margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"457\" data-original-width=\"528\" height=\"553\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-offGHo5sC78/WsSS9jCZrLI/AAAAAAABaK4/fyyyJrxrXms-2CJ3LEJt48iYA8OUwkrSwCLcBGAs/s640/3e423cc7ab86eeee4ed63387c5db611aa94.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gwdzSHVIR0w/WsSTyfiHa5I/AAAAAAABaLE/XEWHDoCgMto_dqvKHJ0x2bj2VEOmsngFwCLcBGAs/s1600/152w2796746_27_our-love-and-hate-relationship-with-bitcoin-miners.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"210\" data-original-width=\"1388\" height=\"96\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gwdzSHVIR0w/WsSTyfiHa5I/AAAAAAABaLE/XEWHDoCgMto_dqvKHJ0x2bj2VEOmsngFwCLcBGAs/s640/152w2796746_27_our-love-and-hate-relationship-with-bitcoin-miners.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Tz2AcZeBf_0/WsSUJdflPSI/AAAAAAABaLI/qZdQtkIMT8YDlwR4Fb0XjIjODZjIGQn-wCLcBGAs/s1600/3a21e1saa30b050b22048b5c8c13f3394e0f0e9ecc5f0864c3406879192cee2231d.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"620\" data-original-width=\"620\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Tz2AcZeBf_0/WsSUJdflPSI/AAAAAAABaLI/qZdQtkIMT8YDlwR4Fb0XjIjODZjIGQn-wCLcBGAs/s400/3a21e1saa30b050b22048b5c8c13f3394e0f0e9ecc5f0864c3406879192cee2231d.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>For any one actor to\nmanipulate the blockchain, they would have to change the data on a majority of\nindividual nodes on the network at any given time, simultaneously. This is\nknown as a 51% attack. Today, the vast majority of blocks are solved by miners\nparticipating pools.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In theory, if a single pool grew large enough (or a few\nlarge pools joined forces) to dominate 51% of the network\u2019s hashrate, that\ngroup would be able to control which new blocks were added to the blockchain. &nbsp;&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The mafia pool could spend their Bitcoin more\nthan once, or \u201cdouble spend.\u201d The mafia pool performing the 51% attack could\ninvalidate previously confirmed blocks by forking before those blocks and\nconverging with a different chain.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>For example, a person could buy a\nLamborghini from a dealership and wait for the transaction to be added to the\nblockchain. Then, they could go back and start mining from the previous\ntransaction. This would create two competing versions of the blockchain- one\nthat includes their transaction and one that doesn\u2019t.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>With their 51% of the\nprocessing power, they can ensure that their preferred version of the\nblockchain is the one that is ultimately perpetuated. At that point, they can\ngo back into the dealership and buy another Lamborghini with the same Bitcoin\nthey used to buy the first one.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6511665511516795482\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_13M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/blockchain-bitcoin-must-be-kicked-out.html?showComment=1522847420268#c6511665511516795482\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 4, 2018 at 6:40 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_13MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">https://www.newsbtc.com/2018/04/04/report-ethereum-becomes-popular-bitcoin-india/</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">A blockchain is essentially a decentralised ledger that maintains transaction records on many computers simultaneously. Once a group or a block of records is entered into the ledger, the block\u2019s information is connected mathematically to other blocks, forming a chain of records..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In this way, blockchain technology produces a dependable ledger without requiring record-keepers to know or trust one another, which eliminates the dangers that come with data being kept in a central location by a single owner</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In short, with blockchain, \u201ccryptology replaces third-party intermediaries as the keeper of trust, with all participants running complex algorithms to certify the integrity of the whole</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">IS IT REALLY SO ?</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">IT TAKES A REAL IDIOT NAY A CUNT --TO BELIEVE THAT MINING MAKES A CRYPTO CURRENCY POWERED BLOCKCHAIN DECENTRALIZED..</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Bitcoin and Ethereum are open blockchain systems, meaning that in principle anyone can be a miner</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">But organizations have formed to MAFIA pool mining resources. The top four Bitcoin-mining operations has more than 55 percent of the system\u2019s average mining capacity, measured on a weekly basis</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Mining for Ethereum was even more consolidated: three top MAFIA pool miners accounted for 63 percent of the system\u2019s average weekly capacity.</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">58 percent of Bitcoin\u2019s \u201cnodes,\u201d the computers around the world running its software (not all of them engage in mining), are located in data centers, versus 31 percent for Ethereum.</span><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"></span></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Unless you are a CUNT --this reveals that Bitcoin is KOSHER corporatized</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Hundreds of cryptocurrencies now exist, and many of them work differently from Bitcoin and Ethereum. Not all of them rely on miners or even use a blockchain.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">There\u2019s no perfect way to measure the decentralization of a cryptocurrency network, which is a complicated social as well as technical phenomenon.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The way coins are distributed in a network can matter hugely, for example. In the case of Ripple, a privately owned company oversees the distribution of coins and still holds more than half of all in existence.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Part of the vision sold by the technology\u2019s biggest promoters is that it can help solve problems of financial inequality created in part by traditional, centralized institutions.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">If digital currency allows wealth and power to pool in the hands of a few JEWS , that aint not so revolutionary.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Both Bitcoin and Ethereum mining are very centralized, with the top four MAFIA miners in Bitcoin and the top three MAFIA miners in Ethereum controlling FAR FAR more than 51% of the hash rate.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Fairness is an important metric: it determines whether a small miner is at a greater disadvantage compared to a larger miner.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">If a system is perfectly fair, there would be fewer reasons for miners to pool their resources into larger, cooperating MAFIA pools that operate in brute unison.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">BRAAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY !</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/niti-aayog-to-recommend-use-of-blockchain-in-land-records-pds-healthcare/story-JNB2hJZMu6E0kSrsuvdN1K.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">THE CUNTS IN NITI AYOG DO NOT KNOW THAT THE ONLY PROVEN USE OF BLOCKCHAIN IN ITS 9 YEARS OF EXISTENCE---- IS REGULARIZING GRABBED LAND OF CRIMINAL JEWS IN ISRAEL AND GEORGIA</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">..</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A distributed ledger\ntechnology (DLT) is a system where we share information and we don\u2019t trust each\nother individually, but we trust the group as a whole.&nbsp;&nbsp; DLTs allow us to come up with a consensus on\nthe order of transactions and timestamps.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph is a\nDLT.&nbsp;&nbsp; However, hashgraph is not a\nblockchain in the sense that it\u2019s not built on a chain of blocks.&nbsp; Hashgraph would be best characterized as a\nDAG\u200a\u2014\u200aDirected Acyclic Graph.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other DLT solutions\nmight be secure, but they\u2019re not particularly fast or fair.&nbsp; The following use-cases require fairness and\nspeed:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matching buyers and\nsellers on a stock market<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dark Pools<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Online Video Games<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Auctions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instances where it\nmatters who filed first<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Domain Names<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph fixes many of\nthe failings that previous DLTs have faced: Hashgraph is incredibly fast,\nsecure, and fair. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph has a\nincredibly high throughput compared to other DLTs. It is able to achieve\nhundreds of thousands of transactions per second, even with only one shard.\nFurthermore, hashgraph has small latency\u200a\u2014\u200ait takes only a few seconds for the\ntransaction to be sent out.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph achieves this\nspeed through what\u2019s called the \u201cgossip protocol\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The consensus algorithm\nof hashgraph is asynchronous byzantine fault tolerant (asynchronous BFT).&nbsp;&nbsp; What this means is that if there are any two\ngiven transactions in a network, we as a community can come to an agreement as\nto what order those transactions came in. It also assumes that no more than \u2153\nof people in the system are attempting to corrupt the system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asynchronous BFT is the\nstrongest form of byzantine fault tolerance. With it, there is a moment when\nyou know with 100% certainty that you have consensus. It uses a mathematical\nproof so that you can never be wrong about when you achieved consensus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asynchronous BFT allows for a network to survive malicious nodes, firewalls,\nand DDOS attacks. Asynchronous byzantine consensus algorithms are nothing new:\nthey existed three decades ago. The problem with them, at the time, is that\nthose algorithms were so slow you\u2019d never use them. As stated above, hashgraph\nwas able to solve the issue of speed through the gossip protocol.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let\u2019s contrast\nasynchronous BFT with some other consensus algorithms, such as distributed\nProof of Stake where we take turns being leaders. The issue with that is the\nfollowing: If the attacker can shut down one computer at a time, then they can\nshut down your entire network because all they need to do is shutdown the\nleader of the system. When a new computer becomes the leader, all that\nattackers need to do is to keep following the new leader and attacking them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph also provides\nfair ordering and fair timestamps. Let\u2019s focus first on why fair ordering is\nimportant, using the stock market as an example. If I put in a bid for a share\nof X, and then you put in a bid for a share of X a second later, my bid should\nhave priority over yours.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But if for some reason the network were to mess up,\nand your bid was prioritized over mine, that would be VERY bad. Ordering of\ntransactions for stock markets is very important: Wall Street High Frequency\nTrading firms spend millions to shave a few milliseconds off the time it takes\nto put their bids in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fair timestamps are\nimportant as well, because it allows you to trust that the community as a whole\ntimestamped something, and not just one miner. Let\u2019s say there\u2019s a payment\ndispute, and somebody claims you didn\u2019t pay them on time. But you actually paid\nthem before the deadline. Hashgraph solves this issue, as it uses cryptographic\nproof you can take to court. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Most important--&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Hashgraph does NOT have a cryptocurrency.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondly, it does not have a public ledger. Instead, Hashgraph is a\npermissioned ledger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a public ledger,\nanybody can be a node in the network. Take Bitcoin, for example, the biggest\npublic ledger in terms of market cap. Anybody can use Bitcoin\u2019s cryptographic\nkeys, anybody can join the network, and anybody can become a miner to be\nrewarded in helping the network function.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anybody can see transactions on the\nnetwork, and anybody can write a new block on the Bitcoin chain (as long as\nthey follow the parameters of what constitutes a valid Bitcoin block).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A permissioned ledger,\non the other hand, requires permission (hence the name) to perform certain\nactivities on or to the network. Permissioned ledgers can limit the people and\ngroups who are able to transact on the blockchain, and limit the people and\ngroups who can write new blocks onto the chain.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Owners of the permissioned ledger\ncan determine who can be transaction validators on the network. In essence, a\npermissioned ledger requires that you have permission to run a full node.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Permissioned ledgers\nare INCREDIBLY useful for industries where you care about keeping secrets. The\nfinancial industry is a great example of such an industry.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dark pools (also\nknown as black pools), private forums for trading securities and derivatives,\nwould be one portion of the financial industry where permissioned would be\nwanted instead of public ledgers\u200a\u2014\u200ayou would want every node of a dark pool to\nbe permissioned and communication between nodes to be encrypted.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swirlds aims to allow\npeople to do all of this for free. This would remove the need for advertisers,\nbecause if a server is free to run then there is no need to run advertisements\nfor nonexistent server costs. This has huge implications on the advertising\nindustry; it would remove the industry based on spying on people\u2019s behaviors\nfor advertisements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This new hashgraph&nbsp; consensus algorithm also has a peer-to-peer\narchitecture, but it rectifies the genetic flaws of its older sibling\nblockchain, such as latency, energy wastage, expense, and proof-of-work. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph offers\n\u201cconsensus time-stamping\u201d while retaining the functionality of blockchain,\nmaking it a more reliable algorithm that can process upwards of 2,50,000\ntransactions per second. This is in stark contrast to blockchain, which is\nlimited to around three to seven transactions per second.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike blockchain,\nwhich is a data structure organised into a series of interconnected blocks,\nhashgraph comprises of a chain of events. A block consists of a timestamp, the\ntransactions pertaining to it, the hash of the block, and its predecessor.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In hashgraphs, data is\norganised into events, with each instance containing the transactions\nassociated with its timestamp, and the hash of both the parent events that\ncreated it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph uses a\nconsensus protocol that uses gossip history to create a directed graph.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Consensus does not\nrequire polling since each member node has a copy of the hashgraph. The order\nof the messages can be determined from the timestamp, enabling consensus.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a blockchain, if two\nminers create two contesting blocks, the proof-of-work is scrutinised and one\nblock is discarded. This can be compared to a tree whose branches are pruned\nand only the trunk advances upwards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fairness - In\nblockchain, the order of transactions is dependent on the order in which miners\nprocess information and add to the block. It is vulnerable to forking and delay\ndepending on the whims of MAFIA miners who can manipulate the order in which\ntransactions are added to the block. However, since hashgraph is based on\nconsensus, it is faster and the ordering of transactions is chronological\ndepending on the timestamp.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speed - Hashgraphs are\nlimited only by bandwidth. All member nodes are connected to the network and\nthe distributed ledger is updated simultaneously. If the member with the\nslowest broadband connection can download information regarding 5,000 transactions\nper second, the system can process and validate transactions at that speed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Provable - Once an\nevent occurs, it is known to all members since it propagates through the\nnetwork. Events created by other members can incorporate the effects of\nneighbouring events\u2019 gossip regarding the order of transactions before\naccepting or repudiating it while moving to the next round.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the graph\nprogresses, only the outermost events hold transaction information, freeing up\nspace from earlier events. It is estimated that the amount of storage required\nto maintain live ledgers for hashgraph would use less than a gigabyte (GB) of\nspace, as compared to the 60GB required for running the blockchain software.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Byzantine - This term\nmeans that no single member can hold up the community from reaching a\nconsensus. It also prohibits consensus from being disturbed. The biggest\nadvantage that hashgraph has over blockchain is that it guarantees Byzantine\nagreement.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The blockchain architecture is organised in such a way that miners\nare pigeonholed into boxes, and the advancement of the block is dependent on\nthe computing power of participating nodes. In such a scenario, miners can\nexploit their hardware superiority to guide or stall the progress of the block.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-permissioned - Both\nblockchain and hashgraph are open source, but only blockchain is open system. A\nnon-permissioned system is one where only trusted members can participate.\nHashgraph avoids the time and computing power required for proof-of-work by\nensuring that only trusted members are allowed into the network.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While it is\nresistant to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks and other divergent behaviour on\nthe part of participating members, hashgraph sacrifices on the openness front.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gossip about Gossip:\nincludes attaching some additional information to a pair of hashes containing\nthe last two people talked to. Through this, a Hashgraph can be built and\nupdated every time some additional information gossips on each node.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virtual Voting: once a\nHashgraph is ready, all members are aware of the information each node has and\nexactly when they were made aware of it. This makes it easy, and pretty\nstraightforward, to know how a node would vote. This data can be used as an\ninput to the voting algorithm and filter the transactions that have reached\nquick consensus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gossip is when one\ncomputer randomly tells two computers about a transaction it makes. Those two\ncomputers then tell four other computers (i.e. they gossip about the gossip)\nand this continues till all the computers in the network are made aware of a\ntransaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Hashgraph has been built on asynchronous\nByzantine Fault Tolerance (aBFT) which means it is at the highest level of\nsecurity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verifiable:\nTransactions in Hashgraph can be verified since the transaction consensus takes\nonly a couple of minutes to reach the entire network.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ACID Compliance: Each\nlocal database of the Hashgraph platform is Atomic, Consistent, Isolated, and\nDurable. And therefore the whole community has a distributed but single\ndatabase with similar properties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cheap and Efficient: No\nblock is ever discarded in Hashgraph which makes it efficient. And since no\nproof of work/stake is required, the platform is cheap.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Timestamped: Every\ntransaction is time-stamped and digitally signed by the creator, therefore,\nmaking it authentic and safe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A blockchain is like a\ntree that is continuously pruned as it grows\u2014this pruning is necessary to keep\nthe branches from growing out of control. In Hashgraph, rather than pruning new\ngrowth, it is woven back into the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both the platforms\nallow any and every member to create a transaction which is eventually put into\na container and spreads throughout the community. In blockchain, these\ncontainers are anticipated to form a single, long chain. If two blocks are\ncreated by two different miners simultaneously, the community will choose one\nand discard the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hashgraph, however,\nevery container is utilised and not even a single one is discarded. All\nbranches continue to exist and eventually grow back into the single whole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph works without\nany requirement of PoW and can potentially deliver a cost-efficient,\nhigh-performance level without a single point of failure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph also allows a\nfairer system of operations as it allows its miners to choose the order of\ntransactions in a block. The transactions can also be delayed or stopped\naltogether. The platform employes time stamping and digital signature to\nprevent anyone from changing the consensus order of transaction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph\nmakes use of Asynchronous Byzantine Fault Tolerance. This is a very secure\nversion of Byzantine fault tolerance (BFT).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph uses two\nunique techniques \u2018Gossip about Gossip\u2019 and \u2018Virtual Voting\u2019 to achieve a fast,\nsecure, and fair consensus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hashgraph is the only\nDLT in use today that represents Asynchronous Byzantine Fault Tolerance.. This\nmeans that no single member (or small group of members) can prevent the\ncommunity from reaching a consensus, nor can they change the consensus once it\nhas been reached. Moreover, each member will eventually reach a point where\nthey know for sure that they have reached consensus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other blockchains use a\nweaker version of Byzantine Fault Tolerance. When a \u2018double spend\u2019 occurs, you\nhave to wait for the network to \u201cbust\u201d it. However, blockchain does not have a\nmathematical guarantee of a Byzantine agreement, leaving you behind with an\n\u2018unconfirmed\u2019 status, and possibly, the money you were paid may disappear as it\nwill remain \u2018unconfirmed\u2019 for ever.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. Hashgraph is fair in\nthat it serializes all transactions with cryptographic timestamping, unlike in\na blockchain where miners determine the order at which transactions are placed\nwithin each block.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hashgraph is basically\na history of how the nodes have talked to one another. This is an unusual\nconcept, but it allows networks to reach consensus very quickly and with strong\nmathematical proofs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_37TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_36B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c272969516451435114\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_36M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/salman-khan-chinkara-poaching-jail-term.html?showComment=1522944082193#c3576304550100347101\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 5, 2018 at 9:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_24MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/banking/finance/banking/india-shuts-down-bitcoins-other-virtual-currencies-prohibits-any-dealing-with-banks/articleshow/63627611.cms</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">WE KNOW WHY THIS ORDER CAME SO LATE</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ALL IN GOOD TIME</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1847344252365979528\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/fake-champaran-satyagraha-of-gandhi.html?showComment=1523461985969#c7431364027667110575\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 11, 2018 at 9:23 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_76MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Bitcoin is NOT decentralized. They\u2019re actually centrally controlled by a MAFIA pool of KOSHER miners, who can basically rewrite history at will.</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"></span></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In 9 years of its existence all that Blockchain has achieved is to regularize grabbed land in Israel and Georgia by white Jews.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">KOSHER miners are the de facto central authority in Bitcoin exchanges. Bitcoin\u2019s main accomplishment is that it allows people to buy and pay for things clandestinely, only in an absurdly inefficient way.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Child porn , drugs , mercenaries and terrorists thrive due to Bitcoin..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2018/04/blockchain-bitcoin-must-be-kicked-out.html</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2507581257904833729\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_84M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_27.html?showComment=1524878987430#c2507581257904833729\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 28, 2018 at 6:59 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_84MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nPump and dump is going on with Bitcoin now.<br />\n<br />\nBitcoin is a colossal pump-and-dump scheme.. \"<br />\n<br />\nPump and dump\" schemes have been around since long before cryptocurrency was invented. What's striking about the crypto markets is that this type of manipulation is done out in the open.<br />\n<br />\nIn a pump-and-dump game, promoters \u201cpump\u201d up the price of a security creating a speculative frenzy, then \u201cdump\u201d some of their holdings at artificially high prices. And some cryptocurrencies are pure frauds. 13% of the money raised for initial coin offerings has been stolen.<br />\n<br />\nThe losers are ill-informed buyers caught up in the spiral of greed. They have black money.. The result is a massive transfer of wealth to internet promoters. And \u201cmassive\u201d is a massive understatement \u2014 1,500 different cryptocurrencies now register over $300 billion of \u201cvalue.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nA bitcoin has no value at all.<br />\n<br />\nPromoters claim cryptocurrency is valuable as (1) a means of payment, (2) a store of value and/or (3) a thing in itself. None of these claims are true.<br />\n<br />\nA currency whose value can swing 10 percent or more in a single day is useless as a means of payment.<br />\n<br />\n. Extreme price volatility also makes bitcoin undesirable as a store of value. And the storehouses \u2014 the cryptocurrency trading exchanges \u2014 are far less reliable and trustworthy than ordinary banks and brokers.<br />\n<br />\nA bitcoin has no intrinsic value. It only has value if people think other people will buy it for a higher price \u2014 the Greater Fool theory.<br />\n<br />\nCryptocurrency is best-suited for one use: Criminal activity.<br />\n<br />\nBecause transactions can be anonymous \u2014 law enforcement cannot easily trace who buys and sells \u2014 its use is dominated by illegal endeavors.<br />\n<br />\nWay too many Initial Coin Offerings are scams \u2014 418 of the 902 ICOs in 2017 have already failed.<br />\n<br />\nHackers are getting into the act. It\u2019s estimated that 90 percent of all remote hacking is now focused on bitcoin theft by commandeering other people\u2019s computers to mine coins.<br />\n<br />\n. Tax law requires that every sale of cryptocurrency be recorded as a capital gain or loss and, of course, most bitcoin sellers fail to do so.<br />\n<br />\nBitcoin transactions are sometimes promoted as instant and nearly free, but they\u2019re often relatively slow and expensive. It takes about an hour for a bitcoin transaction to be confirmed, and the bitcoin system is limited to five transactions per second. MasterCard can process 38,000 per second.<br />\n<br />\nTransferring $100 from one person to another costs about $6 using a cryptocurrency exchange, and well less than $1 using an electronic check.<br />\n<br />\nIf bitcoin were used for a large portion of the world\u2019s commerce (which won\u2019t happen), it would consume a very large portion of the world\u2019s electricity, diverting scarce power from useful purposes.<br />\n<br />\nRemember, if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/blockchain-bitcoin-must-be-kicked-out.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2335822802754126765\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_33M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_17.html?showComment=1523975742102#c2335822802754126765\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 17, 2018 at 8:05 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_33MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/china/silk-road-plan-intended-to-serve-chinas-security-goals-claims-report/articleshow/63802069.cms</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">CHINA IS SITUATED GEOGRAPHICALLY IN THE SHITTIEST PART OF THE PLANET..</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">WHY INDIA IS SITUATED AT THE BEST ( HUB ) PART OF THE PLANET..</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\nIF INDIA HAS A WAR WITH CHINA WE WILL CHOKE OFF THE FUEL SUPPLY TO CHINA....<br />\n<br />\nCHINESE ECONOMY IS SINKING.. A BUBBLE WITHIN A BUBBLE\u2026. CHINA KO ZOR KA L0DA LAGNE WAALAH HAI\u2026<br />\n<br />\nMore than 18 % of China's GDP is housing-related\u2026 The mad men in the Chinese Government has a tendency to rely on infrastructure development to sustain growth in the long term\u2026<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s economy is not just about providing jobs, goods and services. It is about regime survival for a Chinese Communist Party that faces existential risk if they stumble\u2026<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">CHINAs SURVIVAL DEPENDS ON OBOR\u2026.. BUT INDIA KNOWS HOW TO DESTROY VITAL COGS OF THIS ROAD USING OUR MISSILES ..</span></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\nThrough its $1 trillion \u201cOne Belt, One Road\u201d initiative, China is supporting infrastructure projects in strategically located developing countries, often by extending huge loans to their governments\u2026. As a result, countries are becoming ensnared in a debt trap that leaves them vulnerable to China\u2019s influence..<br />\n<br />\nCHINAs DEBT TO GDP RATIO IS A SHOCKING 365 % (total Chinese debt at all levels (household, corporate, bank and government)..<br />\n<br />\nOBOR\u2019s intent to create an infrastructure which would allow physical movement of goods, more specifically EXCESS Chinese goods ( to keep Chinese employed and industries running ) , to large parts of Asia and Europe including Russia<br />\n<br />\nClearly there are no easy answers to China\u2019s debt problem\u2026 The only painless escape would be on a wave of economic growth-- and China thinks their OBOR road will solve it ( DUMPING GOODS ) --<br />\n<br />\nMY LEFT BALL IT WILL TAKE OFF !...<br />\n<br />\nUnder OBOR Initiative, hefty amount of loans will be pumped into the developing countries. This will benefit China and NOT these nations who will receive these Chinese loans\u2026. This is intended to generate demand for the sale of products of Chinese steel mills, cement plants and construction companies, which could help this country to maintain employment at home intact.<br />\n<br />\nChina wants to bring the neighbouring countries within its economic orbit and thereby maintain regional hegemony\u2026 Once a country falls in China\u2019s debt trap, it becomes far difficult to get out of it\u2026. China uses its clout on the aid receiving countries to pressurize them to work in its own interest..<br />\n<br />\nThere has been NO risk assessment on OBOR by MAD commie leaders.CHINA IS ON THE BRINK OF MASSIVE SOCIAL AND POLITICAL UNREST IN THE WEST OF CHINA\u2026 Economically, China needs a powerful recession to get rid of businesses being kept alive by loans<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">INDIA IS THIS PLANETs HEALTHIEST ECONOMY..</span><br />\n<br />\nCHINESE COMMIE RULERS DO NOT HAVE THE SUPPORT OF WESTERN PART AND SOUTHERN PART PEOPLE\u2026 INDIA HAS THE POWER TO BREAK UP CHINA\u2026 IN 7000 BC INDIA RULED THE WHOLE OF UIGHUR TERRITORY AND TIBET\u2026<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_33BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-deep-state-and-shadow-government_13.html?showComment=1528895795928#c1345855554571010929\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">June 13, 2018 at 6:46 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_9MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTether, one of the most-traded cryptocurrencies, shows a pattern of being spent on Bitcoin at pivotal moments, helping to drive the world\u2019s first digital asset to a record price in December.<br />\n<br />\nBitfinex lost banking relationships yet continued to operate.<br />\n<br />\nBitcoin\u2019s had a meteoric rise to a record high of almost $20,000 last 16th December 2017, before it crashed and fell to $6,441 today ( 13th June 2018) which was the level on 31st Oct 2017.<br />\n<br />\nTethers are created by the parent company Tether Ltd., often in large chunks such as 200 million. Almost all new coins then move to Bitfinex.<br />\n<br />\nWhen Bitcoin prices drop soon after the issuance, Tethers at Bitfinex and other exchanges buy Bitcoin \u201cin a coordinated way that drives the price\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nIf there\u2019s fraud or manipulation in a market it can leave tracks in the data.<br />\n<br />\nWhen Bitcoin\u2019s price fell, purchases with Tether tended to increase, helping to reverse the decline. But during times when Bitcoin rose, the reverse did not occur.</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">Tether and Bitfinex share a KOSHER management team, including JEW Jan Ludovicus Van der Velde. They have been busy threatening bloggers.</span></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\nBitfinex CEO JL van der Velde said in an emailed statement: \"Bitfinex nor Tether is, or has ever, engaged in any sort of market or price manipulation. Tether issuances cannot be used to prop up the price of Bitcoin or any other coin/token on Bitfinex.\"<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/blockchain-bitcoin-must-be-kicked-out.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTether is a cryptocurrency that\u2019s meant to be backed one-for-one by the US dollar. The idea is to have the price stability of the dollar combined with the operational ability of a cryptocurrency.<br />\n<br />\nIn theory, Tether holders can sell one USDT back to Tether Limited for $1. Tether Limited doesn\u2019t hold sufficient currency reserves to back all the Tethers in circulation.<br />\n<br />\nIf Tether becomes untethered from the dollar then it will also cause problems for exchanges that use it as a proxy for client funds. This could potentially create liquidity issues and, in a worst-case scenario, force them to seek extra capital.<br />\n<br />\nTether tokens are issued by Tether Limited, a company based in the British Virgin Islands.. Tether\u2019s website says it is incorporated in Hong Kong, with offices in the US.<br />\n<br />\nThe company has many of the same management team as Bitfinex, the Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange that is one of the biggest in the world. Jan Ludovicus van der Velde is CEO of both Bitfinex and Tether, and Philip Potter is chief strategy officer for both businesses<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px;\" />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5946776886586140533\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_136M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/06/the-deep-state-and-shadow-government_23.html?showComment=1529850515057#c2038088184840979922\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">June 24, 2018 at 7:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_60MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nBitmain Technologies Ltd., or Bitmain, is a privately owned company headquartered in Beijing, China. They are a bitcoin miner and designer of ASIC chips. The company also operates Antpool, historically one of the largest bitcoin mining pools.<br />\n<br />\nDespite the steady decline in BTC prices since the start of the year, the network hashrate has moved in the other direction. In fact, BTC mining hash rate has tripled since December 2017, while the price of Bitcoin has dropped to approximately a third of its value within the same period.<br />\n<br />\nWith the drop in prices and the increasing hashrate, it is currently more difficult to mine Bitcoin than it was in December 2017. For smaller mining operations, the price drop is a significant problem that could render them unable to continue the business.<br />\n<br />\nIf they close up shop and new miners don\u2019t enter the market, there is the possibility of Bitmain grabbing control of a much larger share of the hashrate. Since Bitmain manufactures its hardware, it can most likely survive for much longer even in the face of increasing mining difficulty and reducing prices.<br />\n<br />\nBitcoin enthusiasts are now concerned about a possible 51 percent control of the blockchain\u2019s hashrate by Bitmain\u2026 This looks like the real elephant in the room for bitcoin. Once one mining organization gets close to 51% how can that coin be trusted for transactions.<br />\n<br />\n51% attack is the ability of someone controlling a majority of network hash rate to revise transaction history and prevent new transactions from confirming.<br />\n<br />\nA 51% attack is a potential attack on the bitcoin network whereby an organization is somehow able to control the majority of the network mining power (hashrate). Bitcoin is secured by having all miners (computers processing the networks transactions) agree on a shared ledger called the blockchain.<br />\n<br />\nBitcoin nodes look to each other to verify what they're working on is the valid blockchain. If the majority of miners are controlled by a single entity, they would have the power to (at least attempt to) decide which transactions get approved or not.<br />\n<br />\nThis would allow them to prevent other transactions, and allow their own coins to be spent multiple times - a process called double spending. With a 51% attack, the bad actor could reverse transactions and also engage in double-spending.<br />\n<br />\nWhen a miner forms a valid block of transactions, the individual will normally broadcast the block to the rest of the miners on the network, so that other miners can verify its validity, which allows for consensus as to the shared state of the blockchain to be reached. However, a bad actor with more than 50% of a network\u2019s hash rate could begin mining privately.<br />\n<br />\nThey do this by mining from the same mempool, but transactions included in these privately mined blocks are not broadcasted to the rest of the network. This results in a scenario in which the public version of the blockchain is being followed by the rest of the network, but the bad actor is working on his own version of the blockchain and not broadcasting it to the rest of the network.<br />\n<br />\nThey can do this by first spending their bitcoins on the public version of the blockchain, but then not include these transactions on the blockchain that has not been broadcasted. On this private version of the blockchain, the bad actor still possesses those spent bitcoins.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_60BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc;
