text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-F60VziNSJ4o/WsCVdzsSIEI/AAAAAAABaEM/j6G4thBUmy81d2FekgIHfZHYYWYvyT9YQCLcBGAs/s1600/maxresdWefault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"1280\" height=\"225\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-F60VziNSJ4o/WsCVdzsSIEI/AAAAAAABaEM/j6G4thBUmy81d2FekgIHfZHYYWYvyT9YQCLcBGAs/s400/maxresdWefault.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1943986953310697675\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_10M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/down-syndrome-trisomy-21-caused-by-ivf.html?showComment=1522570103535#c1943986953310697675\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 1, 2018 at 1:38 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_10MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTHE ONLY SISTER OF THE 100 KAURAVAS LIVED AND DIED WITHOUT CHILDREN<br />\n<br />\nTHE REST OF THE KAURAVAS PERISHED DURING THE MAHABHARATA WAR 6000 YEARS AGO<br />\n<br />\nDushsala was married off to the king of Sindhu and Sauvira, King Jayadratha.<br />\n<br />\nHe was son of the mighty king Vridhakshatra.<br />\n<br />\nKing Jayadratha had a split personality disorder. One day when he was afflicted , Jayadratha tried to abduct Draupadi. The Pandavas freed Draupadi and wanted to kill Jayadratha. Draupadi requested the Pandavas not to kill Jayadratha as doing so will make their only sister Dushala a widow.<br />\n<br />\nOwing to their love for Dushala, Jayadratha was not killed by the Pandavas.<br />\n<br />\nHowever, they did punish Jayadratha.. Bhima shaved Jayadratha's head leaving him with just five spots of hair on his head, before setting him free<br />\n<br />\nThis was equal to death -- Jayadratha decided to seek vengeance for what had happened to him. Jayadratha got an invite from Duryodhan for a war against Pandavas.<br />\n<br />\nDuring the war when Jayadratha killed Abhimanyu, and Arjun got the news of his sons eath he vowed to kill Jayadratha himself before the next day sunset-or he would commit suicide.<br />\n<br />\nThe Kaurava army was successful in keeping Arjuna away from Jayadratha and sunset was nearing. So Lord Krishna unleashed his Sudarshana Chakra-- a scalar interferometry based spinning discus, which created an severe ENDOTHERMIC inversion in the atmosphere.<br />\n<br />\nThe atmospheric refraction reversed ,and the sun suddenly dipped below the visible horizon causing absolute darkness. At this time there was a mighty cheer among the Kaurava ranks and Jayadratha peered out of his tent.<br />\n<br />\nAs per the rules of Dharma Yuddha it is NOT possible to kill an enemy after sunset. As soon as Krishna saw Jayadratha he commanded Arjuna to behead him with an arrow and immediately restored the atmospheric refraction the usual way.</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The sun suddenly came up above the visible horizon. This was NOT a solar eclipse. And hence a solar eclipse should NOT be used to date the Mahabharata war of 4000 BC.</span></div>\n<br />\nArjuna quickly picked up his Gandiva and shot a Pashupatastra at Jayadratha. Jayadratha's head than flew away very far and landed on lap of his father, Vridhakshatra who was deep in meditation.<br />\n<br />\nVridhakshatra had a boon that whosoever will be responsible for his son's severed head to fall onto the ground will have his head burst into 100 pieces. This way Jayadrata was invincible even in death.<br />\n<br />\nThe old man , horrified at the sight of his son's bloody head in his lap, out of reflex action , recoiled --causing the severed head to touch the ground-- killing Vridhakshatra at the same moment.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IJlnlv9UrLY/WsCUZyYCrwI/AAAAAAABaD8/EJ5ppLs6F2k9k874C8hTH4vstCP7tkcNACLcBGAs/s1600/upside_sdown_rainbow.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"274\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"438\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IJlnlv9UrLY/WsCUZyYCrwI/AAAAAAABaD8/EJ5ppLs6F2k9k874C8hTH4vstCP7tkcNACLcBGAs/s640/upside_sdown_rainbow.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RNXlRXINCkY/WsCTobah42I/AAAAAAABaDs/YZk4mI7eN4ElRcr5fhNfY33oGHyh2TIqgCLcBGAs/s1600/Death_of_Jawyadratha.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1186\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"474\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RNXlRXINCkY/WsCTobah42I/AAAAAAABaDs/YZk4mI7eN4ElRcr5fhNfY33oGHyh2TIqgCLcBGAs/s640/Death_of_Jawyadratha.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5sUoSQlWwe4/WsCT9PfsLMI/AAAAAAABaDw/g-bUCkHp3qM5tiS920rHIo88RtdaUOoqwCLcBGAs/s1600/Jayadratha%2527s_head_faleeels_in_his_father%2527s_lap.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1600\" data-original-width=\"1203\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5sUoSQlWwe4/WsCT9PfsLMI/AAAAAAABaDw/g-bUCkHp3qM5tiS920rHIo88RtdaUOoqwCLcBGAs/s640/Jayadratha%2527s_head_faleeels_in_his_father%2527s_lap.jpg\" width=\"480\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RgPU0VACxyo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RgPU0VACxyo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women are born with the\ntotal number of eggs that they will ever release. This is called the ovarian\nreserve. Every menstrual cycle (or alternate cycles for some women), the woman\nwill release an egg, which sits and waits in the fallopian tube for a sperm to\nfertilise it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If fertilisation happens, and hormones are optimal, the woman will\ngo onto become pregnant. If there is no fertilisation, that cycle ends with\nmenstruation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hormonal balance is\nnecessary to get pregnant, carry to term and have a healthy baby. Hormonal\nimbalance does not happen overnight but slowly over time. Anti Mullerian\nHormone is one of the important hormones for the women.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fertility problems are\noften directly linked to its imbalance. Anti-mullerian hormone (AMH) is a\nprotein made by the cells that surround each egg.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-mullerian hormone\n(AMH) is the substance that is responsible for destroying the mullerian ducts\n(female reproductive organs) in developing male embryos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH levels decline with\nage. A decline in AMH level may be the earliest marker of ovarian aging.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH levels do not vary\nmuch throughout the menstrual cycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike FSH levels (which should be\nmeasured on cycle days 2, 3 or 4), AMH levels can be measured on any day of the\ncycle. It can therefore serve as a unique untimed marker of ovarian reserve!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FSH - follicle-stimulating\nhormone--is produced by the pituitary gland. FSH helps control the menstrual\ncycle and the production of eggs by the ovaries. The amount of FSH varies\nthroughout a woman's menstrual cycle and is highest just before she releases an\negg (ovulates).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amounts of FSH and other hormones (luteinizing hormone,\nestrogen, and progesterone) are measured in both a man and a woman to determine\nwhy the couple can't become pregnant (infertility).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH stops producing as\nfollicles grow and nearly no AMH is produced once a follicle hits 8mm in size<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more eggs a woman\nhas, the higher her AMH level should be<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A simple blood test can\ndetermine a woman\u2019s AMH levels<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the size of the group\nof growing follicles influences the number of remaining primordial follicles\nwhich are believed to reflect a woman\u2019s remaining egg supply (ovarian reserve).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A woman is born with\nall of the eggs she will ever have. Most women have excellent reproductive\npotential until MID &nbsp;30s<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low AMH levels\naccurately predict which women have fewer eggs of lesser quality and therefore\na lower chance of conceiving.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH levels can be drawn\nat any point in the menstrual cycle and results generally do not vary\ncycle-to-cycle AMH is an excellent test for ovarian reserve, which correlates\nwith egg quality/number.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Measurement of follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) on\nthe third day of a period has also been shown to be a good test of ovarian\nreserve. Women with higher AMH levels typically respond better to ovarian\nstimulation during an in vitro fertilization (IVF) cycle. This is because women\nwith a lower AMH level produce a lower number of eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A follicle-stimulating\nhormone (FSH) test may be done to:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Help find the cause of\ninfertility. FSH testing is commonly used to help evaluate a:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Woman's egg supply\n(ovarian reserve).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man's low sperm count.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">AMH levels predict\novarian response in IVF. Higher AMH levels are associated with greater number\n</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">of retrieved eggs. On the other hand, lower AMH levels (<0 .5=\"\" ml=\"\" ng=\"\" o:p=\"\" ovarian=\"\" poor=\"\" predict=\"\" response=\"\"></0></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">AMH levels &gt; 3.5\nng/mL are associated with an increased incidence of ovarian hyperstimulation\nsyndrome.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">AMH levels can therefore be used as a guide when deciding on the dose\nof fertility drugs for ovulation induction. In patients with high AMH levels,\nthe dose should be lowered and the opposite is true for patients with low AMH\nlevels.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">A combination of age, AMH level, FSH level and ultrasound markers such\nas ovarian volume and antral follicle count can be used to assess ovarian\nreserve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Dr Gedis Grudzinskas ,\na fertility specialist declared- We must stop pretending that medical advances\nallow the luxury of delaying starting a family<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Again, women are born\nwith a fixed number of oocytes (eggs) inside their ovaries.&nbsp; As a woman ages, this supply gradually\ndecreases over time, until menopause eventually occurs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">When a female is still\na foetus, for example, her number of eggs peaks at around seven million. This\nfalls to between one to two million at birth, to 500,000 at the start of\npuberty, and 800 at around 51 years old.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Essentially, your\n\u2018ovarian reserve\u2019 is your current egg supply, and it is closely related to your\npotential to reproduce. In general, the more eggs you have left, the better\nyour chances of conception&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">This is why in India parents got their daughters\nmarried up in the age range of 18 to 22.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">So, if you have a low\novarian reserve, it may impact your chances of conceiving<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Diminished ovarian reserve (DOR) refers to a\nreduction in the total number of eggs left in the ovaries such that resistance\nbuilds to ovarian stimulation with fertility drugs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">DOR occurs because of\nan age related \u201cwear and tear\u201d which progressively erodes the woman\u2019s ovarian\negg supply</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It can be hastened in onset by pathologic states such as severe\nendometriosis and/or chronic pelvic inflammatory disease that directly destroy\novarian tissue or compromise blood flow to the ovaries; post-surgical pelvic\nscarring and adhesions that strangulate ovarian blood supply can exact a\nsimilar toll. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Genetic/chromosomal\nfactors can sometimes result in the premature onset of DOR and menopause.\nPresently there is nothing that can be done to slow down or reverse DOR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Advancing age, aside\nfrom being responsible for DOR is inevitably and invariably accompanied by\nprogressively declining egg \u201ccompetency\u201d (quality) which is primarily due a\nprogressive increase in the percentage of eggs that have an irregular number of\nchromosomes (aneuploidy).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Just consider the fact\nthat in women in their early 30\u2019s the incidence of egg aneuploidy is about 50%,\nbut by the time they reach their mid-forties, more than 90% of their eggs will\nbe aneuploid. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Aneuploidy is the\npresence of an abnormal number of chromosomes in a cell, for example a human\ncell having 45 or 47 chromosomes instead of the usual 46. It does not include a\ndifference of one or more complete sets of chromosomes. A cell with the correct\nnumber of chromosomes is called a euploid cell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Aneuploid eggs will,\nupon fertilization, invariably produce embryos that likewise are aneuploid and\nthus \u201cincompetent\u201d (incapable of propagating viable, healthy pregnancies). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">Such aneuploid embryos\neither arrest during cell division, cause early pregnancy loss, or result in\nchromosomal birth defects such as Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">A certain concentration\nof ovarian male hormone (androgens), predominantly testosterone, is absolutely\nessential for adequate follicle growth and egg development to take place.\nComplete absence in production of ovarian testosterone will virtually preclude\nhealthy egg production and result in poor quality embryos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Since advancing age\nadversely impacts both egg quality and ovarian reserve, there is a tendency to\nlump these two variables (DOR and egg quality) together.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">This misses a critical\npoint: while in most cases, the two variables are tied with age, there are many\ninstances where a younger woman has DOR, but because of her relative youth,\nthose eggs will not necessarily suffer inherent quality deficit brought about\nprimarily by age.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, in contrast with an older woman with the same degree of\nDOR, a younger counterpart would be better capable of yielding \u201ccompetent\u201d eggs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">If you\u2019re over 35 or\nstruggling to have a baby, visit your doctor for an ovarian reserve screening. If\nyou do have a decreased ovarian reserve, this can affect the success rate of\nany eventual fertility treatment, and your probability of having a healthy\nbaby.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">There are a few\ndifferent ways your doctor may check your ovarian reserve. These include tests\nfor: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Follicle-stimulating\nhormone (FSH): FSH supports the maturation of your eggs, and is naturally\nreleased by your glands in response to certain hormones in your brain. A\nhigher-than-normal amount of FSH is often linked to a decline in egg quality\nand low egg supply.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Why? Because your brain releases more FSH to try and prompt\nyour ovaries to produce a mature egg.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of FSH\ndoesn\u2019t necessarily mean you won\u2019t conceive. The test is often repeated several\ntimes to analyse the range of FSH levels over several cycles. if your levels\nare consistently high, or fluctuate wildly, this may be a cause for concern. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Estradiol: Your ovary\nreleases estradiol during the development of your ovarian follicles (which are\nwhat eventually release an egg during each cycle). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The level of estradiol\nis usually low between day two to four of your menstrual cycle. Abnormally high\nlevels during this period indicate that your follicles have progressed too far,\ntoo early, which can be caused either by age or as the result of benign ovarian\ncysts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">These types of cysts are usually harmless and often resolve themselves\nafter a few cycles, but they may be what\u2019s interfering with your fertility.\nIt\u2019s worth noting that a high estradiol level may also push a too-high FSH\nlevel into the normal range, so this test may also help your doctor to\ninterpret your FSH test.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-mullerian hormone\n(AMH): This one is fairly straightforward. As the number of follicles decreases\nwith age, the levels of AMH decrease too. AMH also doesn\u2019t change during your\ncycle, so a sample can be taken any time during the month. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Very high levels of AMH\nsuggest a high risk of developing ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (the\npainful swelling of ovaries) during potential IVF treatments. So, it\u2019s\ngenerally a useful test if you\u2019re considering IVF.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Antral follicle count\n(AFC): With this test, your doctor will use an ultrasound machine to view your\novaries and assess the number of follicles during cycle days 2 \u2013 5. The AFC is\nbasically the number of remaining follicles that doctors believe may respond to\nIVF. This is probably the best predictor of IVF outcomes and pregnancy success\nrate.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Since your ovarian\nreserve can vary over time, it\u2019s always worth doing further testing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Women who have a\ndiminished number of eggs in their ovaries, either because they are older or\nfor some other reason such as ovarian surgery, may be more at risk of a\ntrisomic pregnancy than women with an ovarian reserve within the normal,\nfertile range<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\">Below: Let us dance to ANDE KA FUNDA - with PAGALIKA GHOSE who collects Easter eggs on Good Friday&nbsp; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">There is a distinct relation between trisomic\npregnancy and a decreased quantity of eggs available in the ovaries of women\nattending fertility clinics for IVF treatment.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PO4ApbwtjU0/WsC-ewwzDvI/AAAAAAABaE0/TMORy7Vk0RsGIDmPoxmH9w3lUmwi8K7WgCLcBGAs/s1600/iwmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4vzFeiKH1jQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4vzFeiKH1jQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The number of eggs in\nthe ovaries is set at birth and the rate of continuous depletion of the eggs\nthroughout life, is determined by genetic factor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Pregnancy rates in IVF\nare directly dependent upon the quality and number of embryos transferred, and\nthe more eggs a woman grows, the better the embryos to select from and replace&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">This is why women with a good ovarian response have higher pregnancy rates than\nwomen with a poor ovarian response. Impaired ovarian reserve was found NOT to\ncontribute significantly to decreased fertility among young women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Testing for ovarian\nreserve is not the same as testing for ovulation.To date, there is no reliable\ntest available. As a woman gets older the quality of her eggs tends to decline.\nThis is due to increased oxidative stress which is damaging to cells including &nbsp;eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Each month, during a\nwoman\u2019s reproductive cycle, a single follicle is selected out of a group of\npotential follicles, reaches maturity, and ovulates a single egg. Many\nfertility treatments use medications to \u201crescue\u201d other follicles from that\ngroup, so that multiple eggs are released during ovulation as opposed to just a\nsingle egg. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Women patients who have a\npoor response to fertility medications are described as having diminished\novarian reserve<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">First and foremost, egg\nquality is determined by a woman\u2019s chronological age. Peak female fertility\noccurs when a woman is in her twenties and then drops significantly with age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Miscarriage rate rises\nwith age, especially in those women older than age 40, in whom this rate\nexceeds 62 %.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, the age\ncomponent of ovarian reserve is essentially immutable. In other words, unless\nshe uses eggs from an egg donor, a woman cannot change her chronological\nage\u2014and, with increasing age, the number of normal eggs inevitably falls sharply.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Although it is true that the percentage of normal eggs within an ovary is\nspecific to the individual woman, even the most fertile women possess very few\nnormal eggs after age 40.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Older eggs &nbsp;increases the occurrence of chromosomal\nabnormalities, which result in conditions such as Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>THE MOST SUCCESSFUL\nDOCTORS WHO DELIVER BABIES TO HOLLYWOOD SUPERSTARS ARE BASTARDS \u2013WHO USE YOUNG DONOR\nEGGS AND YOUNGER SPERM , CHEATING BOTH THE MOTHER AND THE FATHER . &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">WITH\nDNA TESTS IT IS EASY TO CATCH THE BASTARD AND PUNISH HIM&nbsp;</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">IVF can cause ovarian\nhyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS), which occurs when the fertility drugs cause a\nwoman to make too many poor quality eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Preimplantation genetic\nscreening (PGS) and preimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD) are screening\nprocesses designed to increase the chances of a healthy embryo implantation. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">PGS screens for extra\nor missing copies of chromosomes ( Down Syndrome ) &nbsp;while PGD looks for single-gene defects ( like\nCystic fibrosos ) &nbsp;that may lead to\ngenetic disorders.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">PGS is a recent\ndevelopment in modern medicine which is used to assess the genetic profile of\nthe embryo before it is implanted.. Earlier only 5 chromosomes of the total 23\nchromosomes could be analyzed. But, with PGS all 23 chromosomes can be analyzed\nwhich gives more clarity into the profile of the embryo.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">PGS is presently the\nonly option available to avoid the high risk of a child affected with a genetic\ndisease before conception. It is an appealing way to of preventing a heritable\ngenetic disease.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>PGS is rarely done in\nIndia\u2014we dont have proper facilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Commonsense\n\u2013why do we have so many cases of IVF Down Syndrome cases in India?&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Chakkar kya\nhai bhaiya?<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>THIS IS WHY WE NEED IVF\nDOWN SYNDROME CASE CENSUS IN INDIA..&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>MOST TERMINATIONS AFTER NIPT &nbsp;WILL NEVER BE REPORTED </b></span><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iQkQHNNBvp0/WsDIAQqBVMI/AAAAAAABaFM/NzE6DpelrGMUD7XpPdcyEUW3s61mEsmfgCLcBGAs/s1600/PGS-RTTTbottom-image.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1163\" data-original-width=\"420\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iQkQHNNBvp0/WsDIAQqBVMI/AAAAAAABaFM/NzE6DpelrGMUD7XpPdcyEUW3s61mEsmfgCLcBGAs/s1600/PGS-RTTTbottom-image.jpg\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHEN THE IV DOCTOR HAS COLLECTED MONEY FROM YOU FOR </span><span style=\"color: red;\">PGS</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp; -- TO WEED OUT DOWN SYNDROME&nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">HOW DARE HE DO A&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: red;\">NIPT</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"> LATER AFTER 9 WEEKS AND ASK YOU TO ABORT THE DOWN SYNDROME BABY ? HIS FAILURE RATIO MUST BE STASTICALLY PROFILED</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PGS is one of the steps\nof an in vitro fertilization cycle. After the egg collection happens, the sperm\nand the eggs are fused together to form an embryo. The Pre-Implantation Genetic\nScreening is applied at this stage, where the genetic make-up of the embryo is\nanalysed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using PGS only the best\nand unaffected embryos are transferred into the woman\u2019s uterus. This is a great\nalternative to the currently practiced post conception diagnostic procedures\nwhich could lead to a selective pregnancy termination if there is something\nwrong with the foetus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women of all ages are\nat risk of having chromosomally abnormal embryos \u2014 even women under 30 years of\nage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most couples are not at\nrisk for single-gene disorders. Most individuals are actually carriers of four\nto six different genetic diseases, but their partner is not usually a carrier\nfor the same genetic disease.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And, in the case of most single-gene disorders\nthat PGD is done for, both parents need to be carriers in order for their to be\na risk to the child.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only way to create\nembryos for PGS is through IVF or ICSI treatment.&nbsp; &nbsp;ICSI -\nIntracytoplasmic sperm injection, Iis a medical technique used in assisted\nreproduction.. The recommendation for PGS cycles is to freeze all biopsied\nembryos without transfer until the results of the genetic analysis are known.\nTypically preparation for this can start approximately 6 weeks after egg\ncollection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are several\nresults that can be generated from PGS.----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normal embryo \u2013 shows a\nnormal number of chromosomes and suitable for transfer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abnormal embryo \u2013 shows\nsignificant losses or deletions of chromosomes and not suitable for transfer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Partial deletions \u2013\nshows a small amount of genetic information missing from one or more\nchromosomes but not complete loss of a chromosome.&nbsp; Some of these embryos may be suitable for\ntransfer but may have less chance of pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mosaic \u2013 shows a\nmixture of normal and abnormal cells within those analysed. Some of these\nembryos may be suitable for transfer but may have less chance of pregnancy. See\n\u201cRisks of PGS\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No result \u2013 it was not\npossible to analyse the genetic information sent to the lab. This happens in\napprox. 5% of embryos biopsied.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is an association\nbetween maternal age and the number of embryos produced in a cycle. Cycles\nproducing more embryos from younger couples have an increased chance of having\nat least one normal embryo but this is not guaranteed and may also depend on\nthe reason for PGS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chromosomes in an\nembryo may not be the same in every cell. This is known as chromosomal\nmosaicism. By sampling a larger number of cells in a day 5 embryo this risk\nbecomes reduced in comparison with sampling a single cell in earlier embryos.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;PGS accuracy is approximately 98-99% however ante- natal screening may be\nrecommended in addition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">Below: E 171 used in M&amp;M candy is Titanium Dioxide.&nbsp; &nbsp;No wonder Hilly Billy Yanks are so fuckin' dumb</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
