text-decoration-line: none;\">April 2, 2018 at 8:25 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_47MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/nitrate-water-pollution-chemical.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE AMOUNT OF <span style=\"color: purple;\">PINK ( SAUSAGES/ HAM ETC )</span> IN THIRD WORLD NATIONS IS MORE THAN IN THE WEST<br />\n<br />\nSAME WAY THE AMOUNT OF <span style=\"color: purple;\">WHITE IN PROCESSED FOODS</span> IN THIRD WORLD NATIONS IS MORE THAN IN THE WEST.<br />\n<br />\nTITANIUM DIOXIDE USED FOR WHITENING PROCESSED FOODS REDUCED FERTILITY AND IS USED TO DEPOPULATE<br />\n<br />\nI SHALL PUT A FULL POST ON ITS.<br />\n<br />\nTITANIUM DIOXIDE NOT ONLY WHITENS BUT ALSO MAKES OTHER COLOURS MORE VIBRANT..<br />\n<br />\nAS YOU KNOW CHILDREN ARE ATTRACTED TO SUCH BRIGHT COLOURS IN ICECREAMS , CANDIES , CHEWING GUMS, ETC<br />\n<br />\nTITANIUM DIOXIDE IS NOT SOLUBLE IN WATER AND IT BIO ACCUMULATES IN THE BODY<br />\n<br />\nTitanium dioxide triggers IBS<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/clay-slurries-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWe carry white Kaolin clay slurries n Chemical tankers\u2014we know what Titanium Dixoide is more than the rest of the planet<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_48b+seedGFerD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_48b+seedGFerD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>PREGNANT WOMEN MUST NOT CONSUME TITANIUM DIOXIDE</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>TITANIUM DIOXIDE NANO PARTICLES CROSSES THE PLACENTAL BARRIER&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS AFFECTS THE BRAIN DEVELOPMENT OF THE EMBRYO&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xkl-dQ-GETE/WsGV18bZXLI/AAAAAAABaFs/haGTa_5tdSEq00hhcsnVz8TRMt0lme1OACLcBGAs/s1600/doRwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xkl-dQ-GETE/WsGV18bZXLI/AAAAAAABaFs/haGTa_5tdSEq00hhcsnVz8TRMt0lme1OACLcBGAs/s400/doRwnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pE1xzTHlJkU/WsGXnhIIUUI/AAAAAAABaGM/q8TH4EFlPTUW6jApMM9Z_V_ompmtI0jCgCLcBGAs/s1600/pdwmap.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"435\" data-original-width=\"771\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pE1xzTHlJkU/WsGXnhIIUUI/AAAAAAABaGM/q8TH4EFlPTUW6jApMM9Z_V_ompmtI0jCgCLcBGAs/s1600/pdwmap.png\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women are born with the\ntotal number of eggs that they will ever release. This is called the ovarian\nreserve. Every menstrual cycle (or alternate cycles for some women), the woman\nwill release an egg, which sits and waits in the fallopian tube for a sperm to\nfertilise it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If fertilisation happens, and hormones are optimal, the woman\nwill go onto become pregnant. If there is no fertilisation, that cycle ends\nwith menstruation.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As the woman grows older, so do her eggs. The\nchances of having chromosomal abnormalities and having a child with Trisomies\nsuch as Down\u2019s Syndrome, increases dramatically after the age of 34. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the same time, more\nand more women are putting off having children to pursue their education or\ncareer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">FREEZING EGGS AT A\nYOUNG AGE OF 20 AND THEN IMPLATING IT AT 40 IS A RECIPE FOR DOWN SYNDROME.. AND\nIT IS STEADY INCOME FOR THE EGG BANK</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It's not a\nguarantee that you're going to be able to have children when you come back and\nthaw them out</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Failure to ovulate (release an egg), poor egg\nquality or very few eggs are common reasons for infertility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On average, a woman\nreleases between 400 and 500 eggs over the course of her reproductive life.\nEach month another egg is released, until eventually, no viable eggs remain and\na woman experiences the menopause.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the vast majority\nof women, the supply of eggs nestled away in the ovarian follicles will be\nenough to ensure she does not reach menopause before the age of 45. For some\nwomen however, premature ovarian failure (also called premature menopause)\nmeans that their ovaries lose their ability to ovulate before they should.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whether the menopause\noccurs naturally with age or is associated with an underlying condition, the\nprincipal cause (a lack of viable eggs), remains the same.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is an amazing thing\nthat as a baby girl develops in the womb, she already has every single one of\nthe eggs from which her own future children will be conceived. The number of\neggs originally present in the ovaries is not 400 however, but closer to seven\nmillion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At just half way\nthrough pregnancy, 20 weeks before a baby girl is even born, the number of\nimmature eggs in her ovaries peaks at this staggering figure. Each egg is\nhoused within an ovarian follicle, which provides the environment and hormones\nneeded for the egg to mature later in life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From this point onwards however,\nthe number of follicles begin to decline. By birth, around one or two million\neggs remain in the baby girl\u2019s ovaries, and by puberty, this number has dropped\nto a few hundred thousand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process via which\nfollicles are lost is called atresia. Essentially this means that the follicles\ndegenerate and die over time. The loss of these eggs does not result in a\nmenstrual bleed, because the eggs died inside the ovary and were never released\nto travel into the uterus. Instead, the follicles are broken down by natural\nprocesses and the components are reabsorbed by the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Follicular atresia is\nthe breakdown of the ovarian follicles, which consist of an oocyte surrounded\nby granulosa cells and internal and external theca cells. It occurs continually\nthroughout a woman's life, as she is born with millions of follicles but will\nonly ovulate around 400 times in her lifetime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The degenerative process by\nwhich follicles are eliminated before reaching ovulation is termed atresia. n\natretic follicle is an ovarian follicle that degenerates before coming to\nmaturity. This is a normal process and several of these occur each month in a\nwoman's body.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;If atretic follicles are retrieved in preparation for in vitro\nfertilization (IVF), they cannot be used for fertilization and transfer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Follicles are\n\u2018recruited\u2019 from the resting supply nearly a year before and then undergo about\nthree months of growth and development before ovulation. At the start of each\nmonth, there are around 15-20 follicles which have made it to the final stage\nof this process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under normal\ncircumstances, only one of these 15-20 follicles will become dominant and\nfinally release an egg. By day 8 of the cycle, the follicle that has responded\nto naturally produced follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) the most can be seen\non the ovary using an ultrasound scan. This is the follicle that is likely to\ncontinue development and ovulate as it happened to be exactly the right size at\nthe right time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During IVF treatment,\nFSH injections are given so that levels of the hormone remain higher for\nlonger. This means that multiple follicles are able to mature at the same time\nin preparation for egg collection.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FSH (Follicle stimulating hormone)\ninjectable medications are used to stimulate the development of follicles and\neggs to increase pregnancy success rates. ollicle Stimulating Hormone, which is\nproduced by the pituitary gland. FSH is one of the most important hormones\ninvolved in ovulation, and is responsible for helping your ovaries mature eggs\nevery cycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your FSH level varies throughout your cycle, and as you might\nexpect, is highest just before ovulation. You might expect that this means that\na high FSH level is a positive indication for fertility, but unfortunately, it\nis not. High FSH is a symptom, not a disease or root cause of infertility.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elevated FSH levels are usually a sign that your body is working harder than\nnormal to produce and release an egg: your body will normally produce more FSH\nuntil you ovulate, and if you do not ovulate, it will just continue producing\nFSH indefinitely.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequently, an abnormally high FSH level can indicate that\nyou are suffering from diminished ovarian reserve or at very high numbers over\n40 it may indicate that you have entered menopause. Again, the high FSH level\nis not what is causing infertility, it is a symptom which points to the cause:\nusually diminished ovarian reserve</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Generally when someone talks about \u201creducing\nFSH\u201d what they really mean is \u201cincreasing ovarian function.\u201d Elevated FSH can\nbe a serious issue because IVF treatment works best when used with a high\nquantity of high quality eggs, and high FSH usually indicates a problem with a\npatient\u2019s egg supply&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women with elevated FSH often respond poorly to fertility\nmedications, which often means that the egg retrieval process yields few eggs,\nor poor quality eggs with chromosomal abnormalities which will not produce\nviable embryos.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfortunately, many fertility clinics have FSH cutoff levels\nbeyond which they will not attempt IVF. For a patient who has been dreaming of\nparenthood for years, this can be devastating news. If your FSH tests high\nonce, your doctor may order a second test.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other routine test results such as\nAnti Mullerian Hormone (AMH) levels, ultrasounds, and antral follicle counts\nwill give a more accurate picture of the situation. As always, every woman is\ndifferent, and FSH results should be interpreted individually, considering all\nthe factors of a specific case, rather than sticking to a chart of cutoff\nlevels<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rate at which\nfollicles are lost through atresia cannot be altered by preventing ovulation.\nUsing the contraceptive pill does therefore not mean you will remain fertile\nfor longer. Follicles will continue to be broken down and reabsorbed in the\novary regardless of whether an egg was released during the cycle or not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the age of 34,\nthe quality of the remaining eggs starts to decline and so the rate at which\nfollicles degenerate and die begins to accelerate. Chromosomal abnormalities\nincrease with age because the proteins responsible for quality control are lost\nover time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over the next ten\nyears, less and less follicles are recruited to begin their three months of\ngrowth and development. This means that the likelihood of there being one\nfollicle which can become dominant and ovulate is reduced each month.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the menopause, there\nare around 1000 follicles that remain in the ovaries. Whilst this may sound\nlike a plentiful supply, these follicles are generally unable to respond to FSH\nand therefore cannot ovulate. FSH levels become high at the menopause, because\nother substances which would normally be released to control the hormone are no\nlonger produced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So from a peak of seven\nmillion, we are left with a mere 1000 follicles which are unable to release a\nfertile egg. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maintaining a BMI\nbetween 19 and 25 can not only improve your natural fertility but can also help\nensure you have a healthy pregnancy. Women with a high BMI can find it harder\nto get pregnant and are at greater risk of developing polycystic ovary syndrome\n(PCOS).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cysts in PCOS are in fact small follicles, but these never grow or\nreach full maturity. Equally as damaging to fertility is a very low BMI, which\ncan cause irregular cycles and prevent ovulation altogether.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/fenugreek-womans-best-friend-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/fenugreek-womans-best-friend-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For women receiving\nfertility treatment, a higher BMI means more drugs need to be given and the\neggs produced are often found to be low in number and quality. The egg\ncollection procedure is also more difficult in women with a high BMI, because\nit can be harder to obtain clear images of the ovaries and the follicles using\nultrasound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Furthermore, there\ncould be risks when administering anaesthesia and finally, the incidence of\nmiscarriages and complications in childbirth is higher in women with a raised\nBMI.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regular exercise\nenhances blood flow to the internal organs and also helps maintain a healthy\nBMI. This ensures there is an ideal balance of circulating oestrogen and FSH at\nkey stages of the cycle, providing optimal conditions for successful ovulation\nand fertilisation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>LET US DANCE WITH <span style=\"color: red;\">PAGALIKA GHOSE</span> WHILE COLLECTING EASTER EGGS ON GOOD FRIDAY</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">ONE DAY RAJIV GANDHI FOUND OUT THAT BHASKAR BABY IS A COMMIE --AND KICKED HIM OUT</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: large;\"><b>PAAGALIKA DOES NOT KNOW THAT GODDESS SARASWATI IS A QUASAR BRIGHTER THAN HUNDREDS OF TRILLIONS SUNS&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;
