LEST ACID IS SPLASHED ON THEIR FACES&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">FOR A POOR HINDU&nbsp; ,&nbsp; HIS ONLY HOPE IS HIS GOD</span></b><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hn4RwLC21Tw/WsIG1lG431I/AAAAAAABaIQ/x1RMRj4FazIyPObm3zkBqN1TsKZb_VMeACLcBGAs/s1600/DSCN234284.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1200\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hn4RwLC21Tw/WsIG1lG431I/AAAAAAABaIQ/x1RMRj4FazIyPObm3zkBqN1TsKZb_VMeACLcBGAs/s640/DSCN234284.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">NO DOCTOR &nbsp;ON THIS PLANET DARES TO TELL YOU RISKS OF\nIODISED SALT .. HE WILL BE EX-COMMUNICATED</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/iodized-salt-infertility-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/iodized-salt-infertility-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tests for both FSH and\nanti-mullerian hormone (AMH) which measures the woman\u2019s ovarian reserve and\ngives an indication of the number of eggs left <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reduced ovarian reserve\nis associated with an increased risk of trisomic pregnancy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because infertility is\na complex disorder, treatment involves significant financial, physical,\npsychological and time commitments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fertility tests may\ninclude:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ovulation testing. An\nat-home, over-the-counter ovulation prediction kit detects the surge in\nluteinizing hormone (LH) that occurs before ovulation. A blood test for\nprogesterone \u2014 a hormone produced after ovulation \u2014 can also document that\nyou're ovulating. Other hormone levels, such as prolactin, also may be checked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hysterosalpingography.\nDuring hysterosalpingography, X-ray contrast is injected into your uterus and\nan X-ray is taken to detect abnormalities in the uterine cavity. The test also\ndetermines whether the fluid passes out of the uterus and spills out of your\nfallopian tubes. If abnormalities are found, you'll likely need further\nevaluation. In a few women, the test itself can improve fertility, possibly by\nflushing out and opening the fallopian tubes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ovarian reserve\ntesting. This testing helps determine the quality and quantity of eggs\navailable for ovulation. Women at risk of a depleted egg supply \u2014 including\nwomen older than 35 \u2014 may have this series of blood and imaging tests.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other hormone testing.\nOther hormone tests check levels of ovulatory hormones as well as thyroid and\npituitary hormones that control reproductive processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imaging tests. A pelvic\nultrasound looks for uterine or fallopian tube disease. Sometimes a\nhysterosonography is used to see details inside the uterus that can't be seen\non a regular ultrasound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women taking fertility\ndrugs for 12 or more months without a successful pregnancy are at increased\nrisk of borderline ovarian tumors later in life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Premature ovarian\nfailure \u2014 also known as primary ovarian insufficiency \u2014 is a loss of normal\nfunction of your ovaries before age 40. If your ovaries fail, they don't\nproduce normal amounts of the hormone estrogen or release eggs regularly.\nInfertility is a common result. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Premature ovarian\nfailure is sometimes referred to as premature menopause, but the two conditions\naren't the same. Women with premature ovarian failure can have irregular or\noccasional periods for years and might even become pregnant. Women with\npremature menopause stop having periods and can't become pregnant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Signs and symptoms of\npremature ovarian failure are similar to those of going through menopause and\nare typical of estrogen deficiency. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They include:-----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Irregular or skipped\nperiods (amenorrhea), which might be present for years or develop after a\npregnancy or after stopping birth control pills<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Difficulty conceiving<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hot flashes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Night sweats<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaginal dryness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Irritability or\ndifficulty concentrating<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decreased sexual desire<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In women with normal\novarian function, the pituitary gland releases certain hormones during the\nmenstrual cycle, which causes a small number of egg-containing follicles in the\novaries to begin maturing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usually one or two follicles \u2014 tiny sacs filled with\nfluid \u2014 reach maturity each month.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the follicle\nmatures, it opens, releasing an egg. The egg enters the fallopian tube where a\nsperm cell might fertilize it, resulting in pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Premature ovarian\nfailure results from the loss of eggs (oocytes). This might happen because of:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chromosomal defects.\nCertain genetic disorders are associated with premature ovarian failure. These\ninclude mosaic Turner's syndrome \u2014 in which a woman has only one normal X\nchromosome and an altered second X chromosome \u2014 and fragile X syndrome \u2014 in\nwhich the X chromosomes are fragile and break.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Toxins. Chemotherapy\nand radiation therapy are the most common causes of toxin-induced ovarian\nfailure. These therapies can damage the genetic material in cells. Other toxins\nsuch as cigarette smoke, chemicals, pesticides and viruses might hasten ovarian\nfailure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An immune system\nresponse to ovarian tissue (autoimmune disease). In this rare form, your immune\nsystem produces antibodies against your ovarian tissue, harming the\negg-containing follicles and damaging the egg. What triggers the immune\nresponse is unclear, but exposure to a virus is one possibility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unknown factors. It's\npossible to develop premature ovarian failure, but have no known chromosomal\ndefects, toxin exposure or autoimmune disease. Your doctor might recommend further\ntesting to find the cause, but in most cases, the cause remains unknown\n(idiopathic).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hormones don\u2019t work\nindividually; they work as a complicated interwoven system. When one hormone\nchanges, it affects the production of other hormones. Hormones are chemical\nmessengers produced in one organ that travel through the bloodstream and then\nare used in another organ or system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we age, changes naturally occur in the\nway the body systems are controlled, i.e. transition to puberty, pregnancy,\npostpartum, menopause, etc. Organs can produce fewer hormones over time or\nbecome less sensitive to their controlling hormones. With age, hormones may\nalso be broken down more slowly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As women age and go\nthrough puberty, pregnancy, and menopause, the natural changes in our sex\nhormones (estrogen, progesterone, and testosterone) affect other hormones like\ninsulin\u2014in turn, that disrupts the way our body stores and utilizes calories,\nwhich causes weight gain. The more weight we gain, the worse the system\nfunctions, causing more weight gain. It\u2019s a vicious cycle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Polycystic Ovarian\nSyndrome, commonly referred to as PCOS, is a medical condition in which a woman\nhas an imbalance of her female sex hormones that can cause abnormalities in\nmenstruation, infertility, difficulty losing weight, and distressing clinical\nsymptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PCOS is one of the\nleading causes of infertility and patients are at a high-risk for Type 2\nDiabetes and cardiovascular disease. A diagnosis of PCOS is made when a woman\nmanifests clinical symptoms in conjunction with laboratory tests and a pelvic\nultrasound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hormonal imbalance\nof PCOS can cause the following symptoms:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Irregular menstruation\n(Oligomenorrhea)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Absence of menstruation\n(Amenorrhea)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infertility<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First trimester\nmiscarriages<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Obesity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess weight and\ninability to lose weight<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insulin resistance or\nexcess insulin (hyperinsulinemia)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sugar cravings<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessive hair growth\non face and body (Hirsutism)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scalp hair thinning\n(Male pattern alopecia)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acne<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Darkening of Skin Areas\n(Acanthosis Nigricans)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skin tags<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gray-white breast\ndischarge<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleep apnea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pelvic pain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Psychiatric disturbance\n(depression, anxiety, sleep disorders, etc.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12% of women in India\nwho are childbearing age may suffer from PCOS. Because the symptoms of PCOS\nseem unrelated and there is no specific laboratory test for it, this syndrome\nis confusing, often overlooked, and misdiagnosed by the medical community.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Currently women go to a\nmedical specialist for a specific problem, and sometimes the physician just\nfocuses on their narrow band area of expertise and doesn\u2019t connect the\ndots.&nbsp;&nbsp; For example, a dermatologist will\nNOT refer you to an endocrinologist as a cause of cystic acne, they just kept\ngiving&nbsp; oral antibiotics and topical\ntreatment, when really there was an underlying hormonal cause.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ON TOP OF THAT IN INDIA\nWE HAVE SC/ ST QUOTA AND DONATION PARTY DOCTORS \u2013 WHO ARE USELESS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diagnosing a thyroid\ndisorder is pretty cut and dry: You run blood tests, there\u2019s a physical exam,\nmaybe an ultrasound. If there is a thyroid issue, it can easily be\naddressed.&nbsp; Useless doctors&nbsp; are blaming their poor thyroid glands, when\nit really is other hormones like insulin, estrogen, and testosterone that are\nthe culprits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bisphenol A (BPA) is an\nendocrine disrupter that is found in plastics, the lining of canned foods, and\ncosmetic products. The 'gender bending' chemical BPA, or bisphenol A, has been\nlinked to heart disease, cancer and birth defects<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a link between\nPCOS and BPA:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. High levels of male\nsex hormones (androgens) in PCOS may slow down the bodies ability to get rid of\nBPA, leading to higher BPA levels in woman with PCOS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. BPA can attach\nitself to Sex Hormone Binding Globulin (SHBG), a carrier for male sex hormones\nwhich leads to increased levels of free androgens in the bloodstream causing\nthe disturbing symptoms of PCOS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. BPA disrupts the\nliver\u2019s ability to break down testosterone, further leading to higher\ntestosterone blood levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. BPA may directly\ncause the already malfunctioning ovary to increase its production of androgens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/03/killer-aluminium-leaches-in-your-food.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/03/killer-aluminium-leaches-in-your-food.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a&nbsp; relation between trisomic pregnancy and a\ndecreased quantity of eggs available in the ovaries of women attending\nfertility clinics for IVF treatment. This finding is independent of the women\u2019s\nage. This suggests that the effect of a mother\u2019s age on the risk of trisomy may\nbe explained by the age-related decrease in the numbers of eggs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A history of ovarian\nsurgery increased the risks of trisomic pregnancy more than three-fold; if only\nfour or fewer eggs were retrieved during treatment, this quadrupled the risk of\ntrisomy (conventional IVF aims to retrieve between 8-10 eggs at one time); if there\nwere signs of the menopause at the end of the study period, this increased the\nrisk of a trisomic pregnancy more than five-fold.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women use their 'best'\neggs first in their fertile life and leave their abnormal ones to the last -\nthis is why in India we married off our daughters&nbsp; early<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chance that a\nfertilised, abnormal egg is selected for embryo transfer in IVF is increased in\nwomen with reduced ovarian reserve, simply because there are fewer eggs and\nthus embryos to choose from. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The proportion of normal\nand abnormal embryos may be the same in women with normal and diminished\novarian reserve, but if you only have one or two embryos available (instead of,\nsay, six or eight) the chance that no normal embryo is available is relatively\nhigh.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next to ovarian\nsurgery, other medical interventions, such as chemotherapy or radiotherapy, may\ncause a decrease in ovarian reserve. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;There is a&nbsp;\nrelation between ovarian reserve and trisomy risk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH is a protein\nhormone produced by cells inside the ovarian follicles; the level of AMH in the\nblood can help doctors estimate the number of follicles inside the ovaries. An\nantral follicle count, on the other hand, is performed by a doctor during an\nultrasound. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After visualizing the\novaries, the doctor can count the \u201cactivated\u201d follicles, and use that number to\nestimate a woman\u2019s total ovarian reserve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Older, and generally\nless accurate, methods of measuring ovarian reserve include FSH, estradiol, and\ninhibin testing on the third day of the menstrual period. FSH, or follicle-stimulating\nhormone, is a chemical that helps the ovarian follicle become mature and\nrelease an egg. In contrast to AMH, high FSH levels are associated with a low\novarian reserve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An important factor in\nwhether a woman can get pregnant, stay pregnant, and deliver a healthy baby is\negg quality. Egg quality refers to whether an egg is genetically \u201cnormal\u201d\n(euploid) or abnormal (aneuploid); abnormal eggs will lead to infertility,\nmiscarriage, or genetic disorders such as Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The percentage of\nnormal vs. abnormal eggs is directly related to age; younger women will have\nmostly normal eggs, while older women will have mostly abnormal eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the decline in natural\nfertility with age is actually driven primarily by egg quality.\u201d Regardless of\na woman\u2019s egg count\u2014whether her AMH and FSH levels are low or high\u2014she\u2019ll\nnaturally ovulate one egg per month, \u201cnot more, not less,\u201d.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So the chance of\nnatural pregnancy depends directly and exclusively on \u201cthe chance that this\nmonth\u2019s egg is a healthy one\u201d\u2014not on how many are left in the reserves for the\nfuture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">LET US DANCE -</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WHILE PAGALIKA GHOSE COLLECTS EASTER ANDA ON GOOD FRIDAY</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">By the way</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Monica Bedi was taken in this movie by pressure from Abu Salem, the gangster .&nbsp; But hey, she dances better than Twinkle Khanna who has NO grace</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3q0LNYOaWsY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3q0LNYOaWsY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember,&nbsp; there\u2019s no test for egg quality that can be\ndone in advance. The only tests for euploidy are genetic tests that can be\nperformed on embryos after they\u2019re already fertilized and developed, not on\neggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The importance of egg\nquality explains why ovarian reserve testing alone can\u2019t estimate a woman\u2019s\nchances of getting pregnant in a given month.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even if a 40-year-old\nwoman has lots of eggs left\u2014a high ovarian reserve for her age\u2014if 75% of those\neggs are abnormal (as is typical), she\u2019s going to have a difficult time getting\npregnant.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And vice versa: if a 25-year-old woman has a low ovarian reserve for\nher age according to her test results, she still has a pretty good chance of\ngetting pregnant, because it\u2019s likely that 75% or more of her eggs are\ngenetically normal. This is why doctors , recommend egg freezing before age 35<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But&nbsp; hey frozen eggs have still given Down\nSyndrome to aged women undergoing IVF , the doctors keep this a secret\u2014this is\ntheir golden goose , right ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A sustained high level\nof FSH in the blood or urine, along with a lack of a period, is often used to\nconfirm menopause<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMH testing and antral\nfollicle count can&nbsp; indicate other\npotential reproductive issues, such as polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS),\nwhich, being characterized as a condition in which a woman\u2019s ovaries develop\nmany follicles but don\u2019t actually release an egg, is typically associated with\nabnormally high AMH and specific signs on an ultrasound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The egg freezing\nprocedure and the embryo freezing procedure both start the same basic way: with\nhormone medication, injected over for 8\u201312 days, that stimulates the ovaries to\nproduce multiple eggs. (Multiple eggs is important because not every egg will lead\nto a baby, no matter how young you are.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Freezing multiple eggs increases the\ndoctor\u2019s chances of finding healthy eggs later. Once mature, the eggs are\ncollected from the ovaries and flash frozen with liquid nitrogen, bringing them\nto a temperature so low that all activity within the cell\u2014including\naging\u2014pauses, freezing them in time.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we age, the eggs inside our bodies age\nwith us, and the likelihood that our eggs are healthy gets lower. By freezing\neggs when you\u2019re young, you can preserve their health ( SIC ).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THE BABY FROM THIS FROZEN EGG WILL NEVER BE A\nHERO OR A CHAMPION\u2014NEVER MIND WHAT THE IVF LOBBY SAYS </b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you choose to use\nthese eggs to get pregnant later, they\u2019ll be thawed in a lab and fertilized\nwith sperm to create an embryo (a process known as in vitro fertilization or\nIVF). The difference between freezing eggs vs. freezing embryos can be found in\nthe lab, too. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An embryo is a\nfertilized egg. It must implant in the mother's uterus in order to develop into\na fetus. In IVF, eggs and sperm are combined in a lab to create embryos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During embryo freezing,\nthe eggs are fertilized using IVF before they\u2019re frozen, and develop, over a\nperiod of several days, into embryos, which are then flash frozen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Once again, the health of the embryos, created\nfrom young and healthy eggs, is maintained when they\u2019re frozen at such a low\ntemperature. There was a time, using older slow freeze technology, when embryos\nsurvived the freezing and thawing process better than eggs, because embryos are\nslightly less delicate.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;However, the introduction of vitrification (flash\nfreezing) has largely eliminated this difference. With this state-of-the-art\ntechnique, the survival rates when freezing eggs vs. freezing embryos are very\nsimilar: 90%+ of eggs and about 95% of embryos survive.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When comparing freezing\neggs vs. freezing embryos, it typically requires several eggs to result in one\nembryo, no matter which method you choose. You can freeze many eggs, which may\nbe fertilized later to create a few embryos; or, you can fertilize the eggs\nright after retrieval, and freeze the few embryos that develop. Either way, you\nwill likely have the same number of potential chances at pregnancy.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Freezing embryos does\ngive you more information up front; namely, you\u2019ll know how many eggs were\nhealthy enough to fertilize and begin development. But it also locks you into\nat least one important decision right now: whose sperm will fertilize those\neggs in the first place.&nbsp; when comparing\nfreezing eggs vs. freezing embryos, egg freezing offers more options and\nsimpler choices for many women. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Embryo freezing, which\nrequires sperm to fertilize the egg before freezing, just isn\u2019t all that useful\nfor single women, or lust controlled Chutney Mary women who aren\u2019t sure that\ntheir current partner is the co-parent they\u2019re looking for.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Freezing embryos\nwith donor sperm means that, if you find a partner down the line and want to\nhave biological children with them, you won\u2019t be able to use your frozen\nembryos.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;And freezing embryos with your current Pickle John male partner \u2014even\nif you\u2019re not sure you want to start a family with them\u2014might mean you can\u2019t\nuse those embryos down the line with a new Pickle John partner; or, in fact,\ncould create legal issues with your former partner if one of you want to use or\ndiscard the embryos and the other does not.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you freeze your eggs, you can preserve your fertility\nindependently, giving Chuney Mary women&nbsp;\n\u201creproductive autonomy.\u201d&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Egg freezing offers a\nsimpler path forward for a Chutney Mary who are prone to divorce&nbsp; plus the option for family planning with a\nfuture Pickle John <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NCW will approve .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The upfront cost of egg\nfreezing is less than that of embryo freezing, which requires in vitro\nfertilization before freezing\u2014 paisa bhi vasool.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most IVF hospitals do NOT\ntell women that their freezing system has failedand that their frozen eggs and\nembryos have been damaged <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IVF is used for\npatients whose problem is not infertility. Same sex couples using an egg or\nsperm donor use it, too. In theory, human embryos can remain frozen\nindefinitely as per IVF doctors \u2013 don\u2019t ever believe this. Cold storage is NOT\nfree\u2014it costs a fortune..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.cleveland.com/healthfit/index.ssf/2018/04/la_attorney_gloria_allred_weig.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.cleveland.com/healthfit/index.ssf/2018/04/la_attorney_gloria_allred_weig.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is more to\nfertility than a patient's FSH and AMH levels. Higher FSH, as well as lower AMH\nlevels, are associated with reduced fertility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infertility is\ntypically defined as not being able to get pregnant after one year or longer of\nunprotected sex, according to the US Centers for Disease Control and\nPrevention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 9 % of married\nwomen, 15 to 44, are unable to get pregnant after one year of trying in the\nUnited States<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As of November 4, 2015\ncommercial surrogacy is not legal in India. Those commissioned before 11/4/2015\nare reviewed on case by case situation; however, no new surrogacies will be\nstarted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before 2015, commercial\nsurrogacy was legal in India. India was a desitination for surrogacy-related\nfertility tourism because of the relatively low cost. Including the costs of\nflight tickets, medical procedures, and hotels, it was roughly a third of the\nprice compared with going through the procedure in the UK.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the case of Balaz v. Union of India the\nHonorable Supreme Court of India has given the verdict that the citizenship of\nthe child born through this process will have the citizenship of its surrogate\nmother. Surrogacy was regulated by the Indian Council of Medical Research\nguidelines, 2005.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Commercial surrogacy in\nIndia was legalized in India in 2002. The availability of medical\ninfrastructure and potential surrogates, combined with international demand,\nhas fueled the growth of the industry.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSurrogate mothers receive medical, nutritional and overall health care\nthrough surrogacy agreements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 41,000\nchildren are now being born through surrogates in India every year in an industry\nworth 3 billion USD.&nbsp; More than 65%&nbsp; of these are \"commissioned\" by\noverseas, mainly white western, couples.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the industry is operating\nunchecked.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India's medical research watchdog drafted regulations more than two\nyears ago, yet they still await presentation in parliament, leaving the\nsurrogates and baby factories open to abuse.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Assisted Reproductive\nTechnology Bill, 2013 has a been pending for quite a while and it has not been\npresented in the Indian Parliament..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rajya Sabha Standing Committee tasked\nto study the contours of the controversial Surrogacy Regulation Bill, 2016, has\nagain delayed the submission of its report.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">MODI HAS INTRODUCED\nVISA ON ARRIVAL FOR FERTILITY TOURISM \u2013 HELPING WHITE HOMOSEXUALS . IT STILL\nGOES ON CLANDESTINELY&nbsp; ..</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only childless,\nheterosexual Indian couples who have been married for five years and are living\nin India can now avail of fertility treatment. And if they need to find a\nsurrogate to carry the baby, they have to seek out a relative who will do it out\nof altruism. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With this sweeping ban,\nthe Bill negates the rights of parenthood to HOMOSEXUALS , single sex couples,\nand live-in relationship partners<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">WE HAD ENOUGH OF WHITE\nHOMOSEXUALS ABANDONING THEIR MALFORMED CHILDREN AND DOING THE VANISHING TRICK</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bill seeks to\nprohibit commercial surrogacy, made legal in India in 2002 after the Indian\nCouncil for Medical Research (ICMR) issued guidelines in its favour, and make\nit a cognisable offence punishable with a 10-year jail term along with a fine\nof Rs 10 lakh. The rationale behind this stern provision seems to be that\ncommercial surrogacy is exploitative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Surrogacy (Regulation)\nBill, 2016</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Some of the salient\nfeatures of the proposed Bill are:<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Complete ban on\ncommercial surrogacy, only altruistic surrogacy will be legal. The Act defines\naltruistic surrogacy as: \u201caltruistic surrogacy means the surrogacy in which no\ncharges, expenses, fees, remuneration or monetary incentive of whatever nature,\nexcept the medical expenses incurred on surrogate mother and the insurance\ncoverage for the surrogate mother, are given to the surrogate mother or her\ndependents or her representative.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Only \u201cinfertile\ncouples\u201d married for at least five years can opt for having a child through a\nsurrogate mother, the couple must be Indian citizens and should not have any\nchild\u2014biological or adopted\u2014at the time of applying for surrogacy.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Only a close relative\nof the couple can act as a surrogate.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The surrogate mother\nmust have an eligibility certificate issued by an appropriate authority, she\nmust be married and have a child of her own and be aged between 25 to 35 years\non the day of implantation.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Setting up of a\nNational Surrogacy Board at the central level along with State Surrogacy Boards\nin states and Union Territories. The National Surrogacy Board will advise the\ncentral government on policy matters relating to surrogacy, review and monitor\nthe implementation of the Act, lay down a code of conduct to be observed by\npersons working at surrogacy clinics, set minimum standards of physical\ninfrastructure, laboratory and diagnostic equipment and expert manpower to be\nemployed by the surrogacy clinics, and so on.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Stringent penalties\nprescribed<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Offences and penalties\nunder the Act:<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Commercial surrogacy,\npublicising commercial surrogacy or aiding buying or selling of human embryo or\ngametes will be punishable with imprisonment for a minimum term of 10 years and\nwith fine of up to Rs 10 lakh.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Registered medical\npractitioners, gynaecologists, paediatricians or surrogacy clinic owners who\ncontravene any provision of the Act shall be punishable with imprisonment of up\nto five years and with fine of up to Rs 10 lakh. In case of subsequent or\ncontinuation of the offence, the medical practitioner\u2019s registration can be\nsuspended for a period of five years.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>An intending couple who\nseeks the aid of any surrogacy clinic or registered medical practitioner for\ncommercial surrogacy shall be punishable with imprisonment of five years and\nwith a fine of Rs 5 lakh for the first offence; for subsequent offence the\nimprisonment may extend to 10 years and fine to Rs 10 lakh.</i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Every offence under the\nAct shall be cognisable, non-bailable and non-compoundable.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<i><br /></i>\n<i><br /></i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">Capt.
