, &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">If you have a child with Down Syndrome , &nbsp;lifelong deep unhappiness for both mother and\nbaby is 100% assured.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>The home becomes an unhappy place for the rest of the family</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">There will be too much medical / hospital expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">It is just NOT worth the\nrisk.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Drugs\nused in IVF for older women increase their risk of having a baby with Down's\nsyndrome\u2014 this is a deeply guarded secret of the IVF money spinning industry.&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Nobody other than Capt Ajit Vadakayil will\ntell you this.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Drugs\nused to kick-start ovaries for IVF in older women disturb the genetic material\nof the eggs.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Fertility drugs work by\nincreasing the levels of certain hormones in your body, helping to mature and\nrelease one or more eggs each month (ovulation).</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IVF process involves removing an egg from a woman\u2019s ovaries and\nfertilising them using sperm in a laboratory.&nbsp;\nThe fertilised egg, also known as an embryo, is transferred back into a\nwoman\u2019s womb to grow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As a\nwoman\u2019s eggs age, there is a higher risk of the chromosomes dividing\nincorrectly. Therefore the risk of Down syndrome increases with a woman\u2019s age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There\nis no evidence of a man with Down syndrome ever fathering a child. The blood lineage\nends there .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Down\nsyndrome is not an illness or disease to be prevented but instead, an\nunexplained error in replicating DNA, genes, and chromosomes at the earliest\nstages of embryo development.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There\nis a 100% relationship between the age of the mother and the risk of having a\nchild with Down syndrome.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In every cell in the\nhuman body there is a nucleus, where genetic material is stored in genes. Genes\ncarry the codes responsible for all of our inherited traits and are grouped\nalong rod-like structures called chromosomes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Typically, the nucleus of each cell\ncontains 23 pairs of chromosomes, half of which are inherited from each parent.\nDown syndrome occurs when an individual has a full or partial extra copy of\nchromosome 21.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YfNEh2d5_TY/WrwtXqRqVhI/AAAAAAABZ9I/k3XIQXIEkkAR0FYtReILkaG4zD0rMp2-wCLcBGAs/s1600/Wimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"189\" data-original-width=\"267\" height=\"283\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YfNEh2d5_TY/WrwtXqRqVhI/AAAAAAABZ9I/k3XIQXIEkkAR0FYtReILkaG4zD0rMp2-wCLcBGAs/s400/Wimages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common form of\nDown syndrome is known as trisomy 21, a condition where individuals have 47\nchromosomes in each cell instead of 46. &nbsp;&nbsp;Trisomy 21 is caused by an error in cell\ndivision called nondisjunction. This leaves a sperm or egg cell with an extra\ncopy of chromosome 21 before or at conception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down syndrome is\nusually caused by an error in cell division called \u201cnondisjunction.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nondisjunction results in an embryo with three copies of chromosome 21 instead\nof the usual two. Prior to or at\nconception, a pair of 21st chromosomes in either the sperm or the egg fails to\nseparate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aneuploidy is the\npresence of an abnormal number of chromosomes in a cell, for example a human\ncell having 45 or 47 chromosomes instead of the usual 46. It does not include a\ndifference of one or more complete sets of chromosomes. A cell with the correct\nnumber of chromosomes is called a euploid cell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most cases Down\nSyndrome is caused by a random error in cell division that happens during\nformation of the mother\u2019s egg or father\u2019s sperm. Because of this error, when\nfertilization does take place, the embryo has an additional third chromosome 21\nor \u201ctrisomy 21.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every cell of our\nbodies contains 21 pairs of chromosomes. One chromosome from each pair must\ncome from our father and one chromosome must be from our mother. These\nchromosomes carry thousands of genes in DNA which contain all our genetic\ninformation</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down syndrome occurs\nwhen an individual has an imbalance of this genetic material because of the\npresence of an extra chromosome in the number 21 pair. This imbalance occurs at\nthe time of conception, when the egg is fertilised by the sperm to form the\nembryo.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The extra chromosome 21 comes\neither from the egg or the sperm so that the embryo formed has now 3 copies of\nChromosome 21 instead of two. Hence the other name for Down syndrome is Trisomy\n21.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vast majority of\ncases (about 90%) of Down syndrome are due to a problem with the egg. A small\npercentage of all eggs (and sperm) have abnormal chromosome arrangements.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a\nwoman ages, the proportion of eggs with abnormal chromosomes (compared to\nnormal eggs) increases, so the risk of Down syndrome increases with age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normal cells contain 46\nchromosomes arranged in 22 pairs plus the sex chromosomes X and Y. Sometimes,\nerrors occur in the egg or sperm that result in an extra or missing chromosome\nin the embryo. Having an extra chromosome is known as trisomy.. Having a\nmissing chromosome is termed monosomy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down\u2019s syndrome occurs\nwhen the embryo receives three copies of chromosome 21 from the male partner\nand one copy from the female partner<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0MfIm-jvR1k/WrwvWn7M9iI/AAAAAAABZ9U/D04W_PQacakzKfR2J2HZsuBiDIfOiZzQwCLcBGAs/s1600/chroWmosomes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"300\" data-original-width=\"420\" height=\"456\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0MfIm-jvR1k/WrwvWn7M9iI/AAAAAAABZ9U/D04W_PQacakzKfR2J2HZsuBiDIfOiZzQwCLcBGAs/s640/chroWmosomes.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human beings have a\ntotal of forty-six chromosomes. Forty-four of these are called autosomes and\nare present in both sexes. The final pair is called the sex chromosomes (X and\nY).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CV4KLOJ8JU8/WrwviqwDqMI/AAAAAAABZ9Y/cu7odeQ5tpIxnlDa-kiiqoznsd9fVxmmACLcBGAs/s1600/X3download.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"167\" data-original-width=\"301\" height=\"355\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CV4KLOJ8JU8/WrwviqwDqMI/AAAAAAABZ9Y/cu7odeQ5tpIxnlDa-kiiqoznsd9fVxmmACLcBGAs/s640/X3download.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<o:p></o:p><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If an embryo has too\nfew or too many chromosomes, it is not able to survive and make a live birth .\nExceptions do exist, including Down's syndrome (Trisomy 21, which is three\ncopies of the 21st chromosome). &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other\nexceptions are Trisomy 13 and 18 ( 3 copies of chromosome 13 and 18\nrespectively), where despite being live born, these offspring rarely survive\nmore than a few months due to severe birth defects...&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-DZHKLgx9cG8/WrwwYARiJGI/AAAAAAABZ9o/shIZiswdPPMAIlI2zHHvoP37XA2O_xTVgCLcBGAs/s1600/wsdownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-DZHKLgx9cG8/WrwwYARiJGI/AAAAAAABZ9o/shIZiswdPPMAIlI2zHHvoP37XA2O_xTVgCLcBGAs/s400/wsdownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Trisomy 18 or trisomy\n13 simply means the child has three copies of the #18 chromosome (or of the #13\nchromosome) present in each cell of the body, rather than the usual pair.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AuxUH7O6De0/WrwwfLrMWSI/AAAAAAABZ9s/jHxqhy_XW-oEkCmea86iD4QZdG9cTBn2wCLcBGAs/s1600/downlssad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AuxUH7O6De0/WrwwfLrMWSI/AAAAAAABZ9s/jHxqhy_XW-oEkCmea86iD4QZdG9cTBn2wCLcBGAs/s400/downlssad.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/and-winner-is-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/and-winner-is-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL IS THE ONLY PERSON ON THIS PLANET TO CALL&nbsp; \"WORLDs MOST EVIL MAN \"&nbsp; POL POT --&nbsp; &nbsp;A HERO !&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>PEOPLE ARE SICK AND TIRED OF&nbsp; ENDLESS KOSHER LIES.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THEY WANT OUT ..&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THIS IS WHY CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL IS NO 1 ON SOCIAL MEDIA ON THIS PLANET-- HE OCCUPIES THE SPACE FROM NO 1 -- TO -- NO 1000.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/pol-pot-of-khmer-rouge-great-cambodian.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/pol-pot-of-khmer-rouge-great-cambodian.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/formalin-as-fish-preservative-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/formalin-as-fish-preservative-and.html</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/naive-sailor-formaldehyde-fumigation.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/naive-sailor-formaldehyde-fumigation.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humans normally have 46\nchromosomes in each cell, divided into 23 pairs. Two copies of chromosome 21,\none copy inherited from each parent, form one of the pairs.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--3xgQwgibjU/WrwzcoNrYjI/AAAAAAABZ-Q/JVpZxIPriBkW5PcjMvhiCfaqF9XzSUMygCLcBGAs/s1600/iRmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--3xgQwgibjU/WrwzcoNrYjI/AAAAAAABZ-Q/JVpZxIPriBkW5PcjMvhiCfaqF9XzSUMygCLcBGAs/s400/iRmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chromosome 21 is\nthe smallest human chromosome, spanning about 48 million base pairs (the\nbuilding blocks of DNA) and representing 1.5 to 2 percent of the total DNA in\ncells.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chromosome 21 likely contains 200 to 300 genes that provide instructions\nfor making proteins. These proteins perform a variety of different roles in the\nbody.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normally in\nreproduction, the egg cell of the mother and the sperm cell of the father start\nout with the usual number of 46 chromosomes. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cO54h1Hr-2E/WrwyHn9QgYI/AAAAAAABZ-A/SzwAZ4Sql6YFIcU1HvEsj7jtdcfbB66WgCLcBGAs/s1600/d333na-fingerprinting-4-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"479\" data-original-width=\"638\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cO54h1Hr-2E/WrwyHn9QgYI/AAAAAAABZ-A/SzwAZ4Sql6YFIcU1HvEsj7jtdcfbB66WgCLcBGAs/s640/d333na-fingerprinting-4-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The egg and sperm cells both undergo a cell\ndivision in which the 46 chromosomes are divided in half, so that both the egg\nand the sperm cells will have 23 chromosomes each. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a sperm with 23 chromosomes fertilizes an\negg with 23 chromosomes, the baby will have a complete set of 46 chromosomes,\nhalf from the father and half from the mother.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-x_e9x0v2elY/Wrwx13LFU6I/AAAAAAABZ98/VuN-yOXiGj4tUwLEkj2C5Kj0QNQ8zXQ7ACLcBGAs/s1600/13217.fworty-six_chromosomes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"220\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"352\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-x_e9x0v2elY/Wrwx13LFU6I/AAAAAAABZ98/VuN-yOXiGj4tUwLEkj2C5Kj0QNQ8zXQ7ACLcBGAs/s640/13217.fworty-six_chromosomes.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dY7Sj1z4eGo/WrwzocBC5JI/AAAAAAABZ-U/gdzGwqscDrEP_FzUODaYOxceL3KFDDp4QCLcBGAs/s1600/DTimages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"159\" data-original-width=\"317\" height=\"321\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dY7Sj1z4eGo/WrwzocBC5JI/AAAAAAABZ-U/gdzGwqscDrEP_FzUODaYOxceL3KFDDp4QCLcBGAs/s640/DTimages.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes, an error\noccurs when the 46 chromosomes are being divided in half, and an egg or sperm\ncell keeps both copies of the #21 chromosome instead of just one copy. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If this egg or sperm is fertilized, then the\nbaby will have three copies of the #21 chromosome, which is called trisomy 21,\nor Down syndrome.&nbsp; &nbsp;The features of Down syndrome are caused by\nthat extra copy of chromosome #21 being in every cell in the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, (<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> I have to\nexplain lucidly for the LCD</span> ) --Normally, the human body has 23 pairs of\nchromosomes (called autosomes) and two sex chromosomes (allosomes). At\nconception, a new cell is formed that receives one copy of each chromosome from\nthe sperm and one copy from the egg.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The new cell divides and multiplies to\nform an embryo and ultimately a fetus and new human. Each cell contains the\nexact same genetic material as the original 48 chromosomes, carrying the same\ngenes and DNA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In patients with Down\nsyndrome, an error occurs in the coming together of chromosome 21. The extra\ngenetic material is responsible for the developmental abnormalities that occur.\nInstead of 46 chromosomes plus two sex chromosomes, there are 47.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trisomy 21 (also known\nby the karyotype 47,XX,+21 for females and 47,XY,+21 for males)is caused by a\nfailure of the 21st chromosome to separate during egg or sperm development.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result, a sperm or egg cell is produced\nwith an extra copy of chromosome 21; this cell thus has 24 chromosomes.&nbsp; &nbsp;When\ncombined with a normal cell from the other parent, the baby has 47 chromosomes,\nwith three copies of chromosome 21.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 88% of cases of\ntrisomy 21 result from nonseparation of the chromosomes in the mother, 8% from\nnonseparation in the father, and 3% after the egg and sperm have merged.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\nIF THE LOWEST COMMON DENOMINATION IS STILL IN FOG -- BETTER BE IN FUCKIN' FOG<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO\nPASS A LAW THAT ALL WOMEN WHO CONCEIVE AFTER THE AGE OF 32 MUST COMPULSORILY\nUNDERGO DOWN SYNDROME CHECKS . &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In I.V.F., a woman is\ngiven ovulation-induction hormones to produce multiple eggs, which are\nretrieved, fertilized with her partner's sperm and transferred back to her\nuterus. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more embryos transferred,\nthe higher the likelihood of multiples..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;In aged women they put three ( out of nine collected ).-- rest 6 embryos are kept frozen</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OB8yIKTWL9I\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OB8yIKTWL9I</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-E5aTjWfI_qk/Wrw7S2TGdpI/AAAAAAABZ-o/3UK5Sa91VIAshPjM0boJDd0i_0aVOytaQCLcBGAs/s1600/in-vitro-fertilizatiown-ivf-process.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"444\" data-original-width=\"750\" height=\"378\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-E5aTjWfI_qk/Wrw7S2TGdpI/AAAAAAABZ-o/3UK5Sa91VIAshPjM0boJDd0i_0aVOytaQCLcBGAs/s640/in-vitro-fertilizatiown-ivf-process.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\">Below: This stupid female Nadya Suleman had 12 embryos inserted-- and gave birth to 8 babies .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\">God does NOT support this --and hence the babies will be poor quality !</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dG68VfFP6zg/Wrw8NvICK5I/AAAAAAABZ-0/YpNKqe9CwGcCT3OdX0cjgLh-WFcpX7JEQCLcBGAs/s1600/featuesres-IVF-3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"488\" data-original-width=\"700\" height=\"446\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dG68VfFP6zg/Wrw8NvICK5I/AAAAAAABZ-0/YpNKqe9CwGcCT3OdX0cjgLh-WFcpX7JEQCLcBGAs/s640/featuesres-IVF-3.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The parents of the\naffected individual are typically genetically normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down syndrome is a\nlifelong condition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">REMEMBER , IF YOU DOWN SYNDROME CHILD\nHAS A PROBLEM , AND IF YOU DON\u2019T SEEK PROMPT MEDICAL HELP ( </span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">EVEN IF IT CLEANS OUT YOUR BANK BALANCE AND PUTS YOU IN ETERNAL DEBT </span></b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>) YOU GO TO JAIL IN\nPLACES LIKE USA</b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\">HERE IS A CASE OF AN\nINDIAN COUPLE SENTENCED TO LONG TERM &nbsp;JAIL IN AUSTRALIA</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/sep/28/homeopathy-baby-death-couple-jailed\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/sep/28/homeopathy-baby-death-couple-jailed</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Characteristics /&nbsp; Percentage&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mental impairment&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 99%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Abnormal\nteeth&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;  60%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stunted growth&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 90%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Slanted\neyes&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 60%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Umbilical hernia&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 90%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Shortened\nhands&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 60%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increased skin back of\nneck&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 80%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Short neck&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 60%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low muscle tone&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 80%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Obstructive\nsleep apnea&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 60%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narrow roof of mouth&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 76%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Bent\nfifth finger tip&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 57%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flat head&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 75%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Brushfield\nspots in the iris&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 56%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flexible ligaments&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 75%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Single\ntransverse palmar crease&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 53%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Proportionally large\ntongue&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 75%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Protruding tongue&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 47%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abnormal outer ears&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 70%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Congenital\nheart disease&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 40%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flattened nose 68%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strabismus&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ~35%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Separation of first and\nsecond toes&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 68%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Undescended testicles&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 20%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some common physical\nsigns of Down syndrome include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flat face with an\nupward slant to the eyes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Short neck<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abnormally shaped ears\n( floppy in top )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Small head<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deep crease in the palm\nof the hand with relatively short fingers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White spots in the iris\nof the eye<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poor muscle tone, loose\nligaments, excessive flexibility<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Small hands and feet<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are a variety of\nhealth conditions frequently found in those with Down syndrome which include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Congenital heart\ndisease<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hearing problems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intestinal problems,\nsuch as blocked small bowel or esophagus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Celiac disease<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eye problems, such as\ncataracts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thyroid dysfunctions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skeletal problems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dementia \u2013 similar to\nAlzheimer\u2019s<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sgIZTvp9D7E/WrxJpCEaoXI/AAAAAAABZ_U/RqO3XAYG5FoUfyKiPT5rpo7Pp6__V7SvwCLcBGAs/s1600/downV-syndrome-karyotype-face-hand-foot.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"588\" data-original-width=\"500\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sgIZTvp9D7E/WrxJpCEaoXI/AAAAAAABZ_U/RqO3XAYG5FoUfyKiPT5rpo7Pp6__V7SvwCLcBGAs/s640/downV-syndrome-karyotype-face-hand-foot.jpg\" width=\"544\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Better to explain in\nprose--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infectious diseases \u2013\nbecause of abnormalities to their immune systems, children may contract more\ninfectious diseases such as pneumonia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A child with Down\nsyndrome may have eyes that slant upward and small ears that may fold over\nslightly at the top. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The child's mouth may\nbe small, making the tongue appear large. The child's nose also may be small,\nwith a flattened nasal bridge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some babies with Down syndrome have a short\nneck and small hands with short fingers. Rather than having three\n\"creases\" in the palm of the hand, a child with Down syndrome usually\nhas one single crease that goes straight across the palm, and a second crease\nthat curves down by the thumb. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: Check out the furrow between the big toe and the second toe</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YkGgkVfcrlc/WrxJQg6xc_I/AAAAAAABZ_M/e2NEEfdSGpc1LoFn-f5fAV4BfH0bxxMhgCLcBGAs/s1600/DSC_08E15.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1071\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YkGgkVfcrlc/WrxJQg6xc_I/AAAAAAABZ_M/e2NEEfdSGpc1LoFn-f5fAV4BfH0bxxMhgCLcBGAs/s640/DSC_08E15.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The child or adult with\nDown syndrome is often short and has unusual looseness of the joints. Most\nchildren with Down syndrome will have some, but not all, of these features.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About half of babies\nwith Down syndrome have heart defects<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some babies with Down\nsyndrome are born with intestinal malformations that require surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with Down\nsyndrome are at increased risk for visual impairment. Common visual problems\ninclude crossed eyes, near- or farsightedness, and cataracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with Down\nsyndrome may have hearing loss because of fluid in the middle ear, a nerve\ndefect, or both. All children with Down syndrome should have regular vision and\nhearing examinations so any problems can be treated before they hinder development\nof language and other skills.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with Down\nsyndrome are at increased risk for thyroid problems and leukemia. They also\ntend to have many colds, as well as bronchitis and pneumonia. Children with\nDown syndrome should receive regular medical care, including childhood\nimmunizations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The degree of\nintellectual disability that accompanies Down syndrome varies widely. It ranges\nfrom mild to moderate to severe. However, most intellectual disability falls\nwithin the mild to moderate range. There is no way to predict the mental\ndevelopment of a child with Down syndrome based on their physical features.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with Down\nsyndrome can usually do most things that any young child can do, such as\nwalking, talking, dressing, and being toilet trained. However, they generally\ndo these things later than other children<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There may also be a\nwide space between the big toe and second toe, and a deep crease on the sole of\nthe foot where this space is<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down Syndrome have eyes\nthat turn upward (almond-shaped) People with Down Syndrome tend to have smaller\nears that are set lower on the head. Some may have ears whose tops fold over\nslightly<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with Down\nsyndrome tend to have certain physical features in common. For example, they\noften have flat noses and small ears.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their mental abilities\nwill vary, but most have mild to moderate issues with thinking, reasoning, and\nunderstanding. They\u2019ll learn and pick up new skills their whole lives, but may\ntake longer to reach important goals like walking, talking, and developing\nsocial skills.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Common conditions\ninclude heart problems and trouble hearing and seeing.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Congential heart\ndisease may affect up to 50% of patients. Most commonly found are endocardial\ncushion defects (also known as atrial septal defects) and ventricular septal\ndefects. Both are \u201choles\u201d in the walls that connect the upper (atrium) and\nlower (ventricle) chambers of the heart.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/12/asd-atrial-septal-defect-hole-in-heart.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/12/asd-atrial-septal-defect-hole-in-heart.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There can be many\nabnormalities of the gastrointestinal tract, including duodenal atresia\n(failure for the first part of the small intestine to fully develop),\nimperforate anus, and Hirschsprung's disease where the nerves to the anus fail\nto develop appropriately.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gastroesophageal reflux is common and may lead to\naspiration of stomach contents into the lungs leading to recurrent pneumonia.\nCeliac disease is common in Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Common eye problems\ninclude near sightedness, astigmatism, and strabismus (imbalanced eye muscles).\nCataracts can develop in utero and lead to blindness. Glaucoma, which causes\nincreased eye pressure, is also seen. Tear ducts may be blocked leading to\nrecurrent eye infections.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pLHLhvynSQE/WrxJwpZ189I/AAAAAAABZ_Y/wgLPgO-njLUS4HoYkuyXu2aTeUmLs6xJACLcBGAs/s1600/Rsm-cleftlip-cleftpalate-600x300.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"300\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pLHLhvynSQE/WrxJwpZ189I/AAAAAAABZ_Y/wgLPgO-njLUS4HoYkuyXu2aTeUmLs6xJACLcBGAs/s640/Rsm-cleftlip-cleftpalate-600x300.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of the abnormal\nfacial anatomy, recurrent ear infections are common and can lead to deafness.\nAs well, the large tongue and small mouth are potential risk factors for\ndeveloping sleep apnea.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients with Down syndrome are more prone to autoimmune\ndiseases including hypothyroidism, diabetes, and celiac disease. Children are\nmore prone to infections. Patients with Down syndrome have a higher risk to\ndevelop leukemia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is increased risk\nfor cervical spine instability, especially at the atlanto-axial junction, the\njoint that connects the first and second vertebrae in the neck. This can\npotentially be dangerous should there be subluxation or excessive movement that\ncan damage the spinal cord.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down syndrome patients\ntend to age more quickly and are prone to developing Alzheimer's disease, often\nas young as age 40. Those patients who maintain their mental capacity tend to\nhave a longer life span.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A poorer prognosis is found in those patients who\ndevelop dementia, lose their ability to perform daily physical activities, and\nthose who have decreased vision.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A single deep simian crease\nacross the center of the palm <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GhntGHv7xjA/WrxI1zLWG8I/AAAAAAABZ_I/n9mlyETzQE4XE-vUDZHwGyzOMluXO1w_gCLcBGAs/s1600/pSalmar.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"320\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GhntGHv7xjA/WrxI1zLWG8I/AAAAAAABZ_I/n9mlyETzQE4XE-vUDZHwGyzOMluXO1w_gCLcBGAs/s400/pSalmar.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/palmistry-and-simian-lines-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/palmistry-and-simian-lines-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The average IQ of a\nyoung adult with Down syndrome is 50, equivalent to the mental ability of an 8-\nor 9-year-old child, but this can vary widely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In children with Down\nsyndrome, mental illness occurs in nearly 30% with autism occurring in 5\u201310%.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is increased risk\nof epileptic seizures, which occur in 10% of children and up to 50% of adults.\nMany (15%) who live 40 years or longer develop Alzheimer disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hearing and vision\ndisorders occur in more than half of people with Down syndrome. Vision problems\noccur in 50 to 80%.&nbsp; Between 30 and 50%\nhave strabismus, in which the two eyes do not move together Cataracts\n(cloudiness of the lens of the eye) occur in 15%, and may be present at birth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Keratoconus (a thin, cone-shaped cornea) and glaucoma (increased eye pressure)\nare also more common, as are refractive errors requiring glasses or contacts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brushfield spots (small white or grayish/brown spots on the outer part of the\niris) are present in 45 to 85% of individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Ear infections often begin in the first year\nof life and are partly due to poor eustachian tube function. Excessive ear wax\ncan also cause hearing loss due to obstruction of the outer ear canal. Even a\nmild degree of hearing loss can have negative consequences for speech, language\nunderstanding, and academics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rate of congenital\nheart disease in newborns with Down syndrome is around 40%. Of those with heart\ndisease, about 80% have an atrioventricular septal defect or ventricular septal\ndefect with the former being more common. Mitral valve problems become common\nas people age, even in those without heart problems at birth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cancers of the blood\nare 15 times more common in children with Down syndrome.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Problems of the thyroid\ngland occur in 40\u201350% of individuals with Down syndrome. Low thyroid is the\nmost common form, occurring in almost half of all individuals. Type 1 diabetes\nmellitus is&nbsp; more common.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constipation occurs in\nnearly half of people with Down syndrome and may result in changes in behavior.\nSome have imperforate anus.&nbsp; Imperforate anus is a defect that is present from\nbirth (congenital). The opening to the anus is missing or blocked.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have a weakened\nimmune system. The weakened immune system also contributes to increased\nincidence of yeast infections in the mouth (from Candida albicans)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Down syndrome is not a\ncondition that can be cured.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>It is not &nbsp;one that runs in families.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WHEN THE BABY IN THE WOMB IS MALFORMED , GOD\nENSURES MISCARRIAGE<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>BUT IN THE CASE OF IVF INDUCED PREGNANCY THE\nCHILD WITH DOWN SYNDROME IS BORN<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THIS PLANET IS BEING FLOODED WITH DOWN\nSYNDROME BABIES.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>DOCTORS AND EVIL PHARMA ARE LAUGHING ALL THE\nWAY TO THE BANK<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THIS IS WHY NIPT TESTS MUST BE FREE FOR AGED\nWOMEN GOING FOR IVF<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
