font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>There is nothing the medical world can do to\ntake away your child\u2019s Down syndrome&nbsp; --\nthey will have it for life. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Once the\ndoctor puts his hooks on you as a parent of a Down Syndrome child - he will\nbleed you of all your money.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diagnostic tests like\nNIPT are more expensive and have a degree of risk; screening tests are quick\nand easy to do. However, screening tests have a greater chance of being wrong;\nthere are \u201cfalse-positive\u201d (test indicates the baby has the condition when the\nbaby really does not) and \u201cfalse-negatives\u201d (baby has the condition but the\ntest indicates they do not).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5_HgUQQGGcA/Wr1HqG_lK8I/AAAAAAABaBM/qnJWFtrLAqwHr0Q6qEe3PqKPgdwjMHR7QCLcBGAs/s1600/NIPT%252Bvaaersus%252Bclassical%252BDown%252Bsyndrome%252Bscreening.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"960\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5_HgUQQGGcA/Wr1HqG_lK8I/AAAAAAABaBM/qnJWFtrLAqwHr0Q6qEe3PqKPgdwjMHR7QCLcBGAs/s640/NIPT%252Bvaaersus%252Bclassical%252BDown%252Bsyndrome%252Bscreening.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The terms PGD and PGS\nare now being replaced by new terminology in The International Glossary on\nInfertility and Fertility Care. The new name for all tests is Preimplantation\nGenetic Testing (PGT).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of PGT\nis to identify chromosomally normal embryos, so they can be transferred\nincreasing the chance of pregnancy significantly. Preimplantation genetic\ntesting (PGT) involves screening cells from embryos for genetic diseases and\nchromosomal disorders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This testing is performed with in-vitro fertilization\n(IVF) and occurs prior to embryo transfer, before a pregnancy is established.. PGT\nis an extremely useful tool for couples in which one or both of the partners\nare carriers of an inherited genetic disorder.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The results of the PGT procedure\nmay show that all of the embryos are abnormal. In these circumstances, no\nembryos are transferred and the cycle is cancelled.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TfVNoy8rmNs/Wr1JYusRtGI/AAAAAAABaBY/OA5vxzpwKxEotxoIaYr-J09EIhROg--QACLcBGAs/s1600/DTwP4dakbW0AAFQTE.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1050\" data-original-width=\"1050\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TfVNoy8rmNs/Wr1JYusRtGI/AAAAAAABaBY/OA5vxzpwKxEotxoIaYr-J09EIhROg--QACLcBGAs/s640/DTwP4dakbW0AAFQTE.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How does IVF work?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are six main\nstages of IVF:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Firstly the menstrual\ncycle will be suppressed with medication<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You will be given\nfurther medication to encourage your ovaries to produce more eggs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ultrasound scans will\nbe given to check the development of your eggs and medication can be used to\nhelp the maturing process<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eggs will be\ncollected by a needle being inserted into the ovaries via the vagina<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eggs are mixed with\nsperm for a few days so they can be fertilised<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One or two of the\nfertilised embryos will be placed back into the womb. Women need to wait two\nweeks before taking a pregnancy test to see if the process has been successful.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The percentage of women\nwho had IVF and later had a live birth were:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">32 per cent for women\nunder 35<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">26 per cent for women\naged 35-37<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19 per cent for women\naged 38-39<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">0.9 per cent for women\naged over 44<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Freezing\neggs can preserve fertility by making sure healthy, younger eggs are available\nfor IVF treatment when required.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Multinational companies convince Chutney Mary career employees that they can freeze their ages at the age of 30 and have a healthy\nbaby at the age of 40 by IVF \u2013&nbsp; this is wishful thinking.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Examples? the Queen Mother, Queen\nElizabeth II, Prince Charles, and Prince William etc<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most autistic babies\nare left-handed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people who are\nleft-handed draw figures that face to the right.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Left-handers are more\nlikely to be dyslexic and to stutter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ultrasounds show that\nin the womb, babies which suck the left thumb inside the womb ( a sign that\nthey have eaten their twin \u2013 vanishing twin syndrome ) become homosexual left\nhanders and mean adults\u2014prone to become alcoholics, schizophrenic, delinquent,\nand dyslexic. They are also more likely to have Crohn\u2019s disease, ulcerative\ncolitis, or mental disabilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When placed on their\ntummies, right-handed babies tend to turn their heads to the right.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brains of\nleft-handers process emotions differently than those of right-handers and are\nmore susceptible to negative emotions, such as anger<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS TOLD FOR THE\nFIRST TIME ON THIS PLANET.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">MY REVEATIONS NOW JUMP\nTO 50.2%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first trimester\nbegins on the first day of your last period and lasts until the end of week 12\n.&nbsp; A lot happens during these first three\nmonths. The fertilised egg rapidly divides into layers of cells and implants in\nthe wall of your womb where it carries on growing. These layers of cells become\nan embryo, which is what the baby is called at this stage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During this trimester,\nyour baby grows faster than at any other time. By six weeks, a heartbeat can\nusually be heard and by the end of week 12, your baby's bones, muscles and all\nthe organs of the body have formed. At this point, your baby looks like a tiny\nhuman being and is now called a fetus. He or she will even be practising\nswallowing!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The baby\u2019s gender is\ndetermined by the presence, or lack of, a Y chromosome in the mothers blood\nsample.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nuchal translucency\ntest. During this test, an ultrasound is used to measure a specific area on the\nback of your baby's neck. This is known as a nuchal translucency screening\ntest. When abnormalities are present, more fluid than usual tends to collect in\nthis neck tissue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using your age and the results\nof the blood test and the ultrasound, your doctor or genetic counselor can\nestimate your risk of having a baby with Down syndrome.</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pregnant women ( especially younger ones ) should\nnot make decisions about terminating a pregnancy based on a positive screening\nresult alone without obtaining a diagnostic test to confirm or rule out a\ndiagnosis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Genetic screening tests\nand diagnostic tests are not the same things. Genetic screening is measuring a\nlevel of risk for genetic diseases in the fetus.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A screening test called\ncell-free fetal DNA testing is typically done at the 10th week of pregnancy and\nuses DNA from the mother's blood to detect Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some genetic screening\ntests can be done during the second trimester. A pregnancy lasts for about 40\nweeks. The weeks are grouped into three trimesters. The second trimester\nincludes weeks 13 through 27 of a pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of them is called\nthe \"quad screen,\" which measures four specific substances in the\nmother's blood and can identify genetic disorders, such as Down syndrome. The\nquad screen can also help detect neural tube defects, which are birth defects\nof the brain and spinal cord, such as spina bifida. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A second ultrasound,\ntypically done between the 18th and 22nd weeks of pregnancy, may look for\nstructural abnormalities in the developing fetus, such as cleft lip or heart\ndefects, and can also screen for some genetic disorders, such as Down syndrome.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diagnostic tests can\nactually detect many genetic conditions caused by defects in a gene or\nchromosome. They usually can tell prospective parents whether or not their\nfetus has a particular genetic problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a woman advances in\nage, the risk of aneuploidy increases. An aneuploid embryo is unlikely to\nimplant or go to term. PGS begins with IVF treatment to create embryos. Genetic\nanalysis is performed on the embryo development on day 5 (blastocyst biopsy).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The material removed from the embryo is then examined to see if there are any\ngains or losses in the number of chromosomes. This technique offers an earlier\ntest than alternative ante-natal screening tests which are normally offered\nbetween 11-14 weeks of pregnancy.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only way to create\nembryos for PGS is through IVF<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PGD (Pre-implantation\nGenetic Diagnosis) allows us to see if an embryo has a specific disease.&nbsp; PGD is useful when we know exactly what\ndisease we are looking for. It is a truly diagnostic test whereas CCS is a\nscreening tool.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Comprehensive Chromosome Screening (CCS) as an option for\npatients undergoing in vitro fertilization (IVF). CCS is a treatment for women\nthat wish to improve implantation rates, reduce miscarriage rates, and reduce\nthe risk of multiples after IVF.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Comprehensive Chromosome Screening (CCS) is a\ntechnique that allows selection of the healthiest from a group of embryos.&nbsp; After in vitro fertilization, a few cells\nfrom each embryo are sent to the genetics lab and chromosomes are counted. The\nembryos with a normal number of chromosomes are selected from the group for\ntransfer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Embryo selection by\nconventional imaging techniques is not very selective. Abnormal embryos often\nlook just like normal embryos under the microscope.&nbsp; Early cell division is to some extent\nindependent of the number of chromosomes in the embryo, so an embryo with an\nabnormal number of chromosomes can look just like any other.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To compensate, IVF\nprograms may transfer more than one embryo, risking multiple pregnancy. When an\nabnormal embryo results in pregnancy, miscarriage is possible.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CCS refines embryo\nselection, offering a means of choosing the best embryos, the most likely to\nsucceed, out of a group.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maternal serum\nscreening test ( MSS ) is a blood test offered to pregnant women that helps\ndetermine the risk of Down syndrome, Edward syndrome and neural tube defects in\ntheir unborn child.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-UQIoawNU6k0/Wr2L48RFqxI/AAAAAAABaCA/7RUbi-2Tzk4QcYxdwtci_Dt7NDkik4gLwCLcBGAs/s1600/screenWing-for-down-syndrome-40-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The test may be\nperformed at around 10 weeks (combined first trimester screening test) or 14\u201320\nweeks (second trimester maternal serum screening test).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most cases that are\nidentified as \u2018increased risk\u2019, the baby does not have Down syndrome, trisomy\n18 or a neural tube defect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/TOdEbBlhIgU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/TOdEbBlhIgU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Embryos that have too\nfew or too many chromosomes are known as aneuploid. This may be a result of an\ninherited genetic condition, pollutants such as tobacco, or especially by the\nage of one or other of the parents.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Egg age in particular\nis known to be an important factor, and because women are born with all the\neggs they will ever have, it follows that there is a greater risk of aneuploidy\nin women over 35.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aneuploidy does not always result in a miscarriage; it\ndepends on the chromosome and to what extent it is affected. For example, Downs\nSyndrome is caused by an extra chromosome 21.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As of now the mother's\nage at delivery is the only factor found to be linked to the risk of having a\nbaby with Down syndrome by modern science.&nbsp;\nThis is because they have NOT studied what exposure to a chemical like\nFormaldehyde can do to the DNA..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This risk increases\nwith every year, especially after the mother is 35 years old. However, because\nyounger women are more likely to have babies than older women, most babies with\nDown syndrome are born to women younger than 35. This is commonsense.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dWyyFrgt6vE/Wr2P2vkpS9I/AAAAAAABaCM/FDG5155xt54tKt8Gva-AglNpJ5KhRmdmwCLcBGAs/s1600/dowDDDnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"224\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"398\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dWyyFrgt6vE/Wr2P2vkpS9I/AAAAAAABaCM/FDG5155xt54tKt8Gva-AglNpJ5KhRmdmwCLcBGAs/s400/dowDDDnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below:&nbsp; After birth, the\ninitial diagnosis is usually based on the baby\u2019s appearance. If some or all of\nthe characteristic Down syndrome features are present, the health care provider\nwill order a chromosomal karyotype test to be done. font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Unlike \"classic\" Down's syndrome\nwhich is often seen in the babies of older women who conceive naturally, the\npattern of genetic errors leading to Down's in the IVF eggs is different and\nmore complex.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Fertility treatment is to blame, and the IVF industry wont admit\nits . , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>You don\u2019t\nneed to be a hen to evaluate an omelette..&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 16pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once a cell\u2019s DNA is\ndegraded, it can\u2019t be fixed medically or \u201chealed.\u201d In other words, once an egg\nbecomes abnormal, it can\u2019t become normal again\u2014egg quality cannot be improved.\nEgg quality is fairly black-and-white\u2014either an egg is genetically \u201cnormal\u201d\n(euploid) or it\u2019s not (aneuploid), and as women age, a higher and higher\npercentage of their eggs are abnormal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since DNA is like an\ninstruction manual for our cells, any damage to your DNA can prevent that cell\nfrom doing what it\u2019s supposed to do\u2014which, in the case of the egg, is make a\nhealthy baby.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\u2019s no test for egg\nquality. The only way to know if an egg is chromosomally normal is to attempt\nto fertilize it, and, if fertilization is successful, to perform a genetic test\non the embryo. But because damage to our DNA happens naturally and inevitably\nover time, your age can give doctors a fairly accurate picture of what\npercentage of your eggs are normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we talk about a\nwoman\u2019s egg quality, we\u2019re talking about the expected percentage of her total\nnumber of eggs that are normal. For better or worse, this is purely a function\nof age. In stark contrast to the \u201cwide range of normal\u201d we see when it comes to\negg count, the impact of age on egg quality is consistent and universal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nother words: women in their 20s will have mostly normal eggs, though they\nalready have some abnormal ones. And women in their 40s will have mostly\nabnormal eggs\u2014no matter how healthy a lifestyle they maintain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women\u2019s ovaries are\nnaturally programmed to allow just one egg to grow, mature, and be released\n(\u201covulated\u201d) each cycles (usually each month). That one egg represents the one\nchance for pregnancy in that particular menstrual cycle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That egg ovulated may be\neither normal or abnormal. If it\u2019s normal, great\u2014you have a healthy pregnancy.\nBut if it\u2019s not? Abnormal egg cells typically don\u2019t fertilize or implant in the\nuterus, but in the rare case they do, they can result in miscarriage or genetic\ndisorders like Down syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Multinational Zionist\ncompanies tom tom that egg freezing works\u2014 that it allows women to freeze their\nyoung, healthy eggs and preserve their egg quality, so they can be their own\negg donor later on\u2014when they decide to take a break as a career woman. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of course they will pay for all this.. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Egg\nfreezing is a process that involves the hormonal stimulation of the ovaries,\nfollowed by transvaginal retrieval and subsequent freezing and storage of a\nwoman\u2019s viable eggs..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DENTED\nAND PAINTED AGED women who become pregnant at an advanced age are at an\nincreased risk of gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, cesarean delivery and\npreterm delivery of a baby with low birth weight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There\nis increased risk of congenital structural abnormalities\u201d with IVF, and\nincreased risk of cancer and structural cardiac anomalies for these children<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Eggs\ncan\u2019t be tested to see if they\u2019re viable before freezing, because of the\npotential to damage them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\ndrugs used to stimulate the ovaries &nbsp;cause ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Social\negg freezing is inaccessible to women without substantial financial resources,\nand it is misleading to frame social egg freezing as a benefit to all women.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We\ndon\u2019t want the Indian Govt to encourage this freezing thingy for immoral aged\nChutney Marys\u2014sorry, we wont EMPOWER these bitches&nbsp; ( Miss Neha Thomas prototypes )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There\nis no &nbsp;tracking the health risks of women\nwho inject hormones and undergo egg retrieval. Damaging chemicals are used in\nthe freezing process are absorbed by eggs\u2014they are toxic to cell development.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Even\nwith the new flash freezing process, the most comprehensive data available\nreveals a &nbsp;95% failure rate in women aged\n40.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Egg\nfreezing is invasive and it comes with serious short- and long-term physical\nand mental health risks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To\nsecure any eggs you must first submit to a demanding series of rigorously\nscheduled blood tests, hormone injections, and ultrasounds conducted over\nseveral weeks prior to the actual egg retrievals.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">During a typical natural\ncycle, your body will release one egg a month. During the egg freezing process\nyou will inject yourself with a cocktail of powerful hormones\u2014many prescribed\noff-label \u2013 that hyper stimulate your ovaries to produce eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Depending\non your age and reproductive health you may only generate a few eggs or you\nmight produce two dozen. As many as 42% of women who undergo ovarian\nstimulation suffer from a condition known as ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome\n(OHSS), which , can be life threatening.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">after\nnine to 13 days of self-injection, usually twice daily, you will submit to the\nrisks of sedation while a doctor collects the eggs by punching a series of\nholes into your ovaries and applying suction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If you have exceptional egg\nquality and produce six eggs in one cycle, there will probably be one\nreasonable attempt at pregnancy. To increase the odds of sufficient viable eggs\nto fertilize, egg freezing businesses advise at least two cycles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Assuming\nunlimited financial resources or a generous benefit package you may endure\nmultiple cycles. With each round of powerful hormones and punctured ovaries the\nrisk of complications and long term health consequences increase.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Once flash\nfrozen, your eggs are stored indefinitely for an annual fee ranging from which\nof course with be borne by Zionist Multinational company.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fast forward many months or even years into the future. You\nnow attempt to get pregnant with your frozen eggs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hopefully you have\nsufficient savings, or are still employed by Facebook or Apple, because you\nmust now undergo at least one, but probably multiple rounds of invasive and\nlife-altering in vitro fertilization (IVF) procedures.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">You must again inject yourself with hormones, this time to\nprepare your uterus to welcome a potential embryo. You must open your entire\nemotional, social and professional schedule to daily blood tests, ultra sounds,\nvaginal probes and other assorted procedures that experienced women have\nreferred to as&nbsp; mentally draining and traumatic</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If\nyour uterus responds to the hormones, the frozen eggs must then be successfully\nthawed\u2013\u2013-no easy task given low thaw survival rates. An egg\u2019s shell hardens\nwhen frozen in liquid nitrogen so to attempt in vitro fertilization sperm must\nbe injected directly into the egg with a needle to fertilize the egg through a\ntechnique known as ICSI (Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again,\nif all goes well and at least one viable embryo is created in the laboratory,\nit is then transferred into your uterus. As with naturally occurring\nconception, the final outcome is in Mother Nature\u2019s hands\u2013\u2013-and she is clearly\nnot incentive driven. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\">Almost ALL these\nprocedures fail on aged women</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The emotional toll associated with\nfamily-building failure can be crushing. The scientific fascination with the\nlatest protocol and the marketing of fertility procedures as a lifestyle\nenhancer the past few decades has unwittingly led to a disregard for the\nemotional responses of these medical procedures, which creates a different kind\nof health concern \u2013 one involving mental health.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">People\ncoping with fertility failures are MORE distressed than cancer patients. Many\nothers suffer depression and post-traumatic stress disorder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These\nnegatives are conveniently overlooked by those selling services. You will not\nfind failure rates or the harmful impacts highlighted in brochures or on clinic\nwebsites<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fertility\ndoctors are among the highest-paid employees at Western private universities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Today\nservice providers and clinics cavalierly market egg freezing to fertile women\nwithout fully understanding or communicating the risks<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Unlike\nsmartphones or apps that can be recalled or re-engineered should they fail, egg\nfreezing and IVF are high-risk processes with life changing consequences.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;And\nthis science, particularly where egg freezing is concerned, is still in its\ninfancy-YET eclipsed by KOSHER lies..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>INDIAN\nWOMEN ARE BEING USED A GUINEA PIGS \u2014 JP NADDA / MODI YOU ARE PUT ON NOTICE \u2013 <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Dh0210A-VZo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: purple; font-size: large;\">Ovarian\nhyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) is a medical condition that can occur in some\nwomen who take fertility medication to stimulate egg growth</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">FERTILITY DRUGS\nTHEMSELVES ARE THE REASON FOR DOWNs SYNDROME&nbsp; \u2014&nbsp; AND NO DOCTOR OR GENETIC\nRESEARCHER WILL ADMIT THIS <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Ovarian\nhyperstimulation syndrome is particularly associated with injection of a\nhormone called human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) which is used for inducing\nfinal oocyte maturation and/or triggering oocyte release.</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;The risk is further\nincreased by multiple doses of hCG after ovulation and if the procedure results\nin pregnancy.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Symptoms are set into 3\ncategories: mild, moderate, and severe. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Mild symptoms include\nabdominal bloating and feeling of fullness, nausea, diarrhea, and slight weight\ngain. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Moderate symptoms\ninclude excessive weight gain (weight gain of greater than 2 pounds per day),\nincreased abdominal girth, vomiting, diarrhea, darker urine, decreased urine\noutput, excessive thirst, and skin and/or hair feeling dry (in addition to mild\nsymptoms).<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;Severe symptoms are fullness/bloating above\nthe waist, shortness of breath, pleural effusion, urination significantly\ndarker or has ceased, calf and chest pains, marked abdominal bloating or\ndistention, and lower abdominal pains (in addition to mild and moderate\nsymptoms).</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THE BEST PART IS ALL\nDOCTORS WHEN CONFRONTED BY ANGRY&nbsp; RELATIVES OF THE PATIENT ( WHO NEARLY DIED ) WILL SWEAR \u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">THIS IS THE\nFIRST TIE SUCH A THING HAS HAPPENED TO ME.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Use of injectable fertility drugs, such as\nhuman chorionic gonadotropin (HCG), to induce ovulation can cause ovarian\nhyperstimulation syndrome, in which your ovaries become swollen and painful.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>No\ndoctor will admit that this causes Down Syndrome babies.. They will blame it on\nthe mother.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>In normal pregnancy GOD rejects Down Syndrome babies.. they are NOT\nborn at all<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In pregnancy, here exists a definite link\nbetween high levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin and occurrence of Down\u2019s\nsyndrome . No doctor will talk about it as he will be ex-communicated and\nde-frocked.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin\nin a Down\u2019s syndrome pregnancy are more than thrice twice that of an unaffected\npregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">High levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin\nnegative consequences. Very high levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin can\nindicate hyper-proliferation of the placenta (also referred to as hydatidiform\nmoles or molar pregnancies), which can lead to cancer (choriocarcinomas) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin may also be elevated sometimes in\nassociation with some non-pregnancy related cancers (e.g. kidney, breast, lung\nand gastrointestinal tract). In such cases, levels of human chorionic\ngonadotrophin in the blood/urine can serve as a tumour marker.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I HAD TOLD I WILL KEEP AWAY FROM MEDICAL\nMATTERS \u2013WHY AM I WRITING ALL THIS ?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IF I DON\u2019T WHO WILL?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ll3lS2yz5UA/Wr9hGSat4GI/AAAAAAABaCw/R87-K6OIasALSsAjdXuH4ApKb5umL34DACLcBGAs/s1600/doIwnload.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"479\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ll3lS2yz5UA/Wr9hGSat4GI/AAAAAAABaCw/R87-K6OIasALSsAjdXuH4ApKb5umL34DACLcBGAs/s640/doIwnload.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) is a\nmedical condition that can occur in some women who take fertility medication to\nstimulate egg growth, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) hormone is\nsecreted by the placenta in pregnant women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Human chorionic gonadotrophin is a hormone\nproduced by the cells that surround the growing human embryo; these cells will\neventually go on to form the placenta.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Human chorionic gonadotrophin can be\ndetected in the urine from 7-9 days post-fertilisation as the embryo attaches\nand implants in the womb; it forms the basis of most over-the-counter and\nhospital pregnancy tests <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">During the menstrual cycle, when an egg is\nreleased from the ovary at ovulation, the remnants of the ovarian follicle\n(which enclosed the egg) form a new, temporary ovarian gland called the corpus\nluteum, which produces the hormone progesterone.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If, after two weeks, the\novulated egg remains unfertilised, the corpus luteum stops producing\nprogesterone, and breaks down. Through a feedback mechanism, this signals the\npituitary gland to produce follicle stimulating hormone (and to a lesser extent\nluteinising hormone) to initiate the next menstrual cycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, in the\nevent that the ovulated egg is fertilised by sperm and an embryo is conceived,\nit is vital that the corpus luteum continues to produce progesterone until the\nplacenta is established (the placenta then takes over progesterone production).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is important that the corpus luteum keeps producing progesterone because\nloss of progesterone leads to shedding of the womb lining (menstruation), which\nwould prevent an embryo from implanting. Human chorionic gonadotrophin is the\nembryonic hormone that ensures the corpus luteum continues to produce\nprogesterone throughout the first trimester of pregnancy.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As well as maintaining progesterone\nproduction from the ovary, human chorionic gonadotrophin may also play a role\nin making sure the lining of the uterus (endometrium) is ready to receive the\nimplanting embryo. Human chorionic gonadotrophin may help to increase the blood\nsupply to the uterus and be involved in re-shaping the lining of the uterus in\npreparation for the implanting embryo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Human chorionic gonadotrophin is produced by\nthe trophoblast cells which surround the developing embryo at approximately day\nfive of pregnancy. The amount of human chorionic gonadotrophin in the\nbloodstream doubles every 2-3 days as development of the embryo and placenta\ncontinue, and levels peak at around six weeks of pregnancy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Following this\npeak, levels of human chorionic gonadotrophin fall (although they remain\ndetectable throughout pregnancy). Once the placenta is established, it becomes\nthe main source of progesterone production (around week 12 of pregnancy), and\nhuman chorionic gonadotrophin is no longer required to maintain ovarian\nfunction.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oa9I-5r_tRE/Wr9g2hEpwII/AAAAAAABaCs/FjrVmXnIwV4XyJHXKH-fnmt1epf7osowACLcBGAs/s1600/8766b34I228c6e9ebd71a546fd84f8e763f6767ff.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"521\" data-original-width=\"983\" height=\"338\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oa9I-5r_tRE/Wr9g2hEpwII/AAAAAAABaCs/FjrVmXnIwV4XyJHXKH-fnmt1epf7osowACLcBGAs/s640/8766b34I228c6e9ebd71a546fd84f8e763f6767ff.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again, fertility drugs use hormones to\nstimulate your ovaries. These hormones, particularly human gonadotrophin (hCG),\nsometimes overstimulate the ovaries, causing them to develop too many egg sacs\n(follicles). This is OHSS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There are VERY serious complications, such as\nblood clots and kidney problems.&nbsp; IVF\ndoctors pretend this does NOT exist<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>There has been ZERO &nbsp;incidents of people developing OHSS without\ntaking fertility treatment.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Symptoms usually start in the week after egg\ncollection<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If you develop mild OHSS, you may experience:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">tummy swelling or bloating<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">mild pain low down in your tummy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">nausea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If you notice any of these symptoms, contact\nyour fertility clinic for further advice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Severe symptoms require urgent attention.&nbsp; &nbsp;Call your fertility clinic's emergency number or go to your nearest accident\nand emergency department immediately if you:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">are vomiting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">have severe tummy pain or swelling<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">are extremely thirsty<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">are passing small amounts of dark urine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">have difficulty breathing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">have red, hot, swollen, or tender legs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; Kashmir the right to have a separate Constitution and separate flag, but nowhere does it say which category of Indians will enjoy all citizenship rights in Jammu &amp; Kashmir and which sections will not.<br />\n<br />\nPARAMOUNT CLAUSE: \" ETHNIC CLEANSING \" - OF SIX LAKHS KASHMIRI PANDITS BY KASHMIRI MUSLIMS SUPPORTED BY PAKISTAN, MAKES ARTICLE 370 NULL AND VOID\u2026<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/09/uniform-civil-code-in-india-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nJawaharlal Nehru, the HALF BROTHER of Sheikh Abdullah (who married the wife of LAWRENCE OF ARABIA-- JEWESS BEGUM AKBAR JEHAN) subverted the basic structure of the Indian Constitution in May 1954 to deprive all Indian citizens, including refugees from West Pakistan settled in Jammu province. of their fundamental right to exercise all rights in Jammu &amp; Kashmir\u2026<br />\n<br />\nNehru and Sheikh Abdullah made sure that the Permanent Residents of Jammu &amp; Kashmir shall exercise all rights all over India\u2026<br />\n<br />\nNehru amended Article 368 without taking the Indian Parliament into confidence, THOUGH Parliament alone had the power to amend or not amend the Constitution, to amend Article 35 and add to it the atrocious Article 35A which was enforced in Jammu &amp; Kashmir through the Constitution (Application to Jammu &amp; Kashmir) Order, May 1954.<br />\n<br />\nArticle 35A enabled the Jammu &amp; Kashmir Constituent Assembly to deny citizenship rights to the HINDU refugees from West Pakistan and all other Indians, barring Permanent Residents of the State.<br />\n<br />\nArmed with absolute power, the Jammu &amp; Kashmir Constituent Assembly adopted Section 6 which said no persons who had crossed over to the state after May 1944 will be considered eligible for citizenship rights.<br />\n<br />\nNehru enforced Article 35A in Jammu &amp; Kashmir UNCONSTITUTIONALLY - More important he criminally CONCEALED it.<br />\n<br />\nHe hid the amendments from the public, by not mentioning the same in the main body of the Constitution\u2014read this line twice.<br />\n<br />\nThe unconstitutional amendments to Article 368 and Article 35 were mentioned only in Appendix-I and Appendix-II, respectively, so that they could escape public attention in a CRIMINAL MANNER.<br />\n<br />\nAN APPENDIX CAN NEVER HIJACK THE MAIN BODY OF ANY ARTICLE.<br />\n<br />\nANY IDIOT KNOWS THIS UNLESS HE IS SENILE.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_197BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px;
