font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first astral layer had 240 ships with golden prows.. On\nthe second layer were torches with snakes at the base, golden wreaths in the\nmiddle and at the top, flames surmounted by eagles. The third layer showed a\nhunting scene, and the fourth a battle of centaurs, all done in gold. On the\nfifth layer also in gold, were lions and bulls, and on the sixth layer were the\narms of Macedon and Persia. The seventh and final layer ( heaven ) &nbsp;bore sculptures of sirens, hollowed out to\nconceal a choir who would sing a sad lament.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the day of the funeral, he gave\norders that the sacred flame in the temple should be extinguished.&nbsp; &nbsp;Normally, this was only done on the death of\nthe Great King himself<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The classical Hindu law\nhas the oldest pedigree of any known system of jurisprudence. The whole world\nknows this<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During Islamic rule in\nIndia they fused Hindu laws with their own Islamic laws.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmanas ( Vedas\npart 2 ) , the Aranyakas&nbsp; ( Vedas part 3\n) contain numerous precepts which propound rules governing behavior.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Natural cosmic order\n(Rta succeeded later by the concept Dharma) that regulates the universe and\nprovides the basis for its growth, flourishing and sustenance \u2013 be that of the\ngods, human beings, animals and eco-formations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In ancient Hindu\njurisprudence texts, a number of Sanskrit words refer to aspects of law. Some\nof these include Niyama (Sanskrit: </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f\u092f\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\nrule or law), Nyaya (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, legal proceeding,\njudicial sentence), Yuktata (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u0941\u0915\u094d\u0924\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, justice), Samya (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u092e\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\nequality and impartiality in law), Vidhi (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093f\u0927\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\nprecept or rule), Vyavastha (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u094d\u092f\u0935\u0938\u094d\u0925\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, agreement,\narrangement or regulation), Sambhasa (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u092e\u094d\u092d\u093e\u0937\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\ncontract or mutual engagement), Prasamvida-patra (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0938\u0902\u0935\u093f\u0926\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0924\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\nwritten contract),Vivadayati (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093f\u0935\u093e\u0926\u092f\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, litigate or dispute),\nAdhivakta (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0927\u093f\u0935\u0915\u094d\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, lawyer), Nyayavadi (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f\u0935\u093e\u0926\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\nmale lawyer), Nyayavadani (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f\u0935\u093e\u0926\u093f\u0928\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, female\nlawyer), Nyayadata (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f\u0926\u093e\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, judge), Danda (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0923\u094d\u0921</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">,\npunishment, penalty or fine), among others.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu texts included\nDharma,, which include Atmanastushti (satisfaction of one's conscience),\nSadachara (local norms of virtuous individuals)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit text\nVivadarnavasetu, in Chapter 3,&nbsp; states--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the plaintiff or\ndefendant have any excuse for not attending the court, or for not pleading\ntheir own cause, or, on any other account, excuse themselves, they shall, at\ntheir own option, appoint a person as their lawyer; if the lawyer gains the\nsuit, his principal also gains; if the lawyer is cast, his principal is cast\nalso.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a cause where the\naccusation is for murder, for a robbery, stealing etc (...), the principals\nshall plead and answer in person; but a woman, a minor, an insane, or a person\nlacking mental competency may be represented by a lawyer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vivadarnavasetu,\ninclude theories of fair punishment: (1) the texts set a standard of right, in\norder to define a violation that warrants punishment; (2) they discuss the\npossibility of a violation thereby defining a wrongdoing; (3) they discuss a\ntheory of responsibility and assignability of a wrongdoing; (4) the texts\ndiscuss degrees of guilt, and therewith the form and severity of punishment\nmust match the transgression; (5) they discuss approved and authorized forms of\npunishments and how these may be properly administered. The goal of punishment,\nin Hindu law, has been less retributive and more reformative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism and India\nprovide the whole planet with laws.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nHindu law fused with local norms and and practices, giving rise to legal\ntexts <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu law was created\non the basis of selective appropriation of the Dharmasastras, especially the\nSmrtis and to some extent the Nyaya-Mimamsa tradition (the tradition of logic\nand interpretation) as the methodological tool <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyaya in Sanskrit and\nMalayalam literally means justice as per rules. Nyaya school's epistemology\naccepts four out of six Pramanas as reliable means of gaining knowledge \u2013\nPratyak\u1e63a (perception), Anuma\u1e47a (inference), Upama\u1e47a (comparison and analogy)\nand \u015aabda (word, testimony of past or present reliable experts).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In ancient India ,&nbsp; Nyaya Panchayat were headed by a village\nSarpanch.&nbsp; It heard minor civil and\ncriminal cases. There was one Nyaya Panchayat for every three or four villages.\nEach village Panchayat elected a member to the Nyaya Panchayat.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because the modern\njustice system is too tardy, ineffective an unreliable\u2014India has gone back to\nour ancient system of Nyaya Panchayats. This is is a system of dispute\nresolution at village level in India.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyaya panchayats can be endowed with\nfunctions based on broad principles of natural justice and can tend to remain\nprocedurally as simple as possible. They can be given civil and minor criminal\njurisdiction. But they should never follow civil and criminal procedure code in\ntoto.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since a forum for the resolution of disputes with the participation of\npeople in local justice administration is the goal envisaged by Article 39A of\nthe Constitution of India, it is strongly felt by jurists and social scientists\nthat it is incumbent on the government to take immediate steps to activate\nnyaya panchayats, given that it might not be possible to render access justice\nin rural areas simpler and quicker. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyaya panchayats now guided\nby LOCAL TRADITIONS , CULTURE and behavioural pattern of the village community\ninstill confidence in the people towards the administration of justice. Nyaya\nPanchayat is a simple system of dispute resolution at village level in\nIndia.&nbsp;&nbsp; India has had a long history of\nresolving disputes through the mediation of respected village elders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyaya panchayats guided\nby local traditions, culture and behavioural pattern of the village community\ninstill confidence in the people towards the administration of justice. These\nvillage elders know the pulse of the people and have hindsight.&nbsp; They know the rotten eggs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They would dispose of a\nlarge number of cases and thus relieve the burden of regular courts.&nbsp; They would succeed in getting a large number\nof cases compromised through peaceful conciliation using principles of natural\njustice.&nbsp;&nbsp; Here the justice is NOT blind\n, the way Jew Rothschild corrupted our regular judiciary. Appeals and revisions\nfrom these decisions would be small in number.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">There should be speedy\nand cheap disposal of cases without ---<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TAAREEQ , PEH TAREEQ PEH TAREEQ PEH FUCKIN\u2019\nTAREEQ&nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The litigants and witnesses who are mostly agriculturists can conveniently\nattend the courts and thus there would be no interference with agricultural\nactivities in the village. They don\u2019t have to travel far.&nbsp;&nbsp; Witnesses are treated with respect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The panchayat could\nbring justice nearer to the villager without involving the expenditure which\nwould otherwise have to be incurred in establishing regular courts, hiring\nexpensive lawyers who are usually JUDASES&nbsp;\nin cahoots with the lawyer of the opposite camp..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panchayat would have an\neducative value.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Local courts acquainted\nwith the customs of the neighbourhood and nuances of the local idiom are better\nable to understand why certain things are said or done. All conversations are\nin local dialect or language not some alien language .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The people concerned\ncan talk DIRECTLY to the \u201cjudges\u201d \u2013unlike today where the judge will speak onto\nto the MIDDLE MAN lawyer. There is NO \u201ccontempt of court\u201d for faalthu reason\nlike \u201cstanding on one leg \u201c.&nbsp; The\naudience is NOT alien but people in the village who have a stake .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People in a village are\nso closely known to each other that the parties to a dispute would not be able\nto conceal or produce false evidence easily and those who tell lies before the\nnyaya panchayat face the risk of being looked down upon and even boycotted or\nex-communicated by others.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panchas being drawn\nfrom among simple village folk strive at decisions which are fair and at the\nsame time consistent with the peculiar conditions of the parties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panchayats, the age-old\ninstitution has found new vigour with the introduction of the 73rd Amendment to\nthe Constitution, and most accordingly to be considered another pillar in the\nedifice that symbolizes justice.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is\ndespite the Collegium judiciary, Benami media and Foreign funded NGOs trying\ntheir best to discredit this beautiful traditional system by branding it a\nDEVILs WORKSHOP.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine Ex-CJI JS\nKhekar wanted white Jew to be lawyers in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strengthening the\ninstitution of Panchayats and empowering people at the grass-root level to\nresolve their disputes amicably would solve many of the problems that is faced\nby conventional justice dispensation machinery in its attempts to percolate to\nthe lowest levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This would provide a,\nsolution to the problems of access to those living in remote regions and\nilliterate tribals .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rationale behind\nsetting up the Nyaya Panchayat are:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fair justice system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Democratic\ndecentralisation,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Easy access to justice,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speedy disposal of\ncases,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inexpensive justice\nsystem,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revival of traditional\nvillage community life,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Combination of judicial\nsystem and local self government,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reduction in pressure\non Civil Courts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Procedure followed in\nnyaya panchayats is very simple and informal. The procedure codes like Code of\nCivil Procedure, Criminal Procedure Code and Indian Evidence Act apply to the\nnyaya panchyats,&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But, they have power to\ncall witnesses and the parties for recording their evidence&nbsp; or producing any relevant document or fact.\nUnlike courts, they have the power to&nbsp;\ninvestigate the facts to find out the truth and at the same time they have\nthe power to punish for its REAL contempt.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lawyers cannot appear\nbefore a nyaya panchyat in any of its proceedings.&nbsp; Thank god !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>IN MINOR CASES WHY DO\nWE REQUIRE LAWYERS ?<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WHEN YOU HIRE A LAWYER \u2013ALL\nYOU ARE 100% SURE IS THE EXPENSE.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">TODAY\nTHE MILLIONAIRE LAWYERS OF INDIA ARE THE ONES HAVE A \u201cSETTING\u201d WITH A CORRUPT\nJUDGE AND THE OPPOSITE CAMP LAWYER . THEY HAVE FUN AT FREEMASON LODGES</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The advantages of nyaya\npanchayats over the regular courts are priceless\u2026 They provide justice at the\ndoor steps for the village folks.&nbsp;&nbsp; They\nprovide relief to the ordinary courts as they lift the part of burden of\njudicial work on their shoulders. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a way, they are\nemerged on solution to the problem of mounting arrears of cases before the\ncourts. Local culture and traditions are not kicked on the teeth . Panchayat\nSystem has a great educative value for the villagers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till our backlog clears\ndo NOT overburden our justice system with traffic challan cases.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All petty cases and ego\nmassage cases should be taken out of this system.&nbsp;&nbsp; Even petty criminal cases caused by extreme\npoverty should go out. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Courts should be\ndealing with serious criminal offences, not with petty cases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There must be more labs\nfor DNA evidence .&nbsp; There must be secrecy\n\u2013&nbsp; to prevent corruption lab operators\nmust not know names .&nbsp; There must be code\nnumbers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Justice delayed is\njustice denied is an axiom that all of us in India understand as we see thousands\nof cases hanging on without justice for decades.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; shot a\nMONKEY which is no use when alive or dead.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The legal Indian\nprofession has long ago&nbsp; ceased to be a\nnoble&nbsp; service oriented system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Warren Hastings\nappointed a team of eleven Pundits to compile a code on Hindu law in 1772.\nVivadarnavasetu, the original Sanskrit version was later on was first rendered\nin Persian and then into English under the title \u2013 A Code of Gentoo Laws</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">from the Persian rendering by N. B Halhed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\nwas first published in 1776 followed by several editions and reprints in\ndifferent European languages. This text was repeatedly referred and described\nin the contemporary documents as the \u2018standard handbook on Hindu law</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THESE LAWS WERE POISON\nINJECTED TO SUIT JEWS ROTHSCHILD AGENDA OF DIVIDE AND RULE IN INDIA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was an\ninstitution of lawyers in ancient India have which King Solomon adopted 2950\nyears ago<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0935\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nothing is higher than\nDharma. The weak overcomes the stronger by Dharma, as over a king. Truly that\nDharma is the Truth (Satya); Therefore, when a man speaks the Truth, they say,\n\"He speaks the Dharma\"; and if he speaks Dharma, they say, \"He\nspeaks the Truth!\" For both are one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014<b>\u2009Brihadaranyaka\nUpanishad, 1.4.xiv 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Fatawa-e-Alamgiri\nalso formalized the legal principle of Muhtasib ( Rothschild agenda ) , or\noffice of censor that was already in use by previous rulers of the Mughal\nEmpire.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any publication or information\ncould be declared as heresy, and its transmission made a crime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mu\u1e25tasib was\na supervisor of bazaars and trade in the medieval Islamic countries. His duty\nwas to ensure that public business was conducted in accordance with the law of\nsharia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">Fatawaa E Alamgiri was the\ncodification of Islamic law in India during the Mughal Empire, based on Sunni\nHanafi Sharia law </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>IT WAS A KOSHER JOB FOR\nTHE POLITICAL CONVENIENCE OF JEW ROTHSCHILD\u2014&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/blogger.g?blogID=3564735312144269387\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"clear: right; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1615 Sir Thomas Roe\nwas instructed by King James I to visit the Mughal Emperor Jahangir, who ruled\nover 70% of the Indian subcontinent.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The meeting was a success and a commercial\ntreaty was made which gave &nbsp;Rothschild\u2019s &nbsp;British East India Company exclusive rights to\ntrade to and from India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jew Sir Thomas Roe was\nplanted in Jehangir\u2019s court from 1615 to 1618, &nbsp;as British ambassador to &nbsp;Jahangir.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the Mughal court, Roe got\nJehangir addicted to Laudanum ( opium / alcohol/ codein mix )\u2014and extracted all\nhis secrets during&nbsp; their daily night\ndrinking sessions.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">He sweet talked him into employing FAKE CRYPTO JEW SAYYIDS as clerics and poets.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crypto JEW Sayyid\nMuhammad Qanauji was chaplain to the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (1592\u20131666) and\nteacher of his son, the emperor Aurangzeb (1618\u20131707)\u2014PLANTED by Jew\nRothschild. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sayyid Muhammad Qanauji\nwas a disciple of crypto JEW Muhibullah Allahabadi who was a descendant of the crypto\nJew Fariduddin Ganjshakar ( Baba Farid / died 1266 AD )&nbsp; who stayed for many years in Jerusalem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1998, the Punjab\nGovernment in India established the Baba Farid University of Health Sciences at\nFaridkot because Fariduddin Ganjshakar ( SIC ) influenced Guru Nanak.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Listen-- Guru Nanak\ndied in 1539 AD. &nbsp;&nbsp;Baba Farid died in\n1266 AD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Holy books of Sikhs the\nGuru Granth Sahib Ji contains four shabads and 113 shaloks of a Baba Farid .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This baba Faris is\ndifferent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His names is MUSLIM Shaikh\nBrahm (Ibrahim), also known as Farid Sani \u2013it is claimed that Farid Sani met\nGuru Nanak Dev met on two occasions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So here is a\nconversation\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:-- O Sheikh, said\nGuru Nanak, Ours is to be like a true wife, whose husband has gone on a\nmerchandise tour in distant lands. The wife ever remembers him and keeps\nfaithful to him, in thought, word and action. The husband, when he returns, is\noverjoyed at her faithful remembrance and love. He puts his hand on her head\nand says, Thou art mine and I am thine. So we should, O Sheikh, lose ourselves\nwholly in the Divine Being; forsake all attachment to the flesh, and think of\nnone but Him, both within and without. With constant humility, prayer, Divine\nMeditation, considering the service of our fellow men as the service of Him,\nand the company of the illumined, the spark of Divine light springs up in the\nhuman heart and the mind gets illumined, seeing none else but God both within\nand without. We have to serve and meditate and yet feel that service and\nmeditation is His. : UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AIYOOO !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Shah Jahan &nbsp;knew he was dying, he praised JEW Sayyid Sayyid\nMuhammad Qanauji for his faithful service and asked if there was any way he\ncould reward him. Sayyid asked him to forgive his son Aurangzeb (1618\u20131707),\nand the emperor reluctantly agreed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">I MUST REPEAT THIS AGIN-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">FATAWA E ALAMGIRI GAVE SPECIAL PENQUIN\nSTATUES TO CRYPTO JEW SAYYIDS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">SAYYIDS BY DEFINITION ARE MALE DESCENDANTS OF\nALI BY FATIMAH , THE DAUGHTER OF MOHAMMAD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; 150%;\">THERE IS NO MENTION IN\nKORAN OR HADITHS OF MUSLIMS WHO DIE FOR ISLAM GETTING TO HAVE ETERNAL &nbsp;SEX WITH 72 VIRGINS IN HEAVEN.. &nbsp;&nbsp;THIS&nbsp;\nWAS POISON INJECTED BY JEWS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><b>So from where did this\nnumber 72 creep in into Islam?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As far the choice of\nmigrating to Medina ( Yathrib ) \u2013it was a mere \u2018Pledge of Aqaba\u2019 made by the\nfirst Hindu to Muslim converts -- 72 ( men and women ) of Khazraj and Aws\nHindus communities of Medina.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the night of the\n27th of Rajab, that the Holy Prophet &nbsp;went for Meraj (Journey into the Heavens) both\nwith body and soul.&nbsp; &nbsp;It was during this journey, that the Prophet\nbrought from the Court of Allah, the Gift of Namaaz. [Madarijun Nabuiwat vol.1\npg.316]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the 13th year after\nthe announcement of Nabuiwat, during the occasion of Hajj, another 72 people\nfrom Madinah discreetly accepted Islam at Aqaba and took the oath of allegiance\nat the hands of the Prophet. This was known as the Bai'at Aqaba Thaaniya \u2013 The\nsecond Pledge at Aqaba.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 72 Muslims invited the Prophet &nbsp;to come to Madinah with them and said that\nthey were prepared to protect Islam and the Prophet &nbsp;with their lives. During this pledge Hazrat\nAbbas, the uncle of the Prophet who had not as yet accepted Islam, was also\npresent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">The<b style=\"background-color: white;\"> SECOND PLEDGE AT\nAQABA </b>was an important event that preceded the Migration to Medina. &nbsp;Converts to Islam came from nearly all Arab\ntribes present in Madinah,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"> 72</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"> coming to\nMakkah for pilgrimage and to meet Muhammad.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The pledge states:&nbsp; Blood is blood and blood not to be paid for\nis blood not to be paid for. I am of you and you are of me. I will war against\nthem that war against you, and be at peace with those at peace with you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surah Al-Waqia\n(56:35-37) of the Quran describes the houris as \"most refined\",\ncreated by Allah \"in the best of form\" and well-matched\". Wandering into Janasthana, he is assaulted by the memories of his once happy days there, spent in the company of his beloved Sita. His distress makes him cry out:<br />\nAlas! alas! my queen! My heart breaks, my limbs fall apart,<br />\nA fire consumes me incessantly, the world seems empty.<br />\nMy distressed soul sinks despondent into a blinding darkness,<br />\nAnd a stupor comes over me. Luckless as I am whatever shall I do?<br />\nSita who lives in the underworld with Ganga and Prithvi is in the forest too but she is invisible. She hears Rama cry out in pain. She sees him, pale and thin with the smouldering agony within. He faints again and again when memories becomes unbearable. Sita rushes to him to restore him to consciousness with the touch of her hand. Rama senses her presence, recognises her dear and familiar touch. He manages once to grasp her hand, ``beautiful like a pile of snow, soft like a fresh lavali sprout'', but is confused when he does not see her. He despairs that his tortured mind is playing tricks on him. Sita fully realises that Rama's love is hers forever. Her anger melts away and the thorn in her heart is removed. She could now go back to him with honour and dignity. , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">IN MALDIVES AGAIN HE DID TOO MUCH HOOO HAAA ABOUT MUSLIM WOMEN NOT COVERING THEIR BREASTS AND GOT KICKED OUT FROM THERE TOO.</span></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Ibn Battuta's legal training was modest -- and that too only in the Maliki tradition of jurisprudence, ...&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE WROTE THE KORAN AND HERE WAS A PRETENDER TEACHING HIS FATHER HOW TO FUCK.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Maliki school is one of the four major madhhab of Islamic jurisprudence within Sunni Islam. It was founded by Malik ibn Anas in the 8th century..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Maliki school's sources for Sharia are hierarchically prioritized as follows: Quran and then trustworthy Hadiths (sayings, customs and actions of Muhammad); if these sources were ambiguous on an issue, then `Amal (customs and practices of the people of Medina), followed by consensus of the Sahabah (the companions of Muhammad), then individual's opinion from the Sahabah, Qiyas (analogy), Istislah (interest and welfare of Islam and Muslims), and finally Urf (custom of people throughout the Muslim world if it did not contradict the hierarchically higher sources of Sharia).</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The major schools of law (madhhab) were mutually conflicting. . The four most important of them are:--</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Shafi'i (Egypt, Mashriq, Hijaz, Yemen)</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Maliki (Maghreb and West Africa)</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Hanafi (Central and South Asia, the Balkans, Turkey)</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Hanbali (most common in the Gulf counties)</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Fatawa E Alamgiri had strict adherence to the Hanafi madhhab of Abu Hanifa\u2014a rich silk / fine cotton merchant from Caicut..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Sultan Mahmud Ghaznawi ( died 1030) was the first ruler in India who introduced the Hanafi madhhab --he was the author of a book, al-Tafrid, in the Hanafi fiqh..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Ottomans, recognized the Hanafi as the exclusive official school in their empire.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">A madhhab is a school of Islamic law, and each madhhab is based on a systematic methodology of interpreting the Qur\u2019an and Prophetic sunna.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Following a madhhab is not an end in itself; rather, it is a means to follow the Qur\u2019an and Sunna in a sound, systematic, and sustainable manner.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Hanafi madhhab is called the \"followers of opinion\", denoting a perception of their greater reliance on logic and reasoning, as opposed to the label \" HARDCORE followers of the hadith\" (ashab al-hadith) applied to the Shafi\u02d3i and Hanbali madhahibs</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Schools, such as the Zahiri madhhab, were known for their eschewing of reason and logic, relying instead on the \"literal HARDLINE \" interpretation of authoritative sources.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; AS BELOW--<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n\"Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah . But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah , then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah , so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.\"KORAN-- 2.229<br />\n<br />\n\"And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him. And if the latter husband divorces her [or dies], there is no blame upon the woman and her former husband for returning to each other if they think that they can keep [within] the limits of Allah . These are the limits of Allah , which He makes clear to a people who know.\" KORAN\u20142.230<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nRemarriage has been encouraged in Islam for divorcees and widows so that they lead a happy family life<br />\n<br />\nAccording to the Indian All India Muslim Personal Law Board, a man cannot remarry a woman after triple talaq unless she has already consummated her marriage with another man.. and then that new husband dies or divorces her\u2026 In this case the marriage (Nikah) of the woman with her new husband is called Nikah halala\u2026<br />\n<br />\nPer a new set of code of conduct issued regarding divorce by the organisation in April 2017, a man can rejoin with his wife in three months after single talaq and can remarry after three months without the woman having to go through nikah halala\u2026<br />\n<br />\nIn a landmark judgment, the Supreme Court of India barred Instant Triple Talaq on 22 August 2017 and asked the Parliament to make a law on the matter.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nTo ensure that a man does not divorce his wife in a fit of temper, without proper consideration an almost impossible condition was set. Thus a divorced woman is free to marry another man after her waiting period (iddat) after the divorce.<br />\n<br />\nHowever, if the man she has married dies or divorces her, she can marry the earlier husband who had divorced her - she is now halal or permissible for him. This should be of her own free will and without any conspiracy.<br />\n<br />\nIt should not be a marriage entered into just for the purpose of an immediate divorce so that she can remarry the first husband again. Such a marriage can only be called a mis-practice or an innovation against the spirit of Islam.<br />\n<br />\nNowhere is there any suggestion that this should be an escape route for a husband who has arbitrarily given divorce to his wife or a condition of sex between the second husband and wife before marriage to the first.<br />\n<br />\nIn fact, the Prophet denounced it: \u201cCurse be upon the one who marries a divorced woman with the intention of making her lawful for her former husband and upon the one for whom she is made lawful\u201d - Abu Dawud, Book 005, Hadith Number 2071 narrated by Ali ibn Abu Talib.<br />\n<br />\nThe Caliph Omar pronounced pre-planned Nikah Halala as adultery.<br />\n<br />\nNikah Halala violates the right of a woman and her dignity to live an equitable life.<br />\n<br />\nMost Muslims read the Quran in Arabic, often learning it by rote but without understanding it.<br />\n<br />\nNikah Halala is nothing but EXPLOITING VULNERABILITY of Muslim women who are probably willing to go to any lengths to save a marriage or perhaps for economic reasons to survive , without going into prostitution.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br style=\"background-color: #cccccc; below is in one of my old blogs which I penned 8 years ago<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nDIGRESSION:<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nFour decades ago, when i was a young boy, I took a bus from Mangalore to Mumbai.<br />\n<br />\nOn the passage , the radiator of the bus cracked at midnight somewhere in the middle of no man's land.<br />\n<br />\nI remember, I got hold of another youngster to help me out.<br />\n<br />\nI wanted&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">CHOONA</span></b>&nbsp;LIME, SUGAR, FRESH MOTHER'S MILK and RAW KERALA BANANA.<br />\n<br />\nI got everything except the milk.<br />\n<br />\nFinally despite being threatened by the husband of a pretty young lady in burkha nursing a baby, I got the milk.<br />\n<br />\nThis kind and intelligent lady felt that I was doing something right,to save the situation ( in a unsafe area ) and squeezed it into a glass\u2014 despite her husband giving her HAJAAAR tough looks .<br />\n<br />\nThe guy whom I chose to assist me , whispered \u201c Another woman has powder milk-- hum log maar khaane waala hai \u201c<br />\n<br />\nI said \u201c NOPE \u2013that will lack hormones and will NOT make heat resistant strong adhesive putty \u201c<br />\n<br />\nI made a strong adhesive solution which held the hot radiators leak till the next radiator welding workshop in a small town .<br />\n<br />\nChoona was the cement.<br />\n<br />\nSugar was the binder<br />\n<br />\nHormones in fresh \u2013repeat \u2013 fresh mother's milk did the magic catalysis --surprised?<br />\n<br />\nRaw Kerala banana was the resin.<br />\n<br />\nOn ship's which carry corrosive salt we coat the steel of the ship's cargo hold with lime , sugar and cows milk.<br />\n<br />\nAfter that once the salt is discharged, takes at least 300 bars of water pressure from a HP wash Kew machine to get the white compound off the rough steel surface.<br />\n<br />\nSuch a sharp water blade can slice off a human arm clean.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_27b+seedBAskD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_27b+seedBAskD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div text-decoration-line: none;\">March 17, 2018 at 2:05 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_5MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">I AM WATCHING THE MAHA KUMBHA AT SHRAVANABELAGOLA OF JAIN ICON BAAHUBALI ( INDIA TODAY TV )&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">INDIA IS NAMED BHARAT AFTER THE ELDEST SON OF HINDU EMPEROR RISHABHA ( 8190 BC )</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">FAKE BHARAT --THE FAKE SON OF THE FAKE SHAKUNTALA WAS COOKED UP BY ROTHSCHILD ..</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Rishabh was born to Merudevi, Bharat was born to Rishabh, Bharatvarsha was named from Bharat, and Sumati arose from Bharat. ( Vishnu Purana 2.1.31 )</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">This country is known as Bharatavarsha,Since the time the father entrusted the Kingdom to the son, And himself went to the forest for ascetic practices. ( Vishnu Purana 2.1.32 )</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Emperor Rishabha has 100 sons and two daughters . His eldest son was Bharata from Sumangala and the eldest son from his second wife Sunanda was Bahubali.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Chakravarti Bharata ( son of Sumangala ) conquered the whole world.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">After conquering the world he sent a communication to his brothers to accept his order. After an initial hesitation 98 brothers accepted Bharata\u2019s order.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Now Bahubali ( son of Sunanda ) was left. When the messenger came to him with message he said \u2013 \u201cO messenger! Go and tell your emperor Bharat that Bahubali isn\u2019t like his brothers who became Sadhus leaving the kingdom.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Finally emperor Bharat attacked on Takshshila kingdom of Bahubali. Army of both sides fought hard. Sometimes army of Bharat dominated army of Bahubali and sometimes vice versa. Seeing mass destruction in war it was decided that there should be a single combat between Bharat and Bahubali . One who wins will be the only Chakravarti or \"Emperor of Emperors\".</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In all the stages of battle Bharat had to face terrible defeat at the hands of his younger brother Bahubali in all these fights.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">When a point came that Baahubali must give a lethal strike on his elder half brother Bharata, he raised his hand . He felt that his own sister Sundari and step sister Brahmi ( of script Brahmi Lipi fame ) were on the side of Bharata.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Instead of giving the final fatal blow, Baahubali suddenly uprooted a large tuft of hair from his own head instead, thus declaring himself as a monk stunning all .</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">INSTEAD OF REVERING BHARATA AND BAAHUBALI THESE STUPID JAINS POUR WATER ON THE HEAD OF GHANSYAM PANDE WHO WAS CONVERTED INTO GOD BY ROTHSCHILD 188 YEARS AGO</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Bahubali spent many years in meditation and severe penance.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">According to legend, he stood meditating for such a long time that anthills formed on the ground where he stood, snakes climbed on his head and creepers grew all over him. But he did not attain omniscience ( keval jnaan) because he had an ego and indignation burn problem, that he stood on the ground owned by his brother Bharata.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">For this reason, he could not shed perception-obscuring delusions and obstructing karmas that influence the soul. Finally one day Bharata came and reconciled with him, his ego vanished and he attained omniscience ( nirvana ).</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Today pilgrims visit the colossal statue of Bahubali (Gomateshwar ) stands 59 feet high on the hill Vindhyagiri at Shravanabelgola near Mysore. It is the tallest known monolithic statue in the world carved out of a single huge granite boulder. .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BB1-vlgxKLM</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">STUPID JAINS&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/difference-between-buddha-and-mahavira.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; And indeed we should never have succeeded if we had not had Brahmans who are white Christians hidden among them -- The most extraordinary part is that those who are the depositaries of the Veda do not understand its meaning; for the Veda is written in a very ancient language and the Samouscroutam (that is the Sanskrit in Malayalam ) which is as familiar to their learned men as Latin is to us is not sufficient without the help of a commentary to explain the thoughts as well as the words of the Veda.--- The Veda is learnt by heart at first without any attempt at understanding it. It is only after the test has thus been mechanically engraved on the tablets of the memory that the more learned among the Br\u00e2hmans endeavour to understand it under the guidance of their teachers and with the help of ancient commentaries. All this is in accordance with their ancient law-books and exists still as the recognised system of education in several parts of India particularly in the south. Some schools go even so far as to maintain that a text of the Veda if not understood is more efficient at a sacrifice than if it is understood by the person who recites it. I doubt whether any other priesthood has gone so far in their admiration of ignorance\"UNQUOTE</div>\n<div>\n<b style=\"color: purple; font-size: x-large;\">CUNT CALMETTE DID NOT KNOW THAT EFFICACY OF VEDIC SRUTIS WAS IN THE SOUND ( SHABDA BRAHMAN ) AND NOT IN THE MEANING .. THE MEANING IS ONLY TO INSTILL A SENSE OF GRATITUDE.</b></div>\n<br />\nMarco della Tomba ( who studied Sanskrit ) who was in India between 1757 and 1774 confesses that he was never allowed to see a manuscript of the Vedas. He expressed doubt that the Vedas in written form even existed<br />\n<b><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b>ONCE JEW ROTHSCHILD KNEW THE VALUE OF BRAHMANAS ( PART 2 ) AND ARANYAKAS ( PART 3 ) HE STOLE THE ORIGINALS AND SHIPPED IT TO GERMANY</b></span></div>\n<br />\nJesuit JEW Jean-Fran\u00e7ois Pons ( an expert in Sanskrit ) was in Kerala scrounging for Sanskrit texts in Math and Astronomy.
