color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The waitress sullied the Lok Sabha by issuing\nparty whips for every small thing . Only a secret Lok Sabha ballot works . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">This Rothschild method of I THINK THE AYES\nHAVE IT --is nonsense !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Whips are the party's \"enforcers\";\nthey invite their fellow legislators to attend voting sessions and to vote\naccording to the official party policy. This was a system invented by\nRothschild to hijack democracy.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHIP may mean the voting instructions issued\nto members by the whip , or the status of a certain legislator in their party's\nparliamentary grouping.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">In India, the concept of the whip was\ninherited from colonial British rule moulder to suit JEW Rothschild&nbsp; .&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Every major political party appoints a whip\nwho is responsible for the party's discipline and behaviour on the floor of the\nhouse. Usually, he directs the party members to stick to the party's stand on\ncertain issues and directs them to vote as per the direction of senior party\nmembers.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">However, there are some cases such as Indian presidential elections\nwhere whips cannot direct a member of parliament or member of legislative\nassembly on whom to vote.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Violation of the party whip could lead to\nexpulsion under the Anti Defection Act.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">We must stop this nonsense by going for\nsecret ballot <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">A whip is of three kinds.---<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">A one-line whip is non-binding, and merely\nserves to inform the members of the vote.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">A two-line whip seeks attendance in the\nlegislature during the vote.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">A three-line whip is a clear-cut directive,\nto be present in the legislature during the vote and cast vote according to the\nparty line. Violation of the whip could lead to the member's expulsion from the\nHouse.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">In India, under the anti-defection law, a\nthree-line whip can be violated only by more than one-third of a party's\nstrength in the legislature.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">INDIA MUST AMEND THE RULES ABOUT THIS WHIP\nSYSTEM WHICH CAN BE CONTROLLED BY DESH DROHI FOREIGNERS .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">WE MUST HAS CLEAR GUIDELINES OF \u201cFREE VOTE \u201c\nSYSTEM ON CRITICAL ISSUES.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS BULLSHIT\nOF &nbsp;\u201cI THINK THE AYES HAVE IT \u201c &nbsp;MUST BE USED ONLY ON TRIVIAL MATTERS \u2013 ONLY TO SAVE\nTIME <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;The\nfear of losing seat in the house due to anti-defection law, the whip system\nreduces the MPs to a mere headcount on the floor of the House. It effectively\nleads to a tendency to develop \u201cforced consensus\u201d on certain issues and bills.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">What is needed is that whip should be some\nimportant bills where the survival of the government is in question and not on\nevery ordinary bill.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">India's\nAnti Defection Law, passed by Parliament in 1985 through the 52nd amendment to\nthe Constitution, is particularly powerful; with respect to voting, an MP or an\nMLA is deemed to have defected if he or she \"votes or abstains from\nvoting... contrary to any direction of&nbsp; his party.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Essentially,\nevery vote in an assembly or the Parliament must be along party lines, and the\nMLA or MP is legally debarred from exercising his or her own opinion. After 21\nMPs cross-voted during the 2008 trust vote against the UPA-I government,\nseveral were expelled and disqualified under this law.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DEMOCRACY\nIS A JOKE WHEN THIS WHIP SYSTEM IS USED. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ONLY\nFOR SURVIVAL OF \u201cNO TRUST MOTION\u201d MUT WHIP SYSTEM BE USED\u2014BECAUSE HUNDREDS OF\nCRORES ARE GIVEN BY DESH DROHI FOREIGNER TO BRING DOWN AN ELECTED GOVT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since\nthe election of the President is meant to be a \"non-political\" event,\nit is the one time that the whip is not applied, and MPs and MLAs are free to\nvote as per their conscience.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The only other election in which a whip does not\napply is when MLAs vote for new members to the Rajya Sabha, but that election\nis conducted through an open ballot--meaning that the MLA is required to show\nthe official agent of the party whom he or she voted for--making it far harder\nfor MLAs to defy party directions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nelection of the President becomes the only \"free\" vote in India's\nParliamentary democracy. Sure enough, there is some cross-voting during every\nPresidential election.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In 1969, the Prime Minister Indira Gandhi-backed\n\"independent\" candidate V.V. Giri defeated the official Congress\ncandidate Neelam Sanjiva Reddy to become President despite the Congress having\na 431-seat majority in Parliament.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>VV GIRI WAS ROTHSCHILDs MAN --&nbsp; THE TRADE UNION LEADER BRAINWASHED IN LONDON .</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Rothschild made VV Giri the president of the\nAll India Trade Union Congress . VV Giri was sent to Rotshchild controlled\nInternational Labour Conference of the ILO in 1927. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">He was Minister for Labour in the government\nheaded by Freemason C Rajagopalachari. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have given Bharat Ratna to people like VV\nGiri whom Rothschild used as his MAN FRIDAY for controlling labour unions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Jew Lenin had said: IF YOU WANT TO CONTROL\nTHE OPPOSOTION LEAD IT YOURSELF. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">EVERY TRADE UNION LEADERS WHO LEAD STRIKES\nWAS IN ROTHSCHILDs POCKET.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: x-large;\">STRIKES WERE USED AS HEGELIAN DIALECTIC</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/hegelian-dialectic-cancer-on-this.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/hegelian-dialectic-cancer-on-this.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">VV Giri's grandson Palagummi Sainath tried to\nride piggy back-- he even did a GREAT MARCH like Mao all over India.. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Saala jamaah nahin !</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">MPs must\nbe able to vote as per their conscience on legislative matters.. It I the onus\nof the party leadership to educate illiterate MPs on the pitfalls of voting\nagainst party whip<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Every\nvote of an MP or MLA should be recorded so that constituents can know which way\ntheir representative voted on key issues and hold them accountable for it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WE ALL\nKNOW CJI JS KHEHAR VOTED IN FAVOUR OF TRIPLE TALAQ.. &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WHAT IS THIS FELLOW WORTH? &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">HE ALSO WANTED WHITE JEW LAWYERS IN INDIA</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://www.livelaw.in/chief-justice-khehar-supports-entry-foreign-lawyers-india/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.livelaw.in/chief-justice-khehar-supports-entry-foreign-lawyers-india/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VOICE VOTE was used\nduring the formation of Telangana state, in forming the 29th state of India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The voice vote, or\nacclamation, is considered the simplest and quickest of voting methods used by\ndeliberative assemblies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The presiding officer or chair of the assembly will\nput the question to the assembly, asking first for all those in favor of the\nmotion to indicate so orally (\"aye\" or \"yes\"), and then ask\nsecond all those opposed to the motion to indicate so verbally (\"nay\"\nor \"no\"). The chair will then make an estimate of the count on each\nside and state what he or she believes the result to be.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Voice votes have\ninherent disadvantages and are typically only used in votes that are expected\nto be landslides; the method has major shortfalls in close contests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The volume\nof the voices are typically only estimated and not actually measured with sound\nlevel meters, giving a chair enough plausible deniability to falsify the result\nif they disagree with it; even if such a vote can be objectively quantified in\nterms of decibels, the method gives an unfair advantage to those who have\nlouder voices.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The need to make an audible signal also compromises any\nsituation in which a secret ballot may be desired. The method is suitable in\nmost cases where unanimity is required. If there is any doubt as to the\noutcome, any member of the assembly may request another vote by a method such\nas division of the assembly (a standing or rising vote), or a roll call vote.\nVoice votes are usually not recorded, but sometimes are.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 12 March 2015, the\nparliament passed the Insurance laws (Amendment) bill, 2015. Earlier it was\npassed in Lok Sabha on March 4, 2015, and then passed by the Rajya Sabha on 12\nMarch 2015 by voice vote. It proposes to increase FDI limit in local insurers\nfrom earlier 26% to 49% now.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 30 April 2015, the\nLok Sabha passed the Finance Bill for 2015 by a voice vote.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">On 14 March 2018 the\nlok sabha passed the appropriation bill and finance bill by a voice vote.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A simple rising vote\n(in which the number of members voting on each side stand, or \"rise\")\nis used principally in cases in which the chair believes a voice vote has been\ntaken with an inconclusive result, or upon a motion to divide the assembly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nrising vote is also the normal method of voting on motions requiring a\ntwo-thirds vote for adoption. It can also be used as the first method of voting\nwhen only a majority vote is required if the chair believes in advance that a\nvoice vote will be inconclusive. The chair can also order the rising vote to be\ncounted<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A show of hands is an\nalternate to voice voting and can be used as the basic voting method in small\nboards or committees, and it is so used in other informal or small gatherings\nfor voting. &nbsp;It is more precise than a\nvoice vote but does not require members to leave their seats.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, it does\nnot count as a division of the assembly, and is not always as effective as a\nrising vote in causing a maximum number of members to vote who have not done so.\nSome MPs in back rows may put up both hands<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secret voting would\nreduce the influence of the whips certainly, but it would also reduce\naccountability to the public.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An elected representative\nmust have absolute freedom of expression. The Indian Constitution bestows this\nfreedom more compellingly upon legislators than ordinary citizens<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As sovereign citizens,\nit is every Indian\u2019s right to know how her elected representatives perform.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instances where the Lok Sabha (lower house of the Parliament) passed eight\nbills in a record seventeen minutes &nbsp;run\nhavoc over principles of a parliamentary democracy and do little for\naccountability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I WAS AMUSED TO SEE A\nFEMALE JNU PHD STUDENT SAYING SHE CANT GIVE ATTENDANCE AS SHE HAS TO VISIT FAR AWAY\nWHOREHOUSES TO KNOW HOW THE FUCKING IS DONE AND INTO WHICH ORIFICE.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IS\nTHIS IMPORTANT FOR THE FORTUNES OF BHARATMATA ?&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DO YOU THINK THIS UGLY FEMALE WAS REALLY DOING A THESIS \u2013&nbsp; OR WORKING AS SOME SALESWOMAN\nAND USING JNU CAMPUS FOR FREE BOARDING , LODGING AND SEX ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash-for-votes_scandal\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash-for-votes_scandal</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\">Foreign force were involved in bribing of MPs\nduring the July 2008 no-confidence vote, which the UPA-I government won by a\nslim majority.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since India has evolved\nits parliamentary practice from the UK ( created by JEW Rothschild ) , voting\nin the House of Commons is similar to how the Indian Parliament votes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no provision\nin the Lok Sabha rules of procedure, which says that a member is not obliged to\nvote<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A quorum is the minimum\nnumber of members of a deliberative assembly (a body that uses parliamentary\nprocedure, such as a legislature) necessary to conduct the business of that\ngroup.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 100 of the Constitution of India stipulates that at least 10% of\ntotal number of members of the House must be present to constitute the quorum\nto constitute a meeting of either House of Parliament.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, if the\nHouse has the total membership of 250, at least 25 members must be present for\nthe House to proceed with its business.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If at any time during a\nmeeting of a House there is no quorum, the Chairman has to either adjourn the\nHouse or suspend it until there is a quorum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maximum strength of\nthe House allotted by the Constitution of India is 552. Currently the house has\n545 seats which is made up by election of up to 543 elected members and at a\nmaximum, 2 nominated members of the Anglo-Indian Community by the President of\nIndia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Why do we still treat Anglo Indians as\nprotected penguin? Almost all Anglo Indians are products of rape between a\nWHITE MALE and an INDIAN FEMALE ( poor section ) .&nbsp; A lot of them are children of Devadasis &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Most of them ( &nbsp;ugly ) have NO loyalty to the watan. A total\nof 131 seats (24.03%) are reserved for representatives of Scheduled Castes &nbsp;and Scheduled Tribes. The quorum for the House\nis 10% of the total membership<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A MP can &nbsp;disqualified if he is violating party\ndiscipline (as per Tenth schedule of the constitution); disqualified under\nRepresentation of People Act.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8452614125890165625\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_100M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/03/treason-from-within-biggest-cut-on.html?showComment=1521173247226#c8452614125890165625\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 16, 2018 at 9:37 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_100MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/kleptocracy-in-india-lobbying-pimping.html</span><br />\n<br />\nThe political funding law prevented DESH DROHI foreign companies from giving money to political parties.<br />\n<br />\nVERY SOON WE WILL HAVE ISRAEL, CHINA AND PAKISTAN FUNDING INDIAN POLITICAL PARTIES.<br />\n<br />\nThe Finance Bill is normally allotted four hours of discussion-- it passed in 19 minutes.<br />\n<br />\nThey legalised corruption in politics from 1976 onwards and not a single question was asked. Why would you need to backdate a law to 1976 unless you did something in the last 42 years that you no longer want to be brought up in court?<br />\n<br />\nThe FCRA was passed in 2010 but the Centre has amended it with retrospective effect so that the Act will now be applicable from much before the original FCRA came into existence-this is FRAUD which is punishable<br />\n<br />\nEntry number 217 in Part XIX of the amendments in the 2018 finance Bill (Amendment to the Finance Act, 2016), which reads : \u201cIn the Finance Act, 2016, in section 236, in the opening paragraph, for the words, figures and letters \u2018the 26thSeptember, 2010, the words, figures and letters \u2018the 5th August, 1976\u2019 shall be substituted<br />\n<br />\nPrior to the latest change, foreign funds received by a political party before September 26, 2010, when the FCRA was enacted, were open to scrutiny. With the latest amendment, the Government has, in effect, ensured that funds received by political parties since 1976 cannot be scrutinised.<br />\n<br />\n1976 was the year white JEWS flooded money in India to bring down Indira Gandhi and bring back Rothschild\u2019s private banks<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe Representation of People\u2019s Act, which lays down the rules for elections, bars political parties from accepting foreign funds. But the 2016 amendments in the FCRA made it easier for parties to accept foreign funds. The 2018 amendment completely does away with the scope for scrutiny of a political party\u2019s funding for the last 42 years.<br />\n<br />\nThe Delhi High Court had in 2014 indicted the two national parties, the Congress and the BJP, for receiving foreign funds in violation of the provisions of the FCRA.<br />\n<br />\nThe Narendra Modi government effectively made corporate funding of political parties more opaque, contrary to its promise of bringing in more transparency.<br />\n<br />\nIt did so with two key changes in the law: First, it has scrapped a ceiling that earlier restricted a corporate entity from donating more than 7.5 percent of its average net profit in the 3 immediate preceding fiscal years to a political party.<br />\n<br />\nAnd second, the government proposed to cancel an existing rule that required corporate entities to disclose, in the profit and loss account, the name of the political party to which the funding is made. Both made it easier for political parties to make their election funding more opaque.<br />\n<br />\nThis means, for example, that an infrastructure firm could theoretically pay up to 50 percent of its net profits to a single party as donation without anyone getting wiser as to which party has been paid... this throws open the possibility that an order to build a highway or a railway bridge could be given to a firm and that firm could pay the donation to the party in power which placed the order with it. The beauty is that if this happens, it will be legitimate and no questions can be asked by any ethics committee of Parliament or by any CAG audit<br />\n<br />\nWe have a situation, where the manner in which corporate donations, both from India and abroad, reach political parties getting more and more opaque, thus effectively helping the infamous corporate-political nexus. A company can secretly offer donations to a political party in power and expect favours in return.<br />\n<br />\nWith the latest amendment even DESH DROHI foreign parties can safely join the nexus.<br />\n<br />\nWE ALL KNOW SOME POLITICIANS WHO WORE SIKH TURBAN, FALSE BEARDS AND DARK GLASSES DURING 1976 IN INDIA --AND WERE FOUND IN USA AND ISRAEL , FOR WHAT ?.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vaadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6418919221625836845\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_102M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. BUT IT IS NOT ABSOLUTE\u2026 NATIONAL INTERESTS OR LEGITIMATE INVESTIGATIONS CANNOT BE SCUTTLED<br />\n<br />\nRight to privacy has limitations that need to be identified on case-to-case basis-based on CONTEXT\u2026<br />\n<br />\nNothing is above national security and Dharma\u2026 Above the \u201cconstitution\u201d lies WE THE PEOPLE\u2026 Above \u201cwe the people\u201d lies the WATAN\u2026 Above the \u201cwatan\u201d lies DHARMA \u2026.<br />\n<br />\nIS PRIVACY LAWS HELPING MILLIONS OF POOR INDIANS WHO WORRY WHERE THEIR NEXT MEAL WILL COME FROM....<br />\n<br />\nWE WILL NOT ALLOW THE TV PERCEPTION MOLDERS SOLIs AND FALIs TO RULE INDIA\u2026 WE KNOW WHY JEW ROTHSCHILD KNIGHTED 64 ARSIS BEFORE 1947\u2026<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT WANT TO PROVIDE ANY PRIVACY TO THE FOREIGN FUNDED ENEMIES OF THE WATAN AND CRIMINALS WHO TRY TO SINK RULE OF DHARMA..<br />\n<br />\nNo right is absolute.. There are duties attached to it\u2026 Any society with laws can only allow privacy subject to conditions\u2026<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">DHARMA CANNOT PREVAIL WHEN THERE IS ABSOLUTE PRIVACY...</span><br />\n<br />\nPrivacy for what?.. How many of you would like to board a plane where its bags are not checked ? .. Why have an alcometer test for the pilot ?.. Can a Muslim woman refuse to show her face at any airport under her right to privacy ?..<br />\n<br />\nA level headed balance needs to be maintained between the right to privacy and the right of the state to impose reasonable restrictions on it for legitimate aims such as national security, prevention and investigation of crimes and distribution of welfare resources\u2026<br />\n<br />\nLet this balance be provided by the ELECTED LAW MAKERS. .. In the name of privacy all MAJOR crimes are committed in India and even the court lets them off for want of evidence..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">JUDGES HAVE NO RIGHT UNDER THE CONSTITUTION TO CREATE LAWS AND AS SUCH EVERY LAW MADE BY JUDICIARY SINCE INDEPENDENCE IS AUTOMATICALLY NULL AND VOID \u2013 UNLESS ENDORSED BY THE ELECTED LEGISLATURE . .. ..</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIn the constitutions of almost ALL developed democracies, the word \u201ccitizen\u201d appears late in the text, never in the first paragraph. .</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nWe Indians are like cats who fell in HOT water (slavery ) and we are circumspect with COLD water today.. The major exception to this is the Indian Constitution... Here, unlike all others, the term \u201ccitizen\u201d makes its appearance right there in the first sentence, that is, in the Preamble itself\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe lawmakers MUST make constitutional amendments to Part III of the constitution- to PRESERVE THE INTEGRITY OF THE WATAN AND TO PRESERVE DHARMA\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nEveryone has the right to life, liberty \u2013and security ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTO PROVIDE THIS SECURITY ( TO PEOPLE AND THE WATAN ) THE ELECTED EXECUTIVE WILL DO ITS DUTIES AS DEEMED FIT- THEY DONT NEED ADVISE FROM COLLEGIUM JUDGES..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nWE THE PEOPLE WHO ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION , DON\u2019T CARE FOR PAST JUDGEMENT MADE BY COLLEGIUM MELORDS. .. .. ALL THESE MINDLESS JUDGEMENTS DEVOID OF NATURAL JUSTICE AND CONTEXT ARE FIT ONLY TO BE BURNT. ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nANY JUDGEMENT WHICH HURTS THE WATAN AND GOOD CITIZENS IS NULL AND VOID. .</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nHey collegium Melords\u2014have you applied Article 21 to UNDERTRIALS rotting in jail without trial for decades?... The right to life and liberty guaranteed by Article 21 of the constitution, which is inseparable from the right to live with dignity\u2026 Article 21 prohibits the deprivation of the above rights EXCEPT ACCORDING TO A PROCEDURE ESTABLISHED BY LAW. ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nHey collegium Melords\u2014have you applied Article 21 to UNTERTRIALS rotting in jail without trial for decades?...</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">WITHOUT AADHAR AND DIGITALISATION ( TO FACTOR IN FAMILY BASED COTTAGE INDUSTRIES IN GDP ) INDIA CANNOT BECOME THE PLANET NO 1 SUPERPOWER IN 15 YEARS</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n\u201cWE THE PEOPLE\u201d WHO ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION WARN THE JUDICIARY\u2014 DO NOT PUT ROAD BLOCKS IN FRONT OF PM MODI WHO IS TRYING TO TAKE INDIA FORWARD . ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe absolute right to privacy is non-existent in today\u2019s modern world... It does NOT exist anywhere on this planet- I can say this after travelling this planet for 4 decades \u2026I am NOT a frog in the well like our Collegium Melords..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">Privacy was not explicitly mentioned in the Constitution ..</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe people of India have no absolute right to claim it. .. If this has to be explicit, it must be done by the ELECTED LAW MAKERS and not the UNCONSTITUTIONAL COLLEGIUM LAW INTERPRETERS.. .</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe inclusion or exclusion of fundamental rights is only the proviso of Parliament\u2026 Here, the judiciary is taking over the functions of Parliament. Hey, let them do it - but WE THE PEOPLE declare it NULL AND VOID..\u2026.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIn this internet age we all can read and interpret the constitution\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nBY ASKING THAT TRUTH BE HIDDEN, ARE THESE MELORDS PROTECTING BHARATMATA ?..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHE INDIAN CONSTITUTION DOES NOT PROTECT ANY DESH DROHI \u2013ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO POINT A FOREIGN GUN AT BHARATMATA..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nWe will not allow , the right to privacy to hide the naked truth. .. Good people who have nothing to hide do not need a veil of privacy..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">JUDGES CAN ONLY JUDGE FOR A SPECIFIC CASE\u2026 WE THE PEOPLE WILL NOT ALLOW JUDGES TO CREATE PATHETIC RULINGS WHICH WILL BE USED AS A LIFE LONG GOSPEL- WITHOUT UNDERSTANDING THE CONTEXT..</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nJUDGES DID NOT FIND ANYTHING WRONG WHEN 5.1 LAKHS KASHMIRI PANDITS WERE ETHNICALLY CLEANSED AND SUBJECTED TO GENOCIDE\u2026 THOUSANDS OF HINDU TEMPLES WERE RAZED DOWN IN KASHMIR. ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nBUT HEY, THESE MELORDS JUMPED LIKE DEMENTED ORANGUTANS WHEN A BABRI MAJID ( MECCA OF HINDUS ) WAS RAZED DOWN..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">HULLO PM MODI, THE CONSTITUTION IS A DYNAMIC DOCUMENT. .. font-size: medium;\">The Constitution''s provisions have consciously been worded in generalities, though not in vague terms, instead of making them rigid and static with a fixed meaning or content as in an ordinary statute, so that they may be interpreted by coming generations of citizens with the ONWARD MARCH OF TIME, to apply to NEW AND EVER CHANGING AND DEMANDING SITUATIONS, making the Constitution a living and an organic document\u2026</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nRigidity tends to check progressive legislation or gradual innovation\u2026 ONLY A FLEXIBLE DYNAMIC CONSTITUTION CAN SURVIVE THE TEST OF TIME.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIN 1947 WHO WOULD EVEN IMAGINE OF DIGITIZATION OF INDIAN ECONOMY AND OF SOMETHING CALLED GST \u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nRIGHT TO LIFE as guaranteed under Article 21, has by interpretation been expanded to progressively mean a whole lot of human rights..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">A constitution is not a parchment of paper, it is a way of life and has to be lived up to\u2026 Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty and in the final analysis, its only keepers are WE THE PEOPLE\u2026.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHE CONSTITUTION BECOMES NULL AND VOID IF IT ACTS AGAINST THE WATAN.. THE CONSTITUTION BECOMES NULL AND VOID IF IT GOES AGAINST THE PRINCIPLE OF DHARMA ( NATURAL JUSTICE ).... ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe framers of our Constitution and WE THE PEOPLE did not intend the judiciary to be \u201csuperior\u201d to elected Parliament and the elected executive, but intended it to be the sentinel on the qui vive should the other two wings overstep the boundaries of their jurisdiction or omit to discharge their duty as public trustees\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHE COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY DO NOT HAVE THE CEREBRAL WHEREWITHAL TO APPLY BODMAS AND TO PRIORITISE SECTIONS OF THE CONSTITUTION....</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nCollegium Judiciary CANNOT exercise adjudicatory power, without any CHECKS AND BALANCES \u2026 This would be destructive of the basic feature of democracy, and if not forthwith remedied, would dilute the very essence of a democratic form of governance\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe ILLEGAL COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY has never ever been accountable in the manner that the elected executive is accountable.. These Melords keep pointing fingers without any sense of accountability.. It is a constitutional imperative that an authority must be accountable if it wields power..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe Collegium judiciary has developed the mindset that it is above the law...</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: medium;\"><b>WITH JEW ROTHSCHILD GETTING SO MUCH OF PRIVACY ---THAT IT TOOK A BLOGGER NAMED CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL TO REVEAL THAT ROTHSCHILD RULED INDIA, NOT THE KING, QUEEN OR THE BRITISH PARLIAMENT....</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHE CONSTITUTION IS NOT SUPREME ... ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION LIES .. 1) WE THE PEOPLE..\u2026 2) WATAN ( BHARATMATA )..\u2026 3) DHARMA ( NATURAL JUSTICE )\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nCOLLEGIUM ( ROGUE BODY NOT ALLOWED BY THE CONSTITUTION ) SUPREME COURT WHICH IS UNACCOUNTABLE TO THE PEOPLE CAN ONLY REACH UPTO THE CONSTITUTION-- ..THESE JUDGES CANNOT REACH HIGHER THAN THIS LEVEL, COME WHAT MAY\u2026</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nELECTED EXECUTIVE HAS THE POWERS / RESPONSIBILITY TO LISTEN TO THE VOICE OF THE PEOPLE ( JUDGES CANNOT ) IN A DEMOCRACY..&nbsp;&nbsp;</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/10/avram-noam-chomsky-karl-marx-of-new.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/08/right-to-privacy-in-india-is-not.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\ncapt ajit vadakayil</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n..</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_128b+seedbvlD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; IMPORTANT....&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_22MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_22MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">WARNING....&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_22MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_22MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">KHABARDAARRR.....</span><br />\n<br />\n############################################<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">AT SEA WHEN I HAD TO GLEAN A CRITICAL LAW -- I ASKED MY WIFE TO EXPLAIN IT IN PLAIN ENGLISH .. GO OR NO GO ?...<br /><br />BECAUSE SHE HAS NO PRECONCEIVED NOTIONS -- WHILE I HAVE DUE TO MY PAST EXPERIENCE ... THE WRITTEN LAW IS AN IDIOT..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nTHIS COMMENT IS PACKED WITH WISDOM<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE DONE IT EVERYTIME AND WON-- SHOT DOWN PAST PRACTICES CONVERTED TO GOSPE OVER TIME...<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">THE WRITTEN LAW IS AN ASS..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY WHEN INDIA GOES TO WTO NAIROBI--I HAD TOLD NIRMALA SITARAMAN -- GLEAN WELL BEFORE YOU SIGN..<br />\n<br />\nA SIMPLE CHANGE OF WORD FROM&nbsp;<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\"><b>SHALL</b></span>&nbsp;TO&nbsp;<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\"><b>SHOULD</b></span>&nbsp;IN THE TEXT ( CHICANERY ) CAN KILL BHARATMATA...</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS IS WHY NO AGREEMENT MUST BE SIGNED WITHOUT A \"</span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">PARAMOUNT CLAUSE</span></b><span style=\"color: purple;\">-- IF THIS SIGNED AGREEMENT IMPINGES ON INDIAs SOVEREIGNTY -IT SHALL BE NULL AND VOID \"</span></span></div>\n<br />\nEXAMPLE --MOST CRITICAL--<br />\n<br />\n\u201cDeveloped country Parties SHALL continue taking the lead by undertaking economy-wide absolute emission reduction targets. Developing country Parties SHOULD continue enhancing their mitigation efforts\u2026\u201d<br />\n<br />\nIn earlier versions of the agreement, the word SHALL in the first sentence had been SHOULD.<br />\n<br />\nThe change from should to shall introduced new but HUMONGOUS legal and financial requirements.<br />\n<br />\nParis climate deal. Article 4.4 stated: \"Developing country Parties SHOULD continue enhancing their mitigation efforts\u2026\u201d<br />\n<br />\nIn other words, the goal of developing countries is to continue improving their efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.<br />\n<br />\nThe word should does not express a legal requirement. But shall, in the case of the climate agreement, does.<br />\n<br />\nArticle 4.4 of the Paris climate deal stated that developed countries \u201cshall continue taking the lead by undertaking economy-wide absolute emission reduction targets.\u201d<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">JOHN KERRY HELD UP THE AGREEMENT TILL THE CHANGE WAS DONE \"</span><span style=\"color: red;\">SHALL</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">\" TO \"</span><span style=\"color: red;\">SHOULD</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\nFrench leaders told John Kerry that someone must have made a typing mistake.<br />\n<br />\nHours later, delegates from 195 countries were ARM TWISTED into signing the climate deal.<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">THIS IS ONE OF THE MOST POTENT SENTENCES I HAVE WRITTEN IN MY BLOG TILL TODAY</span><br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF 0F--<br />\nPRAKASH JAVEDEKAR<br />\nNIRMALA SITARAMAN<br />\nLAW MINISTRY<br />\nCJI<br />\nLAW MINISTER<br />\nCOMMERCE MINISTER<br />\nENVIRNMONENT MINISTRY<br />\nSPEAKER LOK SABHA<br />\nSPEAKER RAJYA SABHA<br />\nVENKAIH NAIDU<br />\nPM MODI<br />\nATTORNEY GENERAL<br />\nSUPREME COURT BAR COUNCIL.<br />\nARUN JAITLEY<br />\nSMRITI IRANI<br />\nSUSHMA SWARAJ<br />\nSWAMY<br />\nGURUMURTHY<br />\n<br />\nDO IT NOW !</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_10.html?showComment=1526060471074#c2685797842938331508\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 11, 2018 at 11:11 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-collegium-agrees-in-principle-to-reitereate-justice-josephs-name-for-elevation-to-top-court/articleshow/64123835.cms<br />\n<br />\nTHE ACCOUNTABLE ELECTED EXECUTIVE CAN REJECT JUDGE KM JOSEPHs ELEVATION TO SUPREME COURT --WITHOUT ASSIGNING REASONS..<br />\n<br />\nONCE KM JOSEPHs NAME IS REJECTED--IT IS FINAL.. THERE IS NO NEED FOR THE ELECTED EXECUTIVE TO GIVE REASON--ESPECIALLY IF IT IS TO BE PUBLISHED IN THE MEDIA..<br />\n<br />\nIF UNACCOUNTABLE ( TO WE THE PEOPLE ) SUPREME COURT COLLEGIUM SENDS BACK THE SAME NAME AGAIN -- IT IS INDISCIPLINE ..<br />\n<br />\nAND NOW IT IS THE PLEASURE OF THE ELECTED EXECUTIVE TO PUNISH ( LOSS OF PROMOTION - LOSS OF SALARY RISE ) THE RECALCITRANT JUDGES...<br />\n<br />\nDO NOT REDUCE THE SANCTITY OF THE JUDICIAL SYSTEM...<br />\n<br />\nIN THE FIRST PLACE-- OUR CONSTITUTION DOES NOT ALLOW A COLLEGIUM SYSTEM..INDIA IS THE ONLY NATION ON THIS PLANET WHERE JUDGES ELECT JUDGES..<br />\n<br />\nWHO ARE THESE JUDGES ?<br />\n<br />\nARE THEY SOME GOLDEN KNIGHTS ?<br />\n<br />\nSORRY--THESE ARE BOTTOM OF THE SCHOOL CEREBRAL BARREL LAWYERS .. OUT OF THE POOL OF LAWYERS THE LOSER FOOT SLOGGING LAWYERS BECAME JUDGES TO COCK A NOOK AT THEIR SUCCESSFUL RICH LAWYER COLLEAGUES ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE EX-CJI KG BALAKRISHNAN WAS NOT EVEN QUALIFIED TO BE SUPREME COURT JUDGE--LEAVE ALONE CJI... HE WAS A CHRISTIAN MASQUERADING AS A DALIT HINDU...HIS FATHER WAS A CHRISTIAN.<br />\n<br />\nThe Constitution confers the power of appointment of judges on the President of India i.e. the Government of India to be made in consultation with the Chief Justice of India and other judges of the Supreme Court. How then did a collegium of judges of the Supreme Court come to exist and come to possess this UNIQUE power?<br />\n<br />\nThe Supreme Court rewrote the provisions of the Constitution for appointment of judges and appropriated the power to appoint judges by the judges-- when this is amazing Judicial over reach .<br />\n<br />\nThe collegium method was created as a result of two judgments of the Supreme Court, first in 1993 (Supreme Court Advocate-on-Record Association case) and by a follow-up President\u2019s Reference to the Court in 1998<br />\n<br />\nBy the first case the power was vested in the Chief Justice of India in whom it was held the primacy lay in appointments assisted by two judges of the Supreme Court. In the second case the court took away the primacy of the Chief Justice of India and vested the power in a collegium of the Chief Justice of India and four senior-most judges of the Supreme Court.<br />\n<br />\nThe clear intention of the Constitution makers in the Constituent Assembly debates of not making the Chief Justice of India the final authority was disregarded.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">Inversing the constitutional provisions, the Chief Justice of India and the collegium became the initiator and appointer of judges, and the President of India was illegally and unconstiutionally REDUCED to be a NAPUNSAK formal approver in the process. Foreign forces were involved in this humongous subversion..</span></div>\n<br />\n.Indeed, in the second judgment of 1998 the Court went to the extent of extracting a statement from the government that it was not seeking a reconsideration of its earlier judgment of 1993, and DEEP STATE controlled government would also accept and binding the judgment it was delivering.<br />\n<br />\nThe essential features of this judicially created system of appointments is that the collegium selects judges on their own assessment of the merits of a person and the government is bound to appoint the selected person except in a rare case of the collegium having overlooked some aspect of the incumbent not being a suitable judge.<br />\n<br />\nBUT HEY-- LO AND BEHOLD - THE ELECTED EXECUTIVEs VIEW CAN BE KICKED INTO THE DUSTBIN BY THE COLLEGIUM MELORDS AND THEY COULD RESSERT THEIR CHOICE ( AS IS HAPPENING WITH KM JOSEPH NOW )<br />\n<br />\nThe executive has thus ZILCH role in the appointment of judges as a result.<br />\n<br />\nOUR CONSTITUTION DOES NOT ALLOW COLLEGIUM JUDGES TO PLAY GOD.<br />\n<br />\nIt is EASY to comprehend that there is FOREIGN HAND in the new hijacked system of kicking the Constitution\u2019s prescription.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_181BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; THIS IS THE PREROGATIVE OF THE LEGISTLATURE. JUDICIARY CAN ONLY INTERPET LAWS--AND THAT TOO WHEN ASKED FOR IT ( NOT BY VESTED PIL )..</span></div>\n<br />\nIn prescribing the appointment to judges of the Supreme Court and the High Courts by the collegium, the Supreme Court did not realise the burden it was imposing on the collegium of selecting judges for the Supreme Court and High Courts and transferring them from one High Court to another.<br />\n<br />\nAt any given time there are two to three vacancies in the Supreme Court, and 200 in the 22 High Courts and the transfer of a number of judges to be made. An administrative task of this magnitude must necessarily detract the judges of the collegium from their principal judicial work of hearing and deciding cases.<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The collegium neither has a secretariat to shoulder this burden nor an INTELLIGENCE BUREAU to make appropriate inquiries of the competence, character,&nbsp;</span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">loyalty to the watan</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">, and integrity of a proposed appointee.</span></span></div>\n<br />\nBEFORE 1947 ALMOST ALL SUPREME COURT JUDGES WERE IN THE PAYROLL OF JEW ROTHSCHILD..<br />\n<br />\nLacking this infrastructural backup the collegium resorts to ad hoc informal consultations with other judges in the Supreme Court who are expected to know the merits of a proposed appointee from a High Court or occasionally by sounding a member of the Bar.<br />\n<br />\nThese methods are poor substitutes for a full time intensive collection of data about an incumbent, his loyalty to the watan, his work, standing, merit, integrity and potential which requires to be made considerably in advance for filing in the vacancy.<br />\n<br />\nBesides, the collegium\u2019s deliberations are secret, the system is opaque and the choice of a judge is only known when his name is forwarded to the Government for formal appointment.<br />\n<br />\nIN THE RECENT PAST COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY SAVED SEVERAL TRAITORS WHO HAVE TRIED TO KILL BHARATMATA .<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">INDIA MUST DESTROY THE COLLEGIUM SYSTEM AND GO FOR NJAC..&nbsp; ONE STUP1D JUDGE HAD SLAPPED BOTH \"SEDITION\" AND \"CONTEMPT OF COURT \" ON ARUN JAITLEY FOR SAYING CONSTITUTION DOES NOT SUPPORT \"COLLEGIUM SYSTEM\" BUT ONLY NJAC&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\nThe advantage of judicial commissions are that they are independent, broad based and they represent not only the views of the judiciary but also of the executive and other sections of society.<br />\n<br />\nIN 1993 A 9 BENCH ( SECOND JUDGES CASE ) ILLEGALLY CONVERTED \"CONSULTATION\" TO \"CONCURRANCE \"..<br />\n<br />\nTHE 9 BENCH ( THIRD JUDGES CASE ) THE REDUCED THE POWERS OF THE CJI TO A MERE \"RECOMMENDER\".. IF THE PRESIDENT REJECTS THE RECOMMENDATION, THEN THE MELORDS WILL SENT IT BACK-- AND THEN THE PRESIDENT IS DUTY BOUND TO ACCEPT THE NAME ..<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>APPIDIYAAAA ?</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;
