font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You really have no idea\nof the glory of ancient Indian books.&nbsp;\nYou must understand that 7000 years ago, he whole world was running\naround naked , living in caves, clubbing down animals for raw meat and doing\nGRUNT GRUNT for language.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can download the\nMonier Monier Willaims Sanskrit dictionary on the internet\u2014 or you can see it\non line.&nbsp; This Sanskrit dictionary\ncompiled by an Englishman contains only 60% of the Sanskrit words.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet it is three times\nthe size of a modern English Dictionary which has lifted words from all major\nlanguages of the world\u2014 just to prove that stupid English is a great language.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Have you ever seen a\nridiculous Spelling Bee contest?&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can you give me the\ndefinition please , language of origin please , part of speech please ,\nalternate pronunciations please , word's usage in a sentence please, alternate\ndefinitions of the word please , does the word have a specified root please ,\ncan you fu#k yourslef please&nbsp; \u2013\nridiculous is NOT the word.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/old-alumni-meet-kendriya-vidyalaya-no-1.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/old-alumni-meet-kendriya-vidyalaya-no-1.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recentky I went for an\nold students meet at my school.&nbsp; I got a\nchance to sing my school prayer ( the Upanishads, the Brihadaranyaka ( 1.3.28 )\n) after 4 decades.&nbsp; Having matured , I\nwas struck by the greatness and the dharma of ths simple prayer written 7000\nyears ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Om sarve bhavantu\nsukhinah, sarve santu nir\u00e3-maya-ah;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sarve bhadrani\npashyantu m\u00e3-kaschit dukha-bhak bhavet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om, sh\u00e3ntih, sh\u00e3ntih,\nsh\u00e3ntih.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Oh Lord, may all\n[entire mankind] be happy; may all be healthy; may all experience prosperity;\nmay none (in the world) suffer. May peace, peace, peace be unto us and all the\nbeings of the world.\" Brihad\u00e3ranyaka Upanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Referring to the above\nprayer, Arthur Schopenhauer says, \"I know of no more beautiful prayer than\nthat of the Hindus...'May all that have life be delivered from suffering!'</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 4 Vedas along with\nthe 108 Upanishads are the most sacred books of India. Without knowing the\nVedas one cannot comprehend the inner soul and heights of Indian glory.&nbsp; Hindu religion is run by the laws of\nDharma.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the obligatory\nduties of the Hindu owe their allegiance to the Vedas.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They draw forth the\nthought of successive generations of Maharshi seers&nbsp; or spiritual giants from 9500 BC to 5000 BC.\nThe Vedas are considered to be eternal, without beginning and end as they\nrepresent the divine truth itself as perceived through the elevated\nconsciousness of our great ancient seers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are the only\ncomposition in the universe invested with Divine origin, and hence divine\nsanctity. They have been heirlooms of the Hindus from generation to generation\nfor the past 400 centuries<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are called\napauruseya grantha (authorless works) . Thinking with your heart; loving with\nyour mind.&nbsp; All yoga and meditation aim\nto attain this goal. And when the heart sees, it sees the unknowable, nameless,\nformless, limitless, supreme God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads are\nhumanity's most profound philosophical inquiry and the first perceptions of the\nunity of all, the oneness of man and God. The Upanishads are also called the\nVedanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna know how the\nimmoral West copied from India and patented knowledge in their names, showing\ntheir Adharma?&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">These Sanskrit /\nMalayalam &nbsp;astronomy terms below were written\ndown 7000 years ago.</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">THE BASTARD WHITE INVADER STOLE OUR KNOWLEDGE , PATENTED IT IN THEIR NAMES AND THEN CALLED US SAVAGES&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2Eg2pyoRUYU/Wqkg8uKU6-I/AAAAAAABZe0/T4o5iaEfdcQYD27ak655fM7a7eLNABJRQCLcBGAs/s1600/9781598698626333_0244_001.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"215\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"344\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2Eg2pyoRUYU/Wqkg8uKU6-I/AAAAAAABZe0/T4o5iaEfdcQYD27ak655fM7a7eLNABJRQCLcBGAs/s640/9781598698626333_0244_001.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu Smriti is one of\nthe foremost documents on Hindu dharma.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian\ninvader injected poison into this noble and graceful document, for immoral\npurposes of \u201cdivide and rule\u201d and conversions of disgruntled Hindu low\ncastes&nbsp; into Christianity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They injected\nfalsehoods that Manu wrote that Shudras&nbsp;\n( low caste dalits ) are made from the feet of god,&nbsp; while brahmins ( upper caste ) have been made\nfrom the head,&nbsp; the Kshatriyas ( warriors\n) from the arms and vaishyas ( skilled labour and traders ) from the thighs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Absolutely ridiculous\nthings were injected by the vulgar white man with the help of stooges like BR\nAmbedkar and EVR Periyar-- like\u2019\u201d If a shudra listens to the Vedas molten lead\nshould be poured into his ears \u201c .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Hey maan , why not\nmolten copper up his asshole. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Why this partiality to fuckin\u2019\nlead and ears ?&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Pray?&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Prithee ?</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\">Beats the shit out of me !!</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TEEE HEEEEE !!!<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/untouchables-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/untouchables-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-obJlpIgxKdI/Wqk43op4gbI/AAAAAAABZfs/jCLaCeWt2H4DE2ngAK9uURhfm6YaU__DwCLcBGAs/s1600/Hordinancesofmanu00manu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"298\" data-original-width=\"180\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-obJlpIgxKdI/Wqk43op4gbI/AAAAAAABZfs/jCLaCeWt2H4DE2ngAK9uURhfm6YaU__DwCLcBGAs/s640/Hordinancesofmanu00manu.jpg\" width=\"385\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ajyesthaaso\nAkanisthaasa Yete<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sam Bhraataro\nVaavrudhuh Soubhagaya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<b> RigVeda, Mandala-5, Sukta-60, Mantra-5-\n(5000 BC)<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018No one is superior or\ninferior; all are brothers; all should strive for the interest of all and\nprogress collectively\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manusmriti written by\nthe ancient sage Manu, prescribes 10 essential rules for the observance of\ndharma:&nbsp; Patience (dhriti), forgiveness\n(kshama), piety or self control (dama), honesty (asteya), sanctity (shauch),\ncontrol of senses (indraiya-nigrah), reason (dhi), knowledge or learning\n(vidya), truthfulness (satya) and absence of anger (krodha).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu further writes,\n\"Non-violence, truth, non-coveting, purity of body and mind, control of\nsenses are the essence of dharma\". Therefore dharmic laws govern not only\nthe individual but all in society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu further writes,\n\"Nonviolence, truth, non-coveting, purity of body and mind, control of senses\nare the essence of Dharma\".&nbsp; Dharma\nthus is a code of conduct that is intended to secure both worldly joys and\nsupreme happiness.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 18.6667px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">BALLS TO LYING COMMIE JNU PROFESSOR NIVEDITA barren MENON</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4ZFCMTSbsRo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4ZFCMTSbsRo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To act dharmically is,\nin essence, to act appropriately; what is appropriate is determined by the\ncontext in which the action is to be performed and who is performing it. A\nShudra is NOT expected to sacrifice his life when the country is in danger. He\nis NOT exptec to do skilled labour or brainwork he is incapable of. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nobody is a Shudra by\nbirth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If on my ship, my steward\nwho could NOT pass his school exams want the same salary as I the Captain, he\nwants family carrying facility, he wants same comforts and space in his cabin\n\u2013it is just wishful thinking. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">KUMAAARI Mayawati\ncannot hope to snatch away the beauty contest crown from Aishwarya Rai, no\nmatter how hard she tries.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu cautions everyone\nto have self -control, so that his mind does not act as the instigator for\ncommitting any sinful mental action which would inevitably lead to one or the\nother type of evil verbal actions or wicked bodily actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A verse from\nManusmriti:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cSatyam\nBruyatPriyamBruyat\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ma Bruyat Satyam\nApriyam;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PriyamCaNanrutam,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BruyatEshaDharmahSanatanah;\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Translation: Speak\ntruth in such a way that it should be pleasing to others. Never speak truth\nwhich is unpleasant to others. Never speak truth which might be pleasant. This\nis the path of eternal morality, Sanatana Dharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning:&nbsp; The main point is speaking truth which in\none\u2019s dharma. Speaking such truth tactfully which benefits others and is\npleasant to listen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU XII 10-11 :- That\nman is called 'Tridandin' who has established three controls, on his mind viz.,\n(i) Manodanda -control over his thoughts, (ii) Vakdanda -control over his\nspeech and (iii) Kayadanda- control over his body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He who exercises these\nthree controls with respect to all created beings and wholly subdues desire and\nwrath, assuredly gains complete success in his life.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 18.6667px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">BALLS TO LYING COMMIE JNU PROFESSOR NIVEDITA barren MENON</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4ZFCMTSbsRo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4ZFCMTSbsRo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu calls upon man to\nuse his conscience . His verseneeds every individual to establish an internal\ncheck, which alone is the guarantee for good conduct or to eschew bad conduct\nand not the fear of state police,&nbsp; which\nonly makes a man to be more careful and secretive in committing offence. This\ninternal check is what is meant by \"God Fearing\" as Atma (Soul) is\nGod within the man.&nbsp; If man listens to\nhis conscience he will not commit the sin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu has gone into\nterrific detail.&nbsp; Few examples only&nbsp; \u2013 or it will run into hundreds of pages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU X-163 :-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asteya&nbsp; is the unterior motive or desire to secure\nwealth by illegitimate methods which makes a man corrupt, a cheat, a smuggler,\na black marketeer, an exploiter, and makes even men in noble professions\nexploit the miseries of others to make more and more money in utter disregard\nto professional ethics.&nbsp; Therefore, it is\nvery essential to ingrain in the heart and mind of every individual the desire\nnot to indulge in 'asteya' i.e., acquiring wealth by illegitimate and immoral\nmethods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shoucham : Manu\ncommands every individual to maintain purity of thought, word and deed\n(Trikarana shuddi i.e., Kaya, Vacha, Manasa), which is also called Antaranga\nShuddi (internal/mental purity) and Bahiranga Shuddi (external purity or purity\nin action). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This rule means\nabsolute honesty in that there should be harmony in thought, word and deed of\nan individual.&nbsp; One should not think\nsomething in the mind, speak something else, and do entirely another thing.&nbsp; Hypocrisy is addressed here , which is so\nabundant in the west.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indriyanigraha:&nbsp; Manu wants every individual to have of\ncontrol over his senses. Failing which the man&nbsp;\nwill indulge in all types&nbsp; of\nillegal and immoral actions, being instigated by the one or more of the six\ninherent enemies (Arishadvargas).&nbsp; This\nlands himself as well as others in misery and loss of happiness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mere knowledge of\nthe rules of Dharma, however does not make a man 'Dharmishta' i.e., a man\nacting always in conformity with Dharma. Therefore, Dharma has to be ingrained\nin the mind of every individual from child hood.&nbsp; It is a slow but a sure process. This process\nwas called 'Samskara'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANUVI11-15:- Dharma\nprotects those who protect it. Those who destroy Dharma get destroyed.\nTherefore, Dharma should not be destroyed so that we may not be destroyed as a\nconsequence thereof.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU-IX-3 :-The father\nprotects the girl in her childhood, the husband protects her after marriage and\nher sons protect her in old age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU II-145 :- The\nacharya is more venerable than a Upadhyaya (teacher).&nbsp; Father is more venerable than an acharya. But\nthe mother is more venerable than the father.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU III-51-52 :-No\nfather who knows (the law) must take even the smallest gratuity for his\ndaughter; for a man who, through avarice, takes a gratuity, is a seller of his\noffspring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANU Ch.IV-176: Discard\nwealth (artha) or desire (kama) if it is contrary to Dharma as also any custom\nor rules regarded as source of Dharma if at any time they were to lead to\nunhappiness or arouse people's indignation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manu\u2019s concept of\ngratitude (Kritajnata)&nbsp; included custom\nof worshipping animals, and plants as also Ayudha Pooja, i.e., worshipping one\nday in year all the implements or instruments through which we earn our lively\nhood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/ayudha-puja-9th-day-of-navratri.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/ayudha-puja-9th-day-of-navratri.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">JNU STUDENTS MUST KNOW THIS --</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THE BOOK ON MANU PROVIDED BY YOUR DESH DROHI PROFESSORS LIKE ROMILA THAPAR AND NIVEDITA MENON IS TOTALLY POISON INJECTED .&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MFxucwNq40U/WqkiXNH_ogI/AAAAAAABZfA/VfGStJmwqYchPQWRxFm0Q3xifeECGZdAQCLcBGAs/s1600/5328344417_251063851705157_1040351673_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
